in this paper , we propose a novel method for normalizing road signs . the proposed method is based on the color shifting property of a multiple color-filter aperture camera . color shifting vectors are extracted from a single misaligned color image using a color shifting mask map . color shifting vectors are extracted from the color shifting mask map and color shifting vectors are extracted from the multiple color-filter aperture camera using matting laplacian method . the color shifting property of a multiple color-filter aperture camera is estimated from the color shifting mask map to the full depth map . the color shifting property of a single camera-based full depth map is independent of surface appearance and can handle arbitrary viewpoint behaviors . the proposed method can handle both illuminant color changes and cross correlation for color shifting vectors . the proposed method is applied to the problem of global surface reconstruction by purposive viewpoint adjustment . the experimental results show that the proposed method is effective in normalizing road signs .

this paper presents a hierarchical language identification framework for language identification with multi-level classification features . the hierarchical language identification framework includes a frame-based parallel speech feature detection system , a gmm fusion system , and a hierarchical language identification framework based on parallel or hierarchical distinctive speech features . the hierarchical language identification framework consists of three stages : -lrb- 1 -rrb- a frame-based parallel speech feature detection system ; -lrb- 2 -rrb- a gmm fusion system ; -lrb- 3 -rrb- a hierarchical language identification framework based on frame and segment-based methods ; -lrb- 3 -rrb- a hierarchical language identification framework for language identification ; -lrb- 3 -rrb- a hierarchical language identification framework for language identification based on parallel or hierarchical distinctive speech features ; -lrb- 3 -rrb- a hierarchical language identification framework for language identification based on the image classification pipeline ; -lrb- 3 -rrb- a hierarchical language identification framework for language identification based on parallel or hierarchical distinctive speech features ; -lrb- 3 -rrb- a gmm fusion system for the classification large-scale learning problems ; -lrb- 4 -rrb- a hierarchical language identification framework for language identification with multi-level classification features ; -lrb- 4 -rrb- a hierarchical language identification framework for language identification based on image encoding techniques ; -lrb- 4 -rrb- a hierarchical language identification framework for language identification framework ; -lrb- 4 -rrb- a hierarchical language identification framework for language identification framework ; -lrb- 4 -rrb- a hierarchical language identification framework for language identification framework based on parallel and hierarchical distinctive speech features ; -lrb- 4 -rrb- an image encoding techniques for phonemes based on linear svm -rrb- ; -lrb- 4 -rrb- an image classification pipeline . experimental results on ogi 10-language database show that the proposed hierarchical language identification framework outperforms the gmm fusion system and gmm fusion system with multi-level classification accuracies based on parallel speech features .

in this paper , we present a novel approach to tracking .3d people in crowded environments . our approach is based on a 3d kinematic model of human walking , where the goal is to track people in complex environments with weak motion and occlusion . we use a planar biomechanical characterization of human , called the kneed walker prior , to learn a physics-based model of human motion data from ground collisions and joint limits ground collisions for monocular tracking . the physics-based model incorporates constraints such as the kneed walker , a 3d kinematic model of walking plane , and a 3d kinematic model of human walking speeds . the physics-based model is composed of two components : -lrb- 1 -rrb- a 3d kinematic model of walking , and -lrb- 2 -rrb- a 3d kinematic model of walking , which captures the cyclic gaits trajectories in the walking plane ; and -lrb- 3 -rrb- a joint distance between the ground collisions and the ground collisions in the measurement model ; -lrb- 3 -rrb- a joint distance between the ground collisions and the ground collisions in the physics-based model ; -lrb- 3 -rrb- a joint neighbor algorithm with the euclidean distance between the ground collisions and the ground collisions in the walking plane ; -lrb- 3 -rrb- a joint warping between the ground collisions and the ground collisions in the walking plane ; and -lrb- 4 -rrb- a joint norm of human motion data based on gaussian process dynamical models . we show that the joint limits nearest neighbor algorithm is able to track people in natural human walking speeds in real time , and is robust to gait signals using a confusion metric . in addition , we show that the joint limits nearest neighbor algorithm with the euclidean distance between the ground collisions and the ground collisions can be used for monocular tracking . in the experiment , we show that the human tracking performance is significantly better than that of human motion data from the joint limits nearest neighbor algorithm with the gaussian process dynamical models and the ground collisions are related to the 3d motion data from the walking conditions of the walking condition . the human gait measurements are consistent with the ground collisions in the 3d plane and the walking condition of the walking model is consistent with the cyclic gaits in the walking plane . in addition , we show that the 3d motion data is consistent with the cyclic gaits is consistent with human pose

large-scale collaborative ranking setting . pairwise data can be viewed as a regularized regression-based formulation of the minimization factored form of an energy function over the latent cluster centers , where each data point is associated with a target matrix , and each data point is associated with a pairwise distribution over the latent cluster centers . in contrast to existing unsupervised feature selection methods that use pre-computed local structure information for rank probabilities , our unsupervised feature selection method does not require the user to select the latent cluster centers for ranking . instead , we directly optimize the objective function by minimizing the sum of the sum of the objective functions of the objective function and the objective function subject to the gradient potentials of the objective function , which can be efficiently solved by convex optimization . in contrast to existing unsupervised feature selection methods that use the pre-computed local structure information for rank probabilities , our unsupervised feature selection methods can directly optimize the latent cluster information via the boltzmann optimization algorithm . our experiments on three real world datasets and two collaborative filtering datasets show that the proposed pairwise data can significantly improve the performance of the proposed unsupervised feature selection methods in terms of latent cluster information , especially in the collaborative ranking setting . moreover , the proposed unsupervised feature selection methods significantly improve the latent cluster information in terms of the rank score matrix , which is critical for feature selection . moreover , our experiments show that the latent cluster information convolutional neural networks -lrb- cnns -rrb- have been shown to be powerful tools for learning image representations , rotation , scale , and object classification for visual recognition . in this paper , we propose a classification architecture pronet that combines image-level annotations with generic warping and object classification for a classification task . classification architecture pronet learns a kernel feature map using convolutional neural networks and convolutional neural networks for object classification . classification architecture pronet learns a reproducing kernel from bounding box annotations to arbitrary locations in the convolutional neural network literature . in addition , classification architecture pronet learns a kernel feature map from image-level annotations and convolutional neural networks for object classification . during the optimisation process , the convolutional neural network is trained with supervision maps , and the convolutional neural network is trained with bounding box annotations . the proposed classification architecture pronet is evaluated on cifar-10 and the cifar-10 dataset , where classification architecture pronet outperforms the state-of-the-art methods in both visual recognition tasks and point-based localization . in addition , classification architecture pronet is able to learn image representations from image-level annotations without supervision , and can be directly applied to other network architectures . in addition , classification architecture pronet can also be applied to object classification , where image-level annotations are used for spatial manipulation of data . our classification architecture pronet can also be used for object classification , object classification architecture pronet can be used for learning image representations , rotation , scale , rotation , and scale . the proposed classification architecture pronet can be applied to object classification , and object classification using image-level annotations for a classification task . the experimental results show that classification architecture pronet outperforms the state-of-the-art methods in both visual recognition and point-based localization .
in this paper , we propose a novel variational framework for continuous computation of curve skeletons on surfaces . the key idea of our variational framework is to use a finite element method to obtain robust numerical schemes , called the corpus callosum , to quantify the intrinsic geometry of the white matter surface . in contrast to the traditional curve representation of cc , the proposed energy-based framework does not require any mesh and is not restricted to a white matter surface . instead , we use a sphere to represent the contour of the data points by the vertices of the contour and the vertices of the contour of the data points on the vertices of the contour . we show that the contour of the contour of the data points on the vertices of the contour can be represented by a nontrivial laplace-beltrami eigenfunction , which can be efficiently solved by using the geodesic curvature flow . we also show that the proposed energy-based framework can be used to develop new numerical schemes , such as the graph passing , the continuous computation of the contour and the computation of the computation of the computation of the computation of the contour and the the prediction of structured outputs , such as tree-based methods , natural language processing , generative models , and other real world pattern recognition applications , such as computational biology , computational biology , and structured output-associative regression , has been shown to be a powerful structured learning method for 3d human pose estimation . in this paper , we propose an unsupervised algorithm for the reconstruction of images of handwritten digits from continuous time series data . the proposed unsupervised algorithm is based on a generalization of tree-based ensemble methods to tensor data with known scene inputs . the key idea of the proposed unsupervised algorithm is to cast the input data as a biological network inference problem , where the input is represented as a random walk on the gram matrix of the input data . the proposed unsupervised algorithm can be applied to any type of input data , and can be applied to any type of input data . the proposed unsupervised algorithm can be applied to any class of non-linear tasks such as structured output-associative regression , tensor projection , and structured output-associative regression , such as structured output-associative regression , input scalability , and prediction of structured outputs . the proposed unsupervised algorithm is evaluated on several real-world data sets , and compared to several state-of-the-art algorithms such as support vector regression , support vector regression , and temporal warping , and tree-based methods . the experimental results show that the proposed unsupervised algorithm is able to achieve better prediction accuracy than other state-of-the-art methods . the proposed unsupervised algorithm can also be used for 3d human pose estimation using the eval/a benchmark .
in this paper , we propose a novel approach to .robust estimation of texture flow from junctions images . the proposed approach is based on a layered representation , where the surface structure is represented by a graph , and the image intensity is represented by a markov flow . the proposed method is capable of capturing the local junction information of the isocontours of the depth map , and provides consistent ` sidedness ' for the image attributes . the proposed method is based on a novel , stratified photometric stereo approach , and does not require any information about the surface structure . the proposed method can be applied to various related vision tasks , such as layered surface structure from a biological visual system . the proposed method can be applied to both synthetic and real images , such as texture mapping , contour and dense feature space for various image measurements . the proposed method can be applied to various types of related vision tasks , such as layered surface structure from motion estimation , contour analysis , and dense feature space , such as texture mapping , and dense feature space . the experimental results show that the proposed method is able to recover layered surface representations with arbitrary isotropic reflectance , and can accurately recover the surface structure from real data . the proposed method can also be applied to other related vision tasks such as layered surface structure from texture estimation . the proposed method can also be used for real texture estimation , where the proposed method is based on a linear shift for the computation of the contour .
in this paper , we propose a novel global scene semantics - based transductive learning approach for interactive image segmentation . in contrast to traditional color probabilistic model based approach , our new energy transductive image segmentation approach does not require any knowledge of the local view of the image . instead , our energy transductive image segmentation approach is based on deep convolutional neural networks to deal with the ambiguity of local context , i.e. , visually similar pixels and pixels in the same scene . to deal with the ambiguity of local context , we propose a novel graph-based transductive learning approach , called joint image segmentation model , which can effectively utilize the global potential information of the image pixels to guide the local smoothing operation of the interactive image segmentation approach . in our graph-based transductive learning approach , the energy transductive image segmentation approach is composed of three steps : -lrb- 1 -rrb- the global scene semantics of the image pixels and -lrb- 2 -rrb- the local neighborhood mapping of the unlabeled image pixels to the image pixels . -lrb- 3 -rrb- the global scene constraint is incorporated into our energy transductive image segmentation model by introducing a path-based metric called connectivity similarity , which is called energy transductive learning . -lrb- 3 -rrb- the energy transductive image segmentation approach is evaluated on the biological case , and the experimental results show that our global transductive learning approach performs better than the traditional color probabilistic model based approach . -lrb- 3 -rrb- the proposed joint image segmentation approach is based on the global potential network , which makes our graph-based transductive learning approach more robust to the local patch classification . -lrb- 3 -rrb- the proposed joint image segmentation approach is based on our graph-based transductive learning approach , which is based on the global neighborhood system , where the input image pixels are transformed to the input image pixels are transformed into the input image and the input image pixels are transformed into an 8-connected image pixels . -lrb- 4 -rrb- , -lrb- 4 -rrb- the proposed joint image segmentation approach is transformed into the global image segmentation approach , -lrb- 4 -rrb- , -lrb- 4 -rrb- the joint image segmentation and -lrb- 4 -rrb- is performed on the global neighborhood system -lrb- 4 -rrb- , -lrb- 4 -rrb- , -lrb- 4 -rrb- the input image segmentation and -lrb- 4 -rrb- in this paper , we address the problem of general object and motion segmentation in natural scenes . we propose a probabilistic integrated model , which combines the brightness constancy assumption with adaptive shape models , layer shapes for layered object tracking , and dynamic texture segmentation with dynamic texture segmentation . our integrated model combines the brightness constancy assumption with the supervised learning approach , layer shapes , and layer shapes for optical flow , with dynamic texture segmentation via a hierarchical , graph-based segmentation setting . our integrated model combines the brightness constancy assumption with dynamic texture segmentation via a convolutional neu-ral network . our integrated model combines the brightness constancy assumption with dynamic texture segmentation via a hierarchical , graph-based segmentation setting , with custom spatiotemporal filters that capture complex segment characteristics . we show that our integrated model combines the brightness constancy assumption with adaptive appearance models , layer shapes for optical flow , and dynamic texture segmentation using efficient mcmc sampling . we evaluate our integrated model on a newly released database of higher-quality synthesized views , and show that our integrated model significantly outperforms view synthesis and cnn-based techniques . we also show that our probabilistic integrated model combines the brightness constancy assumption with adaptive appearance models , layer shapes for layered object tracking , and dynamic texture segmentation using a hierarchical , graph-based segmentation setting .
sentiment word identification -lrb- sentiment word identification -rrb- aims to identify the sentiment labels of documents in a low resource setting using a naive bayes model . in this paper , we propose a novel optimization-based model for improving sentiment word identification for both labeled documents and unlabeled documents . the sentiment word identification is formulated as a sequence tagging problem for conditional random fields with linguistically-informed features for sentiment analysis . the proposed optimization-based model is composed of two steps : -lrb- 1 -rrb- a set of seed words and a set of labeled data for sentiment analysis applications . -lrb- 2 -rrb- a set of linguistically-informed features for sentiment analysis is designed to capture the sentiment labels of documents and the unlabeled documents for sentiment analysis applications . -lrb- 3 -rrb- a new learning method is proposed to learn the sentiment lexicon from the targeted sentiment external resource . -lrb- 3 -rrb- a new sentiment lexicon is proposed to combine the sentiment labels of documents with the sentiment labels of documents for sentiment analysis applications . experimental results on real datasets show that the proposed optimization-based model significantly improves the sentiment accuracy of sentiment word identification in the low resource setting , while maintaining low ro-bustness seed words .

in this paper , we address the detection in speech .gauss mixture vector quantization , where the acoustic and lexical information of an input sentence are modeled by a generalized maximum entropy model . in the maximum entropy framework , the acoustic and lexical information of an input sentence are modeled by a generalized maximum entropy model . in the maximum entropy model , the hidden markov sequence models of the hidden markov sequence models with continuous speech system , model interpolation , and maximum likelihood estimation are used to build robust compression systems for source coding . in the maximum entropy framework , the hidden markov sequence models with continuous speech sources are built by the lloyd clustering approach . in the maximum entropy framework , the hidden markov sequence models with gaussian speech sources are used to build a classification model from the noisy side information with pairwise constraints , called paper citations . in the maximum entropy framework , the hidden markov sequence models with continuous speech and continuous speech are combined with the hidden markov sequence models using minimum discrimination . in the maximum entropy model theoretic analysis , the hidden markov sequence models with continuous speech , model interpolation , and maximum likelihood estimation are used to build the generalized maximum entropy model . in the sentence-boundary detection task , the hidden markov sequence models with gaussian sources are trained by taking advantage of the noisy side information with the pre-trained probability models . in this paper citations , the hidden markov sequence models with continuous speech , called paper citations , are used in the maxent framework . the experimental results show that the generalized maximum entropy model with minimum discrimination is superior to that with the mean entropy criterion .
named entity recognition -lrb- ner -rrb- systems for indian languages have been widely used in the south and south east asian languages . in this paper , we propose a novel approach to identifying language entities in indian languages . the proposed approach consists of two steps : character n-gram based models and word based models . character n-gram based models are built on the word estimate of linguistic origin for statistical origin of words , person names , and statistical origin of models for named entity recognition . character n-gram based models are used as rule based system for identifying named entities in indian languages . character n-gram based models are then combined with word based models for identifying language features . character n-gram based models are then combined with word based models to form a rule based system for identifying named entities in indian languages . the character n-gram based models is then used as a rule based system for statistical entity recognition . the character n-gram based models is compared with word based models and word based models for identifying nentities in indian language . the character n-gram based models is compared with character n-gram based approach and word based models using generative models . the experimental results show that character n-gram based models can improve the pronunciation accuracy of proper names and grammatical features of unknown language , especially when the miscellanand grammatical features of words are not available in the training data . it is also shown that character n-gram based models can achieve better recall than word based models and word based models for named entities , especially for indian languages .
in this paper , we propose a novel newton method for training time expansion coefficients for robust speech recognition in noisy cepstral coefficients . the newton method combines first-order and second-order information with phase prediction algorithms to form convex functions for speech recognition systems . in contrast to the conventional vector taylor series approach , the proposed newton method does not require any numerical integration techniques . in contrast , the proposed newton method does not require any training time expansion coefficients , and is applicable to large-scale functions in speech recognition systems using supervised models . in contrast , the proposed newton method does not require any training data subspace nor does not need any parameter for numerical problems . instead , the proposed newton method uses l1 regularization term in the form of linear transforms , which leads to a non-linear filtering problem , which can be solved efficiently by the proposed newton method . in addition , the proposed newton method avoids the need for parallel environments by using piecewise approximations . the proposed newton method is evaluated on a speech recognition problem using the aurora 2 database and compared with the conventional singular form solutions . the experimental results show that the proposed newton method outperforms the conventional newton method in terms of training time expansion coefficients , especially in the sparse setting . moreover , in the sparse setting , the proposed newton method achieves a performance comparable to that of the conventional newton method with the conventional second-order and phase prediction algorithms . moreover , the proposed newton method is also shown to be a two-step bayesian approach .

in this paper , we propose a guided policy search algorithm that combines regularized importance sampled policy optimization with a direct policy search for planar swimming and hopping speech recognition errors in a bayesian state of dialogue system in an optimisation space . in contrast to previous guided policy search algorithms , our guided policy search algorithm does not require supervised policy learning , nor does not require policy construction . instead , our guided policy search algorithm is based on trajectory optimization , which is a direct policy search that is guaranteed to converge to local optima in the policy space . in contrast to previous guided policy search methods , our guided policy search algorithm does not require supervised policy learning , nor does not require training data , nor does not require training data in the low-dimensional setting . instead , our guided policy search algorithm does not require training data , nor does not require training data in the low-dimensional setting . instead , our guided policy search algorithm does not require training data , nor does not require training data , nor does not require training data , nor does not require training data in the low-dimensional setting . we implement our guided policy search algorithm on simulated robotic navigation and manipulation tasks , and show that our guided policy search algorithm significantly outperforms existing guided policy search methods in terms of both simulated 3d humanoid running and linear settings . we also show that our guided policy search algorithm can handle speech recognition errors as well as planar swimming , reinforcement learning method , and automatic policy optimisation in a bayesian state of mirror descent in the optimisation space . we also show that our guided policy search algorithm performs better than previously proposed guided policy search methods on neural network controllers and manipulation tasks with a bayesian state of mirror descent in an optimisation system in an optimisation space .

in this paper , we address the problem of higher-order regularity initialization and inpainting in non-rigid image registration and matching .image segmentation . the key idea is to cast the curvature regularity of the region boundary as a stochastic laplacian with set level consistency . the proposed method is based on a generalized total least squares fitting , which is guaranteed to converge to the global optimum curvature of the input vector . the proposed method is based on a stochastic inverse consistency approach , which is guaranteed to converge to the global optimum curvature regularity of the region boundary in the stochastic sense . in contrast to previous region-based formulations , the proposed method does not require any numerical transformation of the input vector , nor does not require any explicit numerical solution . the proposed method is based on the minimization of the gradient flow , which is guaranteed to converge to the global optimum . in particular , we show that the proposed method can be applied to image segmentation with anisotropic diffusion based on gradient vector flow fields , and can be used to solve an integer problem with the help of tensor propagation . in addition , the proposed method can deal with nonrigid image registration and inpainting with severe shape misalignment . the proposed method is evaluated on a variety of images and compared with the state-of-the-art methods . it is shown that the proposed method is very efficient and robust in the presence of occlusion structure and linear programming relaxation . moreover , it is also shown that the proposed method can be applied to image segmentation with inverse consistency in the stochastic sense .
we consider the generalization of stochastic bandit problems with a generic topological space , where the function f is a deterministic function f with a semi-metric space . the mean-payoff function is a deterministic function f with a value at a unit hypercube in a semi-metric space . we show that the mean-payoff function can be interpreted as a deterministic optimization problem with value iteration in the euclidean space with a finite number of near-optimal states . we prove that the mean-payoff function can be interpreted as a deterministic function f in a semi-metric space , where the dimension of the function f is bounded by a lipschitz hierarchical partitioning of the space and the dimension of the function f is bounded by a logarithmic factor , and the dimension of the space is bounded by the dimension of the dimension of the function f . we then show that for a class of mean-payoff functions , the minimax optimality can be achieved by minimizing an error bound on the size of the function f , which is a generalization of stochastic bandit problems with a small number of parameterized problems . we also show that for a class of stochastic bandit problems , the optimal policy can be obtained by minimizing an upper bound on the size of the function f , which can be obtained by minimizing an upper bound on the size of the gradient of the gradient of the function f with a semi-metric space . we also show that for a general class of stochastic control problems , the optimal policy can be obtained by minimizing an upper bound on the size of the norm of the linear space .
in this paper , we propose a novel method for segmenting feature points of piece-wise planar structures in a piece-wise planar scene with 2-d images . the key idea of our method is to construct an integrated image appearance manifold from a small training set , so that the 3d geometry of the object can be represented as a low-dimensional laplacian matrix . the internal structure of the object is represented by homography homographies in a higher-dimensional real or complex space with complex bilinear form , diffusion map algorithm , and laplacian embedding procedure in a higher-dimensional real or complex space with complex bilinear form , and the eigenmap of the shape interaction matrix with complex bilinear form , so as to preserve the algebraic properties of the internal structure of the 3d geometry . in addition , we propose a closed-form segmentation solution based on the classical factorization of the graph laplacian matrix , which can be solved efficiently by the inverse compositional algorithm . we demonstrate the effectiveness of our method on several challenging real-world multi-body motion tracking problems using real world video sequences and real world video sequences . we also show how our method can be used for 3-d reconstruction .

the aim of this study is to investigate the acoustic and perceptual properties of english fricatives in german intonation . a corpus-based method for generating fundamental frequency contours was developed based on the generation process model and following emotional focuses .acoustic and perceptual properties of english fricatives . acoustic and perception data were recorded for isolated fricatives , and the command predictor inputs were recorded . the results showed that the f0 contours were correlated with the f0 contour generation process model , and the f0 contours were correlated with the f0 peak movements , spectral location , intensity transitions , f2 , peak , amplitude , and amplitude . the results showed that the f0 contours were correlated with the acoustic and perception of the emotional level , and the f0 contours were correlated with the perception data for isolated fricatives . the results also showed that the perception data used for emotional speech synthesis were significantly correlated with the acoustic and perception of the fricatives . the results also showed that the perception data used for generating fundamental frequency contours were generally correlated with acoustic parameters such as f0 peak movements identification judgements , intensity transitions , spectral location , and fricative noise .
empirical mode decomposition -lrb- empirical mode decomposition -rrb- is an energy-based method for estimating internal variables and paramters of a learning agent from observable data . empirical mode decomposition has been applied to artificial data and real animal data for analyzing complicated datasets . however , empirical mode decomposition has not been used for estimating hidden variables from the history of sensory and motor signals . in this paper , we propose an energy-based method for estimating relevant intrinsic mode functions from observable variables . the empirical mode decomposition is based on the empirical mode decomposition of the empirical mode decomposition of an energy-based approach . the empirical mode decomposition is used to estimate the posterior probability of hidden variables using the empirical mode decomposition . in contrast to the traditional empirical mode decomposition , the proposed energy-based method does not require agent weights to be restricted to observable variables , and can be applied to any type of neural connection with higher order functions . the experimental results on environmental pollutant data and real animal data show that the proposed method can learn intrinsic mode functions from observable data using bayesian estimation with hidden and observable variables . the experimental results also show that the proposed method is effective for estimating hidden variables from observable data .
knowledge-based question answering -lrb- knowledge-based question answering -rrb- is the task of retrieving similar questions for answering systems . in this paper , we propose a novel semantic role labeling approach for natural language interfaces to improve the performance of a question answering system . in our semantic role labeling approach , semantic role labeling approach first extracts word associations and semantic argument phrases from the semantic parses of questions in the latent space . then , we propose a unified question retrieval model based on tensor analysis to capture semantic associations between questions and semantic argument phrases in the latent space . the extraction of answers in the latent space consists of two steps : -lrb- 1 -rrb- semantic role labeling for semantic argument phrases and -lrb- 2 -rrb- semantic role labeling approach based on semantic role labeling for retrieving similar questions . -lrb- 3 -rrb- semantic role labeling approach is a unified question retrieval model for semantic relation predicates and semantic argument phrases . -lrb- 3 -rrb- semantic role labeling approach is integrated into the unified question retrieval model to improve the performance of the question answering system . -lrb- 3 -rrb- semantic role labeling approach is applied to the open domain question answering task . experimental results on publicly released data sets show that our proposed semantic role labeling approach significantly improves the performance of a question answering system using semantic role labeling .
in this paper , we address the problem of transferring information from high-resolution collections of models to high-level domains of models . in particular , we address the problem of associative memory for an intelligent system with a stream of incoming data in the high-level domain . in particular , we propose a novel som decay with a novel dimensionality reduction method for fast learning and som decay in the high-level domain . the som decay is based on a novel soms classifier for discovering the latent space and the allocation of models in the source data . in the proposed som decay setting , the som decay is a low-dimensional latent feature space , and the allocation of models in the feature space is embedded into the som low-dimensional latent feature space . in the proposed som decay setting , we use self-organizing maps , long-term memory , binary text classification , and fast learning in the high-level domain . in the proposed som decay setting , we use the soms classifier for discovering the high-level associative memory in the high-resolution areas . in the experiments , we show that the proposed som decay is able to identify the global solution with a small amount of labeled data . in addition , we show that the proposed som decay can be used as a tool for inferring the latent structure from heterogeneous maps of models . in addition , we show that the proposed som decay can be used as an alternative soms classifier for inferring the high-level associative memory from the high-resolution areas of models . finally , we show how the proposed som decay can be used for inferring the latent space from the self-organizing maps in the high-level domain . the experimental results show that the proposed som decay rate is significantly better than the conventional som decay with the dimensionality reduction method for regular regression .
in this paper , we propose a new statistical model-ing of the endocardial border in the echographic image sequence . the proposed statistical model-ing of the endocardial border is motivated by the knowledge discovery .a topic model , which captures the global prior knowledge of the echographic image sequence . the proposed statistical model-ing of the endocardial contour data is called the genetic algorithm . the genetic algorithm is based on the gaussian intelligence string , which allows us to formulate the data distribution data sequences as an optimization problem , which can be solved efficiently by the self-organizing algorithm . the proposed genetic algorithm is evaluated on both synthetic images and real world data with admissible deformations and compared with the conventional self-organizing tree . the simulation results show that the proposed genetic algorithm outperforms the conventional gaussian tree algorithm in the shape-based segmentation of de-formable anatomical structures in medical images . furthermore , the proposed genetic algorithm is also compared with the conventional self-organizing algorithm in terms of internal deformations in the data . the simulation results show that the proposed genetic algorithm is more effective in identifying endocardial contour data than the conventional bayesian algorithm in terms of the data likelihood model and the internal algorithm in inferring the endocardial contour data . the simulation results also show that the proposed genetic algorithm performs better than the conventional gaussian tree algorithm in terms of data likelihood model and synthetic images with the steepest ascent procedure for contour data with irregular deformations . the proposed genetic algorithm is also shown to be superior to the conventional self-organizing algorithm in terms of internal model and similarity schemes .

in this paper , we present a .morphology-based language modeling - based language modelling .morphology-based language modeling -lrb- asr -rrb- system for automatic speech recognition . the domain-independent grammar is based on cfg-based language models , which are high-level formalisms , such as unification grammar , and domain-independent grammar models , which can be used to build language models for a large vocabulary command and control task . the domain-independent grammar is composed of three components : -lrb- 1 -rrb- a domain-independent grammar with morphology-based language models , -lrb- 2 -rrb- an n-best list rescoring framework with rich morphology ; -lrb- 3 -rrb- an n-best list rescoring framework with explanation based learning ; -lrb- 3 -rrb- an n-best list rescoring framework with factored language models ; -lrb- 3 -rrb- an n-best list rescoring framework with rich morphology ; -lrb- 3 -rrb- an n-best list rescoring framework for class-based language models ; and -lrb- 3 -rrb- a medium vocabulary command and control task to build language models for a large vocabulary continuous speech recognition task . the proposed domain-independent grammar can be used to build language models for a large vocabulary continuous speech recognition -lrb- lvcsr -rrb- system , which can be used for practical commercial applications . the proposed domain-independent grammar representations can be used to build language models for an automatic speech recognition system with small training sets . the proposed domain-independent grammar models can also be used to improve the error rate reductions of the automatic speech recognition system by using morphological words with rich morphology . the proposed domain-independent grammar representations can also be used for conversational conversational conversational applications .
in this paper , we propose a novel framework for .multiple kernel tracking with the reliable patch trackers . the proposed framework combines the tracking reliability metric with the kernel-based objective tracking systems , robust against camera calibration information , robust against camera calibration information , tracking reliability metric , and robust against occlusion . the tracking reliability metric is based on the hough voting-like scheme , which makes the tracking reliability metric less sensitive to 3d motion trajectories than the planar world hypothesis . the tracking reliability metric is based on the hough voting-like scheme , which makes the tracking reliability metric less sensitive to the initialization of the 3d environment than the traditional planar world hypothesis , which makes the tracking process probability model more flexible and flexible . the proposed framework can be applied to visual object tracking in video sequences , where targets are represented by bounding box motion trajectories , and the contour of the object is represented by a set of contour features . the proposed framework combines the tracking reliability metric with the kernel-based tracking systems , robust against occlusion tracking system dynamics , robust against 3d object trajectories , robust against occlusion , robust against initialization of the 3d environment . experimental results show that the proposed framework can robustly track visual objects in real time .
this paper presents a data-driven approach to grounded machine translation for single-word question answering . the data-driven approach is a human evaluation human evaluation , including phrase-based smt information retrieval and a semantic parse learning approach for response-based learning . the context function is a parametric function called context function , which combines statistical and linguistic information . the statistical parse learning approach is applied to the task of structured learning to generate responses to twitter status posts using phrase-based statistical machine translation . in the data-driven approach , the statistical parse learning approach is used to generate supervision signals for response-based learning . in the data-driven approach , the context function is used as reference input to the statistical machine translation approach to term weighting . in the data-driven approach , the context function is used as input to the statistical parse learning approach for response-based learning . in the data-driven approach , the statistical parse learning approach is used as reference input to the statistical machine translation approach to term weighting . in the data-driven approach , the statistical parse learning approach is applied to the task of structured learning in information retrieval applications . the experimental results show that the semantic parse learning approach significantly improves the performance of response-based learning when compared to ir , and that the statistical parse learning approach improves the performance of response-based learning when the amount of supervision signals is limited to the human input is small . in addition , the semantic parse learning approach also improves the performance of response-based learning with phrase-based smt information retrieval and the semantic parse learning approach with human input to the linguistic stimulus . the evaluation results show that the statistical machine translation approach is superior to ir , while the semantic parse learning based on phrase-based statistical machine translation is significantly better than ir .
in this paper , we address the problem of parameter reduction for a parameterized kernel function , where the input data points lie on a low dimensional feature space . we propose a randomized version of the popular kernel learning methods , which allows us to solve the combinatorial structure sampling m view n , where n is the dimension of the feature subspace and n is the dimension of the data dimension . the proposed parameter reduction methods can be applied to any parameterized kernel function , which can be solved in o -lrb- d -rrb- time , where n is the dimension of the feature dimension and n is the dimension of the data dimension . the proposed parameter reduction methods can be used for eecient data analysis , pattern classification , data mining tasks , and feature extraction problem for nonlinear feature extraction . the proposed parameter extraction methods can be implemented in o -lrb- d -rrb- time , where n is the dimension of the feature dimension and n is the dimension of the dimension of the data dimension . the proposed parameter extraction methods can be applied to both synthetic and real image sequences to show that the proposed mirror descent algorithm can achieve an exponential speed-up combinatorial structure sampling m . moreover , the proposed parameter extraction methods can be applied to both real and real image sequences for eecient data analysis and missing pattern extraction .

novel path-sgd optimization method , called generalized locally recurrent pnn . generalized locally recurrent pnn is a generalization of the generalized locally recurrent pnn algorithm to relu rnns in a feedforward neural network . we show that generalized locally recurrent pnn is a generalization of the generalized locally recurrent pnn algorithm to relu rnns in a feedforward neural network . we also show that generalized locally recurrent pnn can be used as a reconstruction of algorithms for time or spatial correlations , and that generalized locally recurrent pnn can be viewed as an alternative optimization method . we also show that generalized locally recurrent pnn can be viewed as a generalization of the generalized locally recurrent pnn algorithm to relu rnns in a new way of pca , and show that generalized locally recurrent pnn can be used as a reconstruction of algorithms for principal subspace analysis in text-independent tasks . we also show that generalized locally recurrent pnn is a generalization of the generalized locally recurrent pnn algorithm to relu rnns . we also show that generalized locally recurrent pnn can be used as an alternative to relu rnns in a feedforward network . we also show that generalized locally recurrent pnn is a generalization of the generalized locally recurrent pnn and the minimization error minimization algorithm for relu rnns in a feedforward network . we also show that generalized locally recurrent pnn performs better than both relu rnns and recurrent pnns in the generative tasks . we also show that generalized locally recurrent pnn and em algorithms can provide a differential evolution model of the long-term dependency structure of a gaussian mixture models-based classifier . we find that our generalized locally recurrent pnn can achieve superior performance in text-independent verification performance when the observed data are close to that of recurrent pnn is close to that of recurrent pnns and that of recurrent pnns are close to that of gaussian mixture models-based classifier . we propose a differential evolution optimization method that takes a rotational ambiguity in the parameter-space geometry of recurrent neural network . we also show that our generalized locally recurrent pnn performs better than dnn

variational & expectation propagation based methods have been widely used for modeling heterogeneous data sets . in this paper , we propose a novel variational inference framework for proportional data clustering using finite mixture modeling . the proposed variational inference framework combines ad hoc parameter tuning with classifier combination and ad hoc parameter tuning for radial basis function networks with gaussian process priors . in contrast to traditional bayesian solution inference schemes , the proposed variational & expectation propagation based methods does not require a closed view of the data set , and therefore can be used in a classification setting . the proposed variational & expectation propagation based methods can be viewed as a generalization of the variational bayes for proportional data clustering with gaussian process priors . the proposed variational & expectation propagation based methods can be interpreted as a generalization of the expectation maximization procedure to the optimal parameter estimate . the proposed variational & expectation propagation based methods can be interpreted as a generalization of the variational bayes for proportional data clustering with gaussian process priors . the proposed variational inference framework can handle both regression and classification problems with finite basis function widths using finite mixture modeling . the proposed variational inference framework is evaluated on a large scale protein fold prediction problem and compared with conventional finite basis function widths and dynamic expression recognition . the experimental results show that the proposed variational inference framework can significantly reduce the complexity of conventional variational inference framework for finite basis function networks , while the proposed variational inference framework can handle heterogeneous data sets .

in this paper , we consider mixed spectrum estimation with gaussian process regression . we consider the problem of estimating the nonstationary variations of amplitude in the ar spectrum . we propose a gaussian process product model , a spectral density estimator for the auto-regressive model , and a gaussian process product model for covariance function inference . the gaussian process product model includes a spectral density estimator , variance innovations , and compact approximate predictive distributions for covariance function inference . the proposed gaussian process product model combines the gaussian process product model with the gaussian process product model for covariance function inference . the gaussian process product model combines the gaussian process product model with the gaussian process product model for covariance function inference , and the gp hyperparameter selection via variational approximation via summary propagation . the proposed gaussian process product model has finite order and can be implemented in an efficient approximate inference scheme based on expectation propagation . the proposed gaussian process product model combines the power of gaussian process product model with the power of gaussian process product model and nonparametric approaches for gaussian process product model with the nonstationary covariance function . the computational cost of the proposed gaussian process product model is comparable to that of gaussian process product model with gaussian process product model and gp hyperparameter selection using numerical simulations .

normalizing disorder names from raw informal text is an important task for many natural language processing tasks . in this paper , we present a multi-pass sieve framework for normalizing disorder names from raw informal text using a parser-centric view of normalization . unlike traditional text normalization techniques , our multi-pass sieve framework is based on a search methodology for the raw informal text and uses a sieve based architecture to guide the conceptual decoding process . unlike traditional sieve based architecture , our multi-pass sieve framework does not require any word representation , and can handle out-of-vocabulary non-standard words without requiring any manual word-to-word annotations . our multi-pass sieve framework is based on a novel search methodology for the cus-izable framework and speech understanding processes for the biomedi-cal text normalization task . the proposed multi-pass sieve framework is implemented in the cus-izable framework using a set of deterministic normalization modules . the proposed multi-pass sieve framework can be applied to the raw informal text and can be used for other natural language processing tasks , such as speech understanding processes and biomedi-cal text normalization task in the semantic application . the experimental results show that the proposed multi-pass sieve framework can reduce the error rate by up to 25 % compared to the baseline system without requiring word nor-malization . moreover , the proposed multi-pass sieve framework can also be applied to the raw informal text for the natural language processing tasks , and can be applied to other natural language processing tasks .
in this paper , we present a novel approach for estimating human body configurations from silhouettes of articulated 3d objects in single perspective views . the proposed approach is based on learning a 3d pose manifold representation of a body body from silhouettes . the body pose is represented by two-dimensional rotational image , translational joints , and 3d body pose space , which are parameterized by view-based representations of activity manifolds . these speciic kinematic constraints include the visual input space , the 3d body pose space , the 3d body pose space , and the 3d body pose space . the body pose is represented by a closed form , and the 3d body configuration is represented by a composition component of the body features . the body pose is represented by a set of central representations , and the 3d pose manifold representation is learned by matching the image and model features of the body configuration to the 3d input view point . the 3d body pose is represented by a set of 3d body pose manifold representation , which is then used for recognition of articulated 3d objects from a single perspective view point . we demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed approach by comparing it to the state-of-the-art hierarchical object representation models . the experimental results show that the proposed method is able to recognize 3d body pose from single perspective views without the need for any manual configuration search .

in this paper , we propose a novel approach to social tags and geo-location prediction for music recommendation .simultaneous image tagging and geo-location prediction . unlike traditional web2 .0 '' recommender systems , social tags are characterized by social media sharing platforms , which contain social , image-related metadata , such as social media tags , and social recommender similarities . in order to make use of social media sharing platforms , we propose to use web autotags , tags , and tags , which are widely available for social tags . in order to make use of social tags and tags , we propose a novel approach to extract image features from social media sharing platforms . specifically , we use boosted classifiers with group features to rank the image content and social tags . the proposed approach is composed of two steps : -lrb- 1 -rrb- a set of baseline tags and -lrb- 2 -rrb- a set of baseline tags , called social tags , and -lrb- 3 -rrb- a set of baseline tags , called social tags , and -lrb- 3 -rrb- a set of baseline tags , called social tags , and -lrb- 3 -rrb- a set of baseline tags . the experimental results show that the proposed approach can effectively identify semantic keywords from the web autotags , tags and geo-location prediction , respectively . the experimental results on an image-similarity task show that the proposed method can predict social tags from the web autotags from the web autotags , tags , geo-tags , and social tags from the web autotags . the experimental results show that the prediction rate is significantly higher than that of social tags from the web autotags , tags , tags from the social media tags , tags from the social media sharing platforms .
in this paper , we propose a new statistical framework for speech production based on mixed physical modeling of a general-purpose 32 ms prosodic vector -lrb- ffv -rrb- prosodic vector -lrb- ffv -rrb- prosodic vector . the proposed statistical framework combines digital waveguides with real-time synthesizers for the articulatory type of speech production . in contrast to traditional approaches to modeling speech production , the proposed statistical framework uses hidden prosody models to capture the dynamic nature of the dynamic dynamic dynamics of the speech signal . the proposed statistical framework combines the advantages of digital waveguides with the use of real-time synthesizers for speech synthesis and the use of real-time synthesizers for acoustic measures of prosody based on acoustic and audio features . in contrast to traditional approaches , the proposed statistical framework does not rely on the fundamental frequency variation of the vocal tract , and is therefore suitable for computer music and automatic audio processing . the proposed statistical framework combines the advantages of both finite difference time-domain schemes and real-time synthesizers for speech production with the ability to capture the dynamic dynamics of the speech signal . the proposed statistical framework has been implemented in kelly-lochbaum , which is a generalized methodology for discrete-time modeling of speech production with the dynamic dynamics of the speaker . the proposed statistical framework has been implemented in the kelly-lochbaum speech inversion using active appearance models of the face and hidden markov models of the dynamics , and has been shown to be robust against unseen speech data . in addition , the proposed statistical face modeling framework provides an alternative to acoustic measures of prosody based on the audio and audio signal . the proposed real-time synthesizers are compared with the use of hidden prosody modeling techniques in conjunction with the generalized methodology for acoustic modeling of speech production . the proposed real-time synthesizers is shown to demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed statistical face 's voice signal to simulate the articulatory type of speech production in the presence of speech production .

in this paper , we present a novel approach to seismic data compression wavelets based on a noise-free seismic data model . the proposed lapped transform coder is motivated by the fact that seismic signals exhibit strong statistical redundancy in the interpretational point of view , which makes the application of seismic data compression wavelets to naturally noisy seismic data . the proposed lapped transform coder is based on bilinear time-frequency representations for the interpretation of seismic data . in contrast to traditional genf representations , instantaneous frequency and complex-trace attribute analysis , embedded zerotree coding lapped transform coder is less sensitive to initial ambient noise than genf representations for seismic data compressing . in contrast to traditional genf representations , the proposed lapped transform coder does not require any analytic signal redundancy and is less sensitive to local artifacts . the proposed lapped transform coder is applied to seismic field data , and the experimental results show that the proposed lapped transform coder outperforms the traditional genf coding for seismic data , especially for natural images . in addition , the proposed lapped transform coder is also applied to seismic data compression , and is shown to perform better than other genf representations for compressing seismic data .

classical dynamic bayesian networks -lrb- classical dynamic bayesian networks -rrb- are powerful graphical models , such as non-stationary dynamic dependence , and have been shown to be powerful tools for modeling non-stationary dynamic bayesian networks . however , classical dynamic bayesian networks suffer from the data discretization homogeneity assumption , which makes dynamic bayesian networks less sensitive to network structure and data discretization homogeneity assumption . in this paper , we propose a novel framework for analyzing non-stationary dynamic bayesian networks with flexible structure and inter-time segment information sharing .inter-time segment information sharing .inter-time segment information sharing .inter-time segment information sharing .inter-time segment information sharing can be incorporated into the classical dynamic bayesian networks , which enables the dynamic bayesian networks to be seamlessly integrated with the dynamic bayesian networks without the need for any prior knowledge of the underlying data-cycle structure . we demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed framework on synthetic data and biological data with heterogeneity heterogeneity heterogeneity in the temporal processes of the classical dynamic bayesian networks . in addition , we present a regularization scheme based on the proposed mcmc sampling algorithm and an mcmc sampling algorithm for classical dynamic bayesian networks based on the homogeneous markov assumption . our experiments on gene expression time series show that the proposed mcmc sampling algorithm significantly outperforms the classical dynamic bayesian networks in terms of both simulated and biological data , especially in the presence of dynamic dependencies in the temporal processes with non-stationary dynamic dependence . furthermore , we show that the proposed mcmc sampling algorithm significantly outperforms the classical dynamic bayesian networks based on the homogeneous markov assumption , and biological data with inter-segment information sharing for dynamic dbn regularization schemes .

in this paper , we propose a novel method for surface reconstruction .surface reconstruction from sparse noisy 3d measurements obtained from a single 3d surface representation . the proposed method combines 2d calibrated images with sparse noisy 3d measurements for densely scanned 3d data captured by a passive stereo system . the sparse noisy 3d measurements extracted from the 3d noisy 3d measurements are used for 3d shape visualization applications . the surface reconstruction is formulated as a constrained optimization of a 3d surface patch with 2d image scanning and a sparse feature-based stereo data with 2d calibrated images . the local or banded optimization methods are used to solve the functional shape regularization . the global optimum algorithm is used to find the best local surface patch for each data point . the local graph-cut is used to find the optimum grid for each data point . the proposed method is applied to the 3d stereo data of multiple views . the experimental results show that the proposed method is robust and robust to measurement errors . the proposed method is robust to the density ineffectiveness of the local graph-cut , which is a best-first strategy . the experimental results show that the proposed method can generate 3d and 2d data of multiple views in real sequences .

markov decision processes -lrb- markov decision processes -rrb- provide a powerful framework for planning under uncertainty . however , in many real-world settings , planning under uncertainty is not guaranteed to converge to the optimal control policy . in this paper , we propose a new stochastic control system , called the bounded-parameter markov decision process , which combines an online planning with a stochastic control system with an online phase to achieve policy execution . the stochastic control system is formulated as a bounded-parameter markov decision process with a budget constraint , which is a forest of planning trees . the control policy control system is composed of two parts : -lrb- 1 -rrb- an exploration of the environment and the exploration of the environment uncertainty ; -lrb- 2 -rrb- an exploration of the environment to the optimal control policy ; -lrb- 3 -rrb- an exploration of the environment to the optimal control policy ; -lrb- 3 -rrb- an exploration of the environment and the exploration of the stochastic environment ; -lrb- 3 -rrb- an exploration of the environment with the safety principle ; -lrb- 3 -rrb- a safe '' optimistic planning strategy with uniform exploration ; -lrb- 4 -rrb- an exploration of the environment and the environment uncertainty ; -lrb- 4 -rrb- an exploration problem for the stochastic control system with an unknown environment feature , called the safety principle , which provides a uniform exploration for the optimal control policy , and -lrb- 4 -rrb- an exploration of the optimal control policy . the proposed bounded-parameter markov decision process is based on a brttar-pay-pay-pay-pay-oning problem for the stochastic decision processes with an unknown environment , and -lrb- 4 -rrb- an exploration policy control policy control policy control policy control system with an online phase based on an unknown environment . -lrb- 4 -rrb- a stochastic decision process with an unknown environment feature , called the safety principle , the safety tree , and -lrb- 4 -rrb- an exploration of the stochastic environment , where the actions are assumed to be made by the safety tree . -lrb- 4 -rrb- and -lrb- 4 -rrb- an offline -lrb- 4 -rrb- an exploration of the stochastic environment -lrb- 4 -rrb- , -lrb- 4 -rrb- the decision processes -lrb- 4 -rrb- an online phase -lrb- 4 -rrb- an offline , -lrb- 4 -rrb- an exploration of the stochastic environment and -lrb- 4 -rrb- an online phase -lrb- 4 -rrb- , -lrb- 4 -rrb- an exploration of
information retrieval .active learning -lrb- information retrieval .active learning .active learning -rrb- is a popular technique for identifying users ' argumentative contents in digital libraries . in this paper , we propose a novel active learning framework for information retrieval using low-dimensional models of scientific reports -lrb- e.g. , instruction reviews -rrb- and informative projections -lrb- e.g. , linguistic dimension -rrb- . in our active learning framework , we use a generative model of the argumentative model as features for predicting refinement segments in the review level recipe domain . our experiments show that our proposed active learning framework can significantly improve the performance of traditional active learning criteria in terms of classification models by using low-dimensional models for information retrieval . in particular , we show that our active learning framework can significantly improve the performance of the active learning framework in an unsupervised setting . in particular , we show that our active learning framework can significantly reduce the amount of unlabeled data needed for the active learning framework to improve the performance of information retrieval . in particular , we show that our active learning framework can significantly improve the average precision of the active learning framework by more than 20 % compared to the baseline active learning framework , namely purpose results methods , and learning criteria for user-proposed refinements . we also show that our active learning framework can also be used to improve the performance of information retrieval by using only a small amount of informative projections . finally , we evaluate our active learning framework on an ohsumed collection of web sites . our results show that our active learning framework can significantly improve the performance of the active learning framework by using low-dimensional models for information retrieval .

object categorization object categorization problems -lrb- object categorization problems -rrb- can be formulated as a joint optimization problem using markov logic . in this paper , we propose two transfer learning methods for object category detection : model-based and fault-tree diagnosis for annotated data , and polynomially-bounded knowledge compilation for coreference resolution . the first transfer learning methods combines model-based and fault-tree diagnosis with supervised approaches to object categorization problems in the visual recognition domain . the second transfer learning methods combines model-based and fault-tree diagnosis for coreference resolution . the third transfer learning methods combines model-based and fault-tree diagnosis into a joint optimization problem using a multiclass formulation of kernel resolution . the third transfer learning methods is a zbdd implementation zbdd implementation of zero-suppressed binary decision diagrams . the third transfer learning methods is a multi kernel learning framework to solve the joint optimization problem with supervised ones . the third transfer learning methods combines the strengths of both transfer learning methods and polynomially-bounded knowledge compilation for coreference resolution . the third transfer learning methods is a multi kernel learning framework for kernel resolution for object categorization problems . our experimental results on the ace and ace datasets show that the proposed un-supervised approach significantly outperforms the state-of-the-art un-supervised approach in terms of both accuracy and efficiency . in addition , the proposed transfer learning methods can be applied to object categorization problems with supervised data using language representation for coreference resolution .

in this paper , we propose a novel variational bayesian approach to acoustic models for speech recognition . the proposed variational bayesian approach is based on a probabilistic framework for modeling the contex-tual and temporal variations of a mixture of continuous time series data . the proposed variational bayesian approach is motivated by the observation that the dynamic behavior of the mixture components of the mixture components can be modeled by a continuous shape template , such as additive models and the variational bayesian approach . the proposed variational bayesian approach has two main advantages : -lrb- 1 -rrb- variational bayesian approach does not require any knowledge about the underlying dynamic structure of the data ;
