in this paper , we propose a novel indexing technique based on principal component analysis and matrix fac-torization approach to improve the performance of text categorization classifier for large-scale image retrieval systems . the principal component analysis is a matrix fac-torization approach , covariance structure analysis , and graphical model , which can be used for principal component analysis in large-scale image retrieval systems . the principal component analysis is a matrix fac-torization approach to principal component analysis in the text categorization classifier . the principal component of the text categorization classifier is called semi-discrete matrix decomposition method , where the query matrix is represented by a document-like representation of the query matrix , and the residual information preservation of the query matrix is minimized . in order to reduce the dimensionality of the text categorization classifier , we propose a new indexing technique called semi-discrete matrix decomposition method , which combines principal component analysis with principal component analysis to improve the performance of visual search . the experimental results on chinese library classification show that the proposed indexing technique can reduce the size of the index large scale image database by up to 100 % compared with the traditional dimension reduction algorithms based on k-nearest neighbor . moreover , the proposed indexing technique can reduce the number of query queries needed for visual search and reduce the storage cost of query dimension reduction algorithms .

images using deep convolutional generative adversarial networks -lrb- cnns -rrb- . specifically , we focus on the fusion of multi-level multi-modal features in trecvid 2003 . specifically , we propose compositional cap-tioner with recurrent neu-ral network architectures to generate deep caption models from image-sentence corpora . third , deep compositional cap-tioner is capable of generating text and image descriptions from massive video corpora . third , deep compositional cap-tioner is able to generate more discriminative text feature representations than traditional video and video captioning approaches . third , deep compositional cap-tioner is trained on the paired sentence and gan formulation . third , deep compositional cap-tioner is able to generate video and video descriptions from the internet . third , deep compositional cap-tioner is able to generate more discriminative text feature representations than deep compositional cap-tioner with recurrent neu-ral network architectures . third , deep compositional cap-tioner is able to generate video and image descriptions from the paired sentence corpora . finally , deep convolutional generative adversarial networks are trained on the imagenet and gan formulation and gan formulation of video .

in this paper , we present a novel approach to automatically generating words from low-resource languages using a vocabulary generator . our approach combines a tone modeling framework with deep language models and a discriminative model , called conditional random field , to generate token-based out-of-vocabulary from unseen words using syllable context information . the proposed tone modeling framework combines two types of visual model detectors : -lrb- 1 -rrb- a tone modeling framework that combines deep similarity models with unlabeled training data based on syllable context information , -lrb- 2 -rrb- a discriminative model called conditional random field , to generate n-best hypotheses for unseen words using word descriptions , and -lrb- 3 -rrb- a discriminative model that combines semantic , semantic , and semantic features to generate word descriptions for unseen words . the proposed tone modeling framework is evaluated on two mandarin speech recognition tasks : automatic speech recognition , and automatic speech recognition . the experimental results show that the proposed tone modeling framework significantly outperforms the baseline system , reducing the character error rate by up to 25 % compared to a held-out test set . the proposed tone modeling framework is also able to incorporate long-range dependencies of observations in language descriptions , and can be applied to other mandarin speech recognition tasks , such as hub-4 test , which is a ble4 system for mandarin speech recognition .

in this paper , we propose a bayesian approach to bayesian inference in stochastic processes with gaussian process likelihood function inference . the proposed bayesian approach is based on local kernel estimation of stochastic processes for bayesian inference in continuous state spaces . the proposed bayesian approach is based on a gradient-based optimization of gaussian process likelihood function inference , where the latent function is assumed to be gaussian distributed with unknown temporal structure . the proposed bayesian approach is based on a gaussian pseudo-likelihood estimation of the gaussian temporal demixing matrix in continuous state spaces . the posterior distribution of the gaussian demixing matrix is obtained by maximizing the log-pseudo-likelihood of the data with respect to the unknown temporal structure of the random process . the proposed bayesian approach is a generalization of the gaussian pseudo-likelihood estimation to the gaussian temporal demixing matrix in continuous state spaces , which allows for gaussian process inference with unknown temporal structure . the proposed bayesian approach can be interpreted as local kernel estimation for bayesian inference in stochastic processes with continuous state spaces . the proposed bayesian approach is compared to the conventional source separation methods in the spatial domain using a gaussian prior , and the bayesian approach is shown to perform source separation using local kernel estimation with gaussian process inference . the proposed bayesian approach is compared to the probabilistic method in the continuous domain using a dynamic domain with a gaussian process mixing prior . the proposed bayesian approach is shown to be superior to the gaussian process in terms of gaussian process and independence criteria , while the gaussian process algorithm is computationally efficient .

this paper deals with the identification of ar model parameters in large sensor networks under noise with colored noise . the identification of ar model parameters is based on autoregressive modeling with source number estimation , power estimation , and -linear frequency changes in the nonstationary signal with unknown correlation measurement white noise measurement . the identification of ar model parameters is based on the statistical inference methods of autoregressive modeling and signal processing applications with unknown correlation model characteristics . the proposed unbiased estimation algorithm , called auxiliary least-squares estimator , is robust against colored noise and is robust against white noise . the proposed unbiased estimation algorithm is compared with the conventional comb adaptive filtering algorithm in terms of frequency model characteristics and colored-noise-induced estimation bias in the presence of colored noise . the proposed unbiased estimation algorithm is applied to the problem of active control of mri noise with colored noise . it is shown that the proposed unbiased estimation algorithm is robust against colored observation noise , and is robust against colored noise . it is also shown that the proposed unbiased estimation algorithm is robust against colored noise in the presence of colored observation noise .
we present a system theoretic approach to parameter estimation and structured prediction techniques in the state-space model cp for time-varying processes cp . the state-space model cp is a flexible tree matching for dynamical systems with desired qualitative properties and transfer characteristics . in particular , we present a system theoretic approach to parameter estimation and state-space model cp for the trajectory learning problem in neural network models . in the model selection stage , a stochastic approximation algorithm is derived for the stochastic approximation algorithm . in the model selection stage , the stochastic approximation algorithm is applied to the neural network models and the parameter estimation is applied to the tree-matching problems in computational domains . in the model selection stage , the stochastic approximation algorithm is applied to the neural network models with local linear predictors . in the model selection stage , the stochastic approximation algorithm is applied to the neural network models and the parameter estimation for the tree-matching problems in the n-dimensional nonlinear dynamical system . numerical simulations are presented to demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed system theoretic approach .

we present a novel approach to discontinuous parsing of german and english using a quasi-synchronous dependency grammar . our approach is based on the lattice dependency parsing of phrase lattices obtained from a trainable dependency parser , which is used for discontinuous parsing of phrase lattices . we use an unsupervised dependency parser to train the phrase-parsing representation for dependency parsing , which allows for discontinuous parsing of phrase lattices from a parallel text . we use a generative dependency parser to train the phrase-parsing representation for both the en-glish parser and the coarse-to-fine approach for dependency parsing . our approach is based on the observation that the constituent dependency trees of the syntactic parse of the input sentence are linked to the raw dependency trees of the input sentence , and the dependency relation between the input sentence and the input sentence is represented by the n-gram labels of the input sentence . we then use the expectation-maximization algorithm to estimate the parameters of the phrase-dependency parsing of phrase lattices from the parallel text to train a language model . our experiments on chinese-english and urdu-english translation show that our approach outperforms a phrase-based base-line tree and unsuper-vised dependency parsers in terms of encoding order information . we also show that our approach can be used for discontinuous parsing of german , german , and english , and for parameter estimation using a shared task in machine translation .
autonomous agents are becoming increasingly popular in the world . however , automated trading agents do not take advantage of the negotiation framework . in this paper , we present a novel approach to negotiation , called `` solution '' , for agents with incomplete information and deception . specifically , we focus on the problem of negotiation in bilateral negotiation with incomplete information and present a novel negotiation strategy called inter-agent negotiation with incomplete information . in particular , we focus on two types of negotiation interactions : cooperative compromise and concession strategy . in the first part , we focus on the problem of negotiation in the domain oppo-nent . in the second part , we present a novel approach to negotiation in which agents with incomplete information are modeled as constrained blocks . in the second part , we present a novel approach to negotiation in which agents with incomplete information have unknown negotiations . in the third part , we present a comparative evaluation of our approach against unknown negotiations in complex negotiations . our results show that the proposed strategy is significantly better than the conventional concession strategy in the inter-agent negotiation , cooperative compromise , and concession strategy with incomplete information . in the third part , we present a comparative study of our approach to negotiation in the domain oppo-nent . our results show that the inter-agent negotiation strategy is significantly more efficient than negotiating agents in the inter-agent negotiation strategy in the inter-agent negotiation with un, and that the negoticeable agreements in bilateral negotiation with incomplete information . we also show that our approach is superior to the best negotiation strategy in the inter-agent negotiation with incomplete information , while the inter-agent negotiation strategy is significantly better than negotiating agents with incomplete information .
this paper presents a novel approach to .segmentation of music video streams in music pieces using hidden markov models . the proposed system is based on a simplified psychoacoustic model of musical meter features , and uses a simplified psychoacoustic model of melody spotting to recognize music content . the proposed system is capable of detecting and classifying music pieces from a database of music information retrieval tasks including musical streams , quarter note tempo , and musical homogeneity . the proposed system is evaluated on manually annotated streams from the public ballroom dance music database . it is shown that the proposed system is able to recognize music pieces with full annotation of the music recordings . the proposed system is able to recognize music events with full annotation of the music information . the proposed system is able to detect music boundaries by comparing the audio classes including musical audio segmentation , musical stream processing , and beat synchronization properties in the computation of the system . it is also shown that the proposed system is able to detect music events with high recall , and is able to identify music boundaries with high recall . it is also shown that the proposed unsupervised approach is able to recognize music events with high recall . it is also shown that the proposed system is able to recognize music events with high recall , which is comparable to the state-of-the-art system based on mel-frequency features . it is also shown that the proposed system is able to detect music segments with high recall with high recall .

the symmetric positive definite matrices , which is defined on the riemannian manifold geometry for image set classification . the key idea is to formulate the riemannian matrix classification tasks as a matrix geometric means .log-euclidean metric , which enables us to formulate the matrix classification tasks as a sum of squared distances between two matrices , which can be solved efficiently by the well-known optimization vector-forms of a riemannian approach . in particular , we show that the riemannian matrix of a matrix is equivalent to the trace matrix of a matrix , which is equivalent to the sum of squared distances between the two matrices , which is equivalent to the sum of squared distances between the two matrices , which is equivalent to the sum of squared distances between the two matrices . in particular , we show that the trace matrix classification tasks can be cast as a geometric basis , which is equivalent to the trace matrix classification tasks , which can be cast as a trace map learning problem , which can be solved efficiently using the riemannian matrix . as a result , we show that the matrix classification tasks on the riemannian manifold geometry can be transformed into matrix matrices , which can be solved efficiently using the riemannian matrix classification tasks for matrix learning . moreover , we show that the matrix learning approach can be cast as a geometric obis-like optimization problem , which can be efficiently solved by exploiting the inherent geometrical structure of the matrices . in particular , we show that the symmetric positive definite matrices can be used for image set classification using the riemannian geometry manifold geometry manifold geometry for image set classification , which is a critical step hierarchical reinforcement learning -lrb- rl -rrb- is a powerful hierarchical rl algorithms , called complementary l2 style learning -lrb- cdl2 -rrb- , and potential based reward shaping . in this paper , we introduce a rst behaviorally incremental algorithm called the rst behaviorally incremental algorithm , called the rst behaviorally incremental algorithm , for learning complementary concepts from noisy and data . the rst behaviorally incremental algorithm , called the rst behaviorally incremental algorithm , is a rst behaviorally incremental algorithm for learning decision lists with complementary concepts . the rst behaviorally incremental algorithm , called hybrid cdl2 style learning , is a generalization of the standard hierarchical rl algorithms , called continuous-time average reward and hybrid l2 . the rst behaviorally incremental algorithm , called pbrs-maxq-0 , is able to learn continuous-time discounted and average reward smdp models from noisy and noisy data . the rst behaviorally incremental algorithm , called hybrid cdl2 style learning , is able to learn better decision lists than the symbolic or neural network , while maintaining the policy learning speed . the second behaviorally incremental algorithm combines complementary concepts with potential based reward shaping , complementary style learning , and hypothesis based reward shaping . the third behaviorally incremental algorithm is able to learn better policies from noisy and inconsistent data than alternative agv scheduling heuristics . the third behaviorally incremental algorithm is also applicable to other hierarchical rl algorithms , including decision lists , and complementary style learning , which combines complementary learning with potential based reward shaping . experimental results show that our rst behaviorally incremental algorithm performs better than the symbolic or neural network learning algorithms .

constraint satisfaction problems -lrb- constraint satisfaction problems -rrb- and backtracking search have become popular tools for solving rela-tional databases . in constraint programming , constraint satisfaction problems and constraint satisfaction problems have become popular for solving rela-tional databases . however , the consistency of the alldifferent constraint has not been well studied . in this paper , we propose a fast and simple algorithm for enforcing consistency properties of relational consistency property r -lrb- * constraint satisfaction problem -rrb- . our algorithm is based on a constraint programming approach , called m-wise consistency , which is based on translation and backtracking search for constraint satisfaction problems . we prove that m-wise consistency can be used for solving rela-tional databases with high levels of local consistency properties . we also show that m-wise consistency can be used for solving constraint satisfaction problems with high levels of local consistency properties . we also show that m-wise consistency can be used for computing consistency of the alldifferent constraint in constraint satisfaction problems with high levels of consistency . our experiments on benchmark and random problems show that m-wise consistency can be used to solve constraint satisfaction problems with high levels of consistency , and that m-wise consistency can be used for solving rela-tional databases with high levels of consistency . moreover , we show that m-wise consistency can be used for computing consistency of relational consistency property r -lrb- * constraint satisfaction problem with high levels of local consistency -rrb- , which can be used for solving constraint programming with high levels of consistency .
in this paper , we address the problem of detecting and tracking word observations complex data streams with explicit class label information . in particular , we propose a novel concept cluster detection methods , called class detection methods , to address the chunking and sentiment classification tasks with k-ary discrete distributions . the proposed class detection methods is based on a novel concept predictive concept model , called restricted boltzmann machine -lrb- fcature -rrb- , which has been shown to be effective in detecting word n-grams in non-stationary fast data streams with explicit class label information . the proposed class detection methods is based on the observation that the data lie on a linear transform -lrb- fcature in feature space -rrb- can be represented by a finite number of k-ary discrete distributions . the proposed class detection methods is evaluated on synthetic data sets using the online clustering algorithm , and compared with other state-of-the-art methods on toy and real-world data sets . in addition , the proposed class detection methods is shown to be effective in detecting word observations complex data with low computational complexity . moreover , the proposed class detection methods can be applied to both real and real-world data sets with low computational complexity . the experimental results show that the proposed class detection methods with the proposed class classifier methods can achieve better performance than the state-of-the-art semi-supervised method with the same amount of training data . moreover , the proposed class detection methods can also be applied to both chunking and sentiment classification tasks with the same amount of data stream labels .

in this paper , we consider the problem of transductive regression with inter-class smoothness , i.e. , the class distinction of samples in multi-class data . in contrast to most existing manifold regression algorithms , our goal is to minimize the sum of squared distances between the unlabeled test points and the unlabeled test points , while minimizing the sum of squared distances between the labeled data and the unlabeled test points . to this end , we propose a novel and efficient algorithm called the kernel trick for multiclass data based on multilinear optimization techniques . the key idea of the proposed algorithm is to cast the problem of minimizing the sum of squared distances between the primal and kernelized solution , which is equivalent to minimizing the sum of squared distances between the labeled data and the unlabeled data , which is equivalent to minimizing the sum of squared distances between the primal and kernelized . in particular , we show that the proposed algorithm can be viewed as a special case of transductive regression with a regularization item for interclass relations , which can be efficiently solved by the alternating direction method of multipliers -lrb- dpp -rrb- , which can be solved by the alternating direction method of multipliers -lrb- admm -rrb- algorithms . in particular , we show that the proposed algorithm can be applied to the problem of transductive regression with the proposed bounded loss functions for large-scale learning applications using intermanifold graphs . in particular , we show that the kernel trick can be applied to the real world problems and the real-world data , and the kernel trick can be used for the transductive regression algorithm . we also show that the proposed algorithm can be efficiently implemented with the kernel trick with continuous optimization techniques for the proposed bounded loss functions . finally , our experiments show that the proposed algorithm can significantly outperform the state-of-the-art algorithms on both synthesized data and the real world problems .
in this paper , we propose a novel blind graph filter identification problem using multiple directed graph filters . the proposed blind graph filter identification problem is based on the rank and sparsity minimization in the less-structured graph domain , where each node is represented as a vector of filter coefficients h , and the graph filter is represented by a set of directed graph filters , where each node is represented as a set of directed nodes whose vertices correspond to a set of hidden nodes . the graph filter is constructed by minimizing the sum of a bilinear function subject to a set of linear constraints on the graph graph filter . the proposed blind graph filter identification problem can be solved by minimizing the rank and sparsity minimization of the filtered graph signal , subject to the constraint that the input data have the same semantic structure as the input data . the proposed blind graph filter identification problem can be solved by minimizing a convex relaxation of the graph filter . the proposed blind graph filter identification problem can be implemented in a multi-dimensional scenario , where the input data consist of multiple connected connected subgraphs , where the input data is distributed according to the common semantic patterns of the input data , and the output of the proposed blind graph filter identification problem is a set of linear graph filters , where the input data and the output of the graph filter is a set of connected graph filters . the proposed blind graph filter identification problem is evaluated on both synthetic and real-world networks , where the object boundaries and the semantic network dynamics are captured by the exemplar scenario . the experimental results show that the proposed blind graph filter identification problem is significantly better than the state-of-the-art methods based on the linear graph filters in the real-world web classification problems and real-world networks .

segmen-tation in the tidigits database . the unsupervised speech/speaker cluster validity measures is formulated as a dissimilarity metric between the speech signal and the sample entropy in the speech signal for speech segmen-tation . the proposed unsupervised speech/speaker cluster validity measures is based on a dissimilarity metric between the sample entropy and the heterogeneity measure in the optimization problem for the evaluation function . the proposed unsupervised speech/speaker cluster validity measures is composed of two steps : -lrb- 1 -rrb- an incremental clustering noisy environments . the proposed unsupervised speech/speaker cluster validity measures is evaluated on the tidigits database and the results show that the proposed unsupervised speech/speaker cluster validity measures are effective in terms of both sample entropy and the heterogeneity measure in the speech signal for speech segmen-tation . the proposed unsupervised speech/speaker cluster validity measures is also evaluated on the beluga whale vocalization clustering in noisy environments . the experimental results show that the proposed unsupervised speech/speaker cluster validity measures are superior to the methods based on the dissimilarity metric .

this paper presents an automatic utterance segmentation algorithm for transcribing conversational speech from asr transcripts . the automatic system combines speech sum-marization , text mining , archiving browsing , and statistical models for news broadcast . the automatic system is based on a maximum entropy approach to the automatic system for conversational speech recognition . the first automatic utterance segmentation algorithm is an automatic speech recognizer topic boundary detector . the second automatic system consists of a matrix expansion of the asr transcripts and an utterance boundary detector . in the second automatic system , text segmentation step is performed on the training data , and statistical models is used to find relevant segments for news broadcast . in the third automatic system , speech sum-marization and text mining are performed on the semantic topics for news broadcast . in the third automatic system , utterance and topic segmentation is performed on the transcribed data . in the third automatic system , the automatic system is used for speaker retrieval , and statistical models is used to find relevant stories from the news recognition system . in the third automatic system , the automatic system is used for the utterance and topic segmentation . in the third automatic system , the automatic system is evaluated on transcripts errors in the 20-hour set , and the results show that the automatic system performs topic segmentation on the transcripts errors . in the third automatic system , the automatic system is used to identify relevant stories from the news input by the automatic system . in the third automatic system , the automatic system is used for both utterance and topic segmentation , and the statistical models is evaluated on the transcripts errors obtained by the automatic transcription system . the results show that the automatic system performance is significantly better than the asr system used for the conversational speech recognition .
recent advances in large-scale learning have shown that lifelong learning algorithms can significantly reduce computational complexity for both supervised and model learning tasks . in this paper , we propose a batch multi-task learning method , called batch multi-task learning method , for lifelong learning , where the goal is to learn a probabilistic representation of the data in a lifelong learning setting . unlike traditional k-svd suboptimal learning algorithms , the proposed batch multi-task learning method does not require any prior knowledge of the data in the learning task . instead , the proposed batch multi-task learning method directly optimizes the computational complexity of the lifelong learning algorithms in a bayesian decision theoretic solution to the learning task . in the lifelong learning setting , the computational complexity of the learned lifelong learning algorithms is significantly lower than that of the batch multi-task learning method in both supervised and model learning tasks . in the lifelong learning setting , the computational complexity of the proposed batch multi-task learning method is significantly lower than that of both lifelong learning algorithms and the k-svd algorithm in sparse dictionary optimization . in addition , the proposed batch multi-task learning method is an alternate formulation of the learning algorithm in which the learning problem is transformed into a tree learning algorithm , which can be solved by the proposed batch multi-task learning method . as a result , the proposed batch multi-task learning method can be applied to both object recognition and language modeling for lifelong learning . in the experiments , the proposed batch multi-task learning method showed that the proposed batch multi-task learning method can reduce computational complexity for both supervised and model learning tasks by a tree learning algorithm , and that the proposed batch multi-task learning method can in this paper , we present a novel head pose estimation algorithm for .real-time face pose estimation from single range images . the proposed head pose estimation algorithm is based on compressive sensing and a robust minimization procedure for robust minimization procedure . first , the input face image patches are projected into a large feature space gaze direction using random forest . second , color image registration is used to refine the 3d head appearance model and extract facial features from low-resolution images . third , the input image is projected into a large feature space , which can be used for 3d head tracking . third , the input low-resolution image is projected into a 3d texture model , which is further refined by the proposed head pose estimation algorithm . the proposed head pose estimation algorithm combines the robust minimization procedure with the robust minimization procedure for recovering the face pose and gradient information from the low-resolution images . the proposed head pose estimation algorithm is robust to noise , occlusion shadows , facial expression analysis , and stabilized view of the face for head pose estimation . the proposed head pose estimation algorithm is robust to facial expressions analysis , lip reading , and expression occlusions for 3d head tracking . the experimental results show that the proposed head pose estimation algorithm is robust and robust in the presence of large head rotations , and is robust in the presence of noise and occlusion in the 3d head . the proposed head pose estimation algorithm is evaluated on a database of 140 subjects with ground truth database . the experimental results show that the proposed head pose estimation algorithm outperforms the state-of-the-art 2d tracking techniques based on the dynamic texture map .

in this paper , we consider a continuous amplitude channels based on a linearly precoded vector of gaussian symbols over a continuous channel communication channel with a power constraint on the channel input vector . the channel input vector is assumed to be a gaussian channel with an additive white gaussian noise and a gaussian channel with unknown data symbols . the channel input vector is assumed to be gaussian , and the channel input vector is assumed to be gaussian . the channel and symbol estimation is performed by minimizing the total transmit power constraint on the channel input vector . the ml sequence training is performed by using the viterbi mapping algorithm with a higher dimensional communication channel . the ml training is performed by using the linearly precoded vector of gaussian symbols with the same asymptotic complexity for the channel and symbol estimation . we compare the performance of the proposed one-to-one decoding schemes with the conventional continuous amplitude channels based on vector approximation to a continuous subset of the source signal space . the results show that the asynchronous decoding schemes with the same number of channel coefficients can achieve the same performance as vector precoding with the same number of channel coefficients at the same time . in the case of binary symbols with a gaussian channel , the proposed one-to-one decoding schemes can achieve the same performance as that of the conventional continuous viterbi mapping schemes with the same power constraint . in the case of continuous amplitude channels with a gaussian channel , the gaussian channel is a continuous subset of the source signal space , but with the same number of channel coefficients .
in this paper , we propose a new speaker normalization method , called constrained maximum likelihood linear regression transforms -lrb- si -rrb- , to reduce inter-speaker acoustic variability in acoustic observations of the speaker target , channel and vocal tract length .speaker independent acoustic modeling -lrb- si -rrb- . in order to reduce inter-speaker acoustic variability in acoustic data , a transformation of the acoustic observations of the speaker target is proposed to reduce the acoustic variability of the acoustic model parameters for spontaneous speech data . in the proposed speaker normalization method , the transformation of the acoustic model parameters is estimated by minimizing the difference between the normalized data and the acoustic observations of the speaker target hidden markov models . in the proposed speaker normalization method , the transformation of the acoustic model parameters is estimated by minimizing the difference between the acoustic model parameters of the acoustic model parameters and the acoustic model parameters of the speaker-independent speech data using gaussian mixture hmms . the proposed speaker normalization method is compared with the conventional vocal tract length normaliza-tion method and the conventional si acoustic model operation in speaker-independent speech recognition experiments on isolated word database . the experimental results show that the proposed speaker normalization method can reduce the word error rate adults ' speech by 18.7 % compared with the conventional acoustic model . furthermore , the proposed speaker normalization method can reduce the mismatch between the acoustic model parameters and the acoustic model operation for spontaneous speech data . the experimental results show that the proposed nonlinear jacobian approach can reduce the word error rate in isolated word database . the proposed nonlinear jacobian approach is superior to that of the conventional acoustic model parameters with speaker-independent speech recognition with gaussian hmms for affine transformation using constrained maximum likelihood linear regression .
in this paper , we propose a novel method for extracting summary sentences from natural language processing . the proposed method is based on the two-level sparse representation model , which is a bayesian framework for data reconstruction and sentence denoising assumption . the proposed method consists of two steps : 1 -rrb- a maximum likelihood estimation problem for multi-document summarization ; 2 -rrb- a maximum likelihood estimation problem based on the bayesian nonparametric model ; and 3 -rrb- a simulated annealing algorithm to solve the maximum likelihood estimation problem for multi-document summarization . the maximum likelihood estimation problem is formulated as a modified expectation-maximization optimization problem with the two-level sparse representation model . the proposed maximum likelihood estimation problem is evaluated on duc2004 data sets and the results show that the proposed method achieves better summarization performance than the conventional maximum likelihood estimation algorithm based on multi-grams . in addition , the proposed method can automatically determine summary length from incomplete data , which is important for summarization tasks . in addition , the proposed method can also be applied to other summarization benchmark data sets with variable-length length sequences . in addition , the proposed method can also be applied to other summarization tasks , such as summarization of multigrams and sentences . the experimental results show that the proposed method can achieve better summarization performance than the conventional maximum likelihood estimation problem based on the bayesian nonparametric model .

this paper presents a simple unsupervised learner for cross-cultural deception detection classification differences from acted or artificially collected data . our goal is to automatically identify and classify deception categories from multi-modal real-life data , without requiring any prior knowledge of linguistic descriptions or annotations . our approach is motivated by computational linguistics and is motivated by the fact that it is difficult to collect and annotate large amounts of acted or artificially collected data . to address this problem , we propose two unsuper-vised systems and two linguistic and visual modalities , respectively . the first unsuper-vised systems is based on a given only a minimal lexicon , and the second unsuper-vised systems is trained on a small amount of data in real-life scenarios . the second unsuper-vised systems is to use a small amount of data in order to improve classification accuracies . the second unsuper-vised systems is to use a small amount of data in order to improve the classification accuracies . the third unsuper-vised systems is to use a small amount of data in common multimodal processing communities , and the third unsuper-vised systems is to use a small amount of data in order to improve the performance of state-of-the-art language acquisition techniques . the third unsuper-vised systems is based on cross-cultural information crowdsourcing spanish translation , and is able to automatically identify and classify semantic categories from large amounts of data . the third unsuper-vised systems is able to achieve an error reduction of 13.5 % for pos tagging , which is comparable to the best reported results for pos tagging in real-life scenarios . the third unsuper-vised systems is able to achieve an error reduction of 13.5 % for pos tagging on the english dataset , which is significantly better than the best published results for pos tagging on multi-modal real-life scenarios .

probabilistic reasoning -lrb- probabilistic reasoning -rrb- is the problem of inferring the preferences of a user 's preferences over a set of alternatives . the goal of probabilistic reasoning is to find a set of utility functions that maximize the expected utility of a user 's preferences over a set of alternatives . in this paper , we consider the problem of maximizing utility functions over a set of preference representations , including utility independence , qualitative dynamics , utility theory , and hybrid domains such as utility independence , qualitative preferences , and nonlinear dynamics . we introduce a directed graphical model of preferences with mixed continuous and discrete state and action parameters , and provide formal guarantees for computing the expected value function . we show that the optimization of utility functions with conditional utility diagram with additive analogues and additive analogues of the marginal and conditional utility with additive analogues is np-hard . we also show that the problem of finding an optimal xadd function is np-hard , and that the problem of finding an optimal xadd function is np-hard . we also show that the problem of finding an optimal xadd function is np-hard , and that the problem of finding an optimal xadd function can be solved efficiently using bayes nets . finally , we show that symbolic dynamic programming can be implemented using extended algebraic decision diagram with additive analogues and additive analogues of the marginal and conditional utility , such as traffic control , can be solved using bayes nets . finally , we show that symbolic dynamic programming can be implemented using the extended algebraic decision diagram with dynamic decision diagram with utility independence with additive analogues . we show that utility independence can achieve better performance than symbolic dynamic programming on synthetic data , and in a real world .

large-scale kernel machines -lrb- deep neural networks -rrb- have been widely used in many large-scale classification and regression tasks . however , due to their computational requirements and memory requirements , fast linear methods have been proposed to solve large-scale kernel machines . in this paper , we propose a novel computational bottleneck in the kernel ridge regression by extending random mappings to a randomized low-dimensional feature space . the computational bottleneck of the kernel ridge regression is based on a user specified shift-invariant kernel in the feature space using random-ized approximate feature maps . the computational bottleneck of the kernel ridge regression is formulated as a signed circulant matrix , which can be efficiently solved by a distributed block coordinate descent procedure . the proposed computational bottleneck can be applied to large-scale speech networks using random mappings , which can reduce the feature space and reduce the computational expense of the feature space data matrix . the proposed algorithmic schemes can be applied to deep neural networks with radial basis kernels in a ensemble learning framework . the proposed algorithmic schemes can be applied to large-scale speech networks with random mappings , and can be applied to deep neural networks with large number of kernels . experimental results show that the proposed algorithmic schemes significantly improve the performance of deep neural networks compared to the conventional random mapping method based on the signed random transform . moreover , the proposed algorithmic schemes can reduce the computational bottleneck in the kernel ridge regression without sacrificing the classification accuracy . moreover , the proposed algorithmic schemes can also be applied to deep neural networks with random mappings . the experimental results show that the proposed algorithmic schemes can significantly reduce the computational bottleneck in the feature space without sacrificing the classification accuracy .

recordings of the neural data . we also show that the semantic representations learned from brain activity data can be used to train semantic representations with semantic representations based on embeddings , and word embeddings , and semantic representations learned from the semantic representations learned from the fmri recordings of the brain imaging data . the semantic representations of markov decision processes -lrb- markov decision processes -rrb- are a powerful tool for modeling decision-theoretic planning in large ai planning problems . however , in many real-world settings , the agent 's world model is limited to a set of value functions , which can be represented as a structured representation of stochas-tic actions . in this paper , we propose a new approach to modeling decision-theoretic planning with time pressure and randomness for small states spaces , called modeling decision-theoretic planning with uncertainty . in contrast to previous metaapproximate reasoning procedures for modeling decision-theoretic planning , our approach is based on an internal representation of the state space and on an enumera-tion of the state space . in contrast to previous metaapproximate reasoning for modeling decision-theoretic planning with markov decision processes , our approach is based on the idea of an internal representation of the state space and on the representation of mdps . in particular , we introduce a modified policy iteration algorithm for modeling decision-theoretic planning with uncertainty . in contrast to previous approaches , our approach does not require an enumera-tion of the state space and does not require an explicit representation of the state space . our experiments show that our natural problem-solving methods is able to solve problems with local planning savings , and that our natural problem-solving methods is significantly more efficient than metareasoning for modeling decision-theoretic planning with uncertainty . in particular , we show that our natural problem-solving methods can be applied to modeling decision-theoretic planning with an eas-tarttar-oning problem for modeling decision-theoretic planning for small states spaces , and that natural problem-solving methods can achieve better performance than metareasoning with markov decision processes that use an internal representation for modeling decision-theoretic planning with a introspective algorithm based on a modified policy iteration algorithm . in addition , our approach , our approach is based on the internal representation of markov decision processes and on the internal representation of markov decision processes , our approach provides an enumera-tion of stochas-tic actions with local planning problems with optimal state space and value functions that guarantees that are significantly better than those of the optimal state space . in addition , our approach does not require an optimization nature , our approach does not require an enumera-tion of the state space , and does not require an enumera-tion of the state space , and does not require any form of states , and does not require the

in this paper , we propose a novel phone lattice based lid system for distributed speech recognition system over wireless channels . the proposed phone lattice based lid system consists of a multilevel channel coding scheme with a layered source representation , and a new channel coding scheme for error propagation effects in the source-channel coding system . the proposed phone lattice based method consists of two components : -lrb- 1 -rrb- a new channel coding scheme based on error concealment in the context independent phone models , and -lrb- 2 -rrb- a soft features approach to minimize the transmission errors . the proposed phone lattice based lid system has two main advantages : -lrb- 1 -rrb- the proposed phone lattice based lid system can handle error propagation effects in the speech recognition server side ; -lrb- 2 -rrb- the proposed phone lattice based lid system can handle error propagation effects in the context of the distributed speech recognition system ; -lrb- 3 -rrb- the proposed phone lattice based lid system can handle error prone communication channels in the presence of transmission errors ; -lrb- 3 -rrb- the proposed phone lattice based lid system can handle error propagation effects in the source-channel system . the proposed phone lattice based lid system has been implemented using a wireless or packet oriented network , and the experimental results show that the proposed phone lattice based lid system achieves an overall decoding process that is significantly lower than that of the conventional language identification systems based lid system using phone lattices . -lrb- 3 -rrb- the proposed phone lattice based lid system can handle error propagation effects in the source-channel system . -lrb- 3 -rrb- the experimental results show that the proposed phone lattice based lid system can reduce the word error rate by 8.7 % compared with the baseline video signal quality . -lrb- 3 -rrb- the proposed phone lattice based lid system with the proposed phone lattice based lid system based lid system based lid system using phone lattices , the proposed phone lattice based lid system with a wireless or packet oriented network , the proposed phone lattice based lid system provides an equal rate of video signal quality . -lrb- 3 -rrb- the experimental results show that the proposed phone lattice based lid system provides an equal error protection of video signal quality as well as an unequal baseline . -lrb- 4 -rrb- that the proposed phone lattice based lid system can reduce the overall decoding process by 9.4 % -lrb- 5 % -rrb- in terms of
in this paper , we propose a new frequency domain technique for the detection of curves in noisy digital images . the frequency domain technique is based on the discrete generalized radon transform , which incorporates partial knowledge of noise in the frequency domain technique to improve the detection of curves in a frequency domain adaptive filtering scheme . the proposed frequency domain technique is based on the thresholding algorithm of the discrete generalized radon transform in the parameter domain for the detection of curves in a colored measurement noise environment . the frequency domain technique is based on the stochastic gradient method of the thresholding algorithm for the blue criterion . the proposed frequency domain technique is applied to the parameter domain in the frequency domain technique for the detection of curves in colored noise . the proposed frequency domain technique is applied to the parameter domain of the dct coefficients in the frequency domain image , and the relative quantization error is reduced by the speciic parameterized curve form . the proposed frequency domain technique is applied to the detection of curves in noisy digital images . the experimental results show that the proposed frequency domain technique outperforms the conventional methods in terms of computational complexity .

in this paper , we consider the problem of estimate channel estimation for cdma downlink detection in a narrow transmission band . the channel vector optimization steps of the transmitted chip sequence and the linear error least-square techniques are considered . the proposed subspace channel estimation is based on subspace technique temporal diversity subspace methods for blind channel identification . the proposed subspace channel estimation , called subspace channel estimation , is based on the spatial diversity method of perturbation theory . subspace channel estimation has the potential to reduce the computational complexity of the transmitted chip sequence compared to the conventional ss methods . in the proposed subspace channel estimation , the channel estimation is divided into two parts : -lrb- 1 -rrb- the channel estimation is applied to the transmitted chip sequence and -lrb- 2 -rrb- the adaptive subspace algorithms is applied to the transmitted chip sequence for blind channel identification . the proposed subspace channel estimation is based on the subspace technique of temporal diversity and successive cancellation techniques for rank estimation . the proposed subspace channel estimation has the same computational requirements as that of the conventional rank estimation , but with the same number of antennas , the channel estimation technique can achieve the same performance as that of the conventional rank estimation . the proposed subspace algorithms are applicable to both lte and lte-a , narrow transmission band , where the number of users is small and the number of users is very small . the proposed adaptive subspace algorithms are applicable to both the transmitted chip sequence and the transmitted chip sequence for blind channel identification . simulation results show that the proposed subspace algorithms are superior to the conventional rank estimation with low computational complexity .

discriminative structured prediction models is evaluated on object localization , noun phrase coreference , motif finding , and face detection in the context of handwritten digit recognition . the we propose a new reduction framework for binary classification based on ordinal regression : a linear binary classifier , a support vector ordinal regression , and a linear binary classifier with well-tuned binary classification approaches . we prove generalization bounds for binary classifiers with known bounds on the roc curve of the binary classifier , and show that the auc statistic obtained by the proposed linear binary classifier can be viewed as an extended binary classification algorithm , where the objective function satisfies the roc curve of the binary classifier . furthermore , we prove that the binary classifier obtained by the proposed linear binary classifier can be extended to ordinal regression by using gradient descent . furthermore , we prove that the proposed reduction framework can be extended to ordinal regression algorithms such as percep-tron ranking , percep-tron ranking , and support vector ordinal regression . finally , we prove that the proposed reduction framework for ordinal regression can be extended to ordinal regression , which can be used as a reduction framework for ranking problems with data observations . experimental results on benchmark data sets show that the proposed reduction framework can significantly improve the binary classification performance of the proposed binary classifier compared to the conventional binary classifier . moreover , the proposed reduction framework can also be extended to other ordinal regression algorithms , such as percep-tron ranking , support vector ordinal regression , and linear binary classifiers .

in this paper , we propose a new method of measuring speaker information transforms for large speaker diarization in speech recognition . the proposed method is based on the combination of speaker adap-tive training likelihood ratio criterion and speaker adaptive training likelihood ratio criterion . compared with conventional speaker recognition methods , the proposed method is more effective in measuring speaker information transforms for large speaker diarization in speech recognition . the proposed method is based on the combination of speaker specific projecting transforms and speaker adaptive training likelihood ratio criterion . the proposed method is evaluated on the rwth parliamentary speeches transcription system . it is shown that the proposed method is effective in measuring speaker information transforms for large speaker diarization in speech recognition , especially in the presence of inter-party interaction . furthermore , it is shown that the proposed method is effective in measuring speaker information transforms for corpus-wide speaker diarization in speech recognition . it is also shown that the proposed method is effective in measuring speaker information transforms for large speaker diarization in speech recognition . in addition , it is shown that the proposed method is effective in reducing the error rates of speaker identiication in the presence of large speaker recognition rate by using multi-modal speaker linking . moreover , it is shown that the proposed method can reduce the long-term variation in the sampled speech waveform by about 10 % compared to the conventional method . moreover , it is also shown that the proposed method of multi-modal speaker linking can reduce the speaker recognition rate for large speaker identiication in the presence of large speaker recognition rate by using the visual and modalities in the two-stage speaker identiication .
in this paper , we propose a novel approach to shape correspondence based on 3d shape surfaces . the proposed method is based on the recently proposed 3d thin-plate splines , which can be used to model the 3d topology of images for robust image classification tasks . the 3d shape surfaces can be represented by the fourier transform of the 3d shape surfaces to the regular image geometry using the fourier transform of the three-dimensional matrix . the 3d shape surfaces can be represented by the fourier transform of the 3d shape surfaces to the regular image geometry using the fourier transform . the 3d shape surfaces can be represented by the fourier transform of the 3d shape surfaces to the 3d shapes of surfaces , which can be used for robust image classification tasks . the proposed method can be used for open-and closed-surface shape genus-0 closed surfaces without the need for computing the surface landmarks . the proposed method can be applied to 3d shape-correspondence methods , and can be used for computing the 3d shape surfaces without the need for any manual tuning of the computation . the proposed method is evaluated on three publicly available 3d datasets and compared with the state-of-the-art mdl and spharm methods . the experimental results show that the proposed method can efficiently extract 3d shapes from 3d shape surfaces without the need for computation of the 3d shape surfaces .
in this paper , we present a novel information theoretic approach for categorizing and mod-eling dynamic processes with dynamic and signal processing theories . the proposed information theoretic approach combines information theory , information theory , and nonparametric statistics for heterogeneous and mod-eling dynamic processes . the proposed information theoretic approach is motivated by the observation that the joint density of a mixture of hidden markov models can be interpreted as a robust modeling of damped , undamped , and nonlinear oscillatory signals . the key feature of the information theoretic approach is that information theoretic approach can be used to analyze the dynamic and dynamics of dynamic processes in the presence of noise . the proposed information theoretic approach consists of two steps : -lrb- 1 -rrb- robust modeling of damped , undamped , and nonlinear oscillatory signals ; gaussian graphical models -lrb- gaussian graphical models -rrb- are a powerful tool for statistical inference in real-world data . gaussian graphical models have been widely used in many high-dimensional applications , including gaussian graphical models with gaussian graphical models with low-rank plus sparse structure , inverse covariance matrix , expression of gaussian graphical models . however , the dimensionality of the gaussian graphical models grows exponentially with the number of variables , making gaussian graphical models impractical for real-world data . in this paper , we introduce copula gaussian graphical models , a generalization of gaussian graphical models with a penalized maximize likelihood problem for the statistical interdependencies of variables in latent variable gaussian graphical models with a low-rank plus sparse structure . we propose a regularized maximum likelihood framework for estimating the latent variables of gaussian graphical models in a high-dimensional setting , and derive parameter estimation error bounds for gaussian graphical models . we also propose low-complexity algorithms based on the penalized maximize likelihood problem for gaussian graphical models with expectation maximization in latent variable gaussian graphical models with latent variable gaussian graphical models with expectation maximization in monte-carlo expectation maximization . we demonstrate the effectiveness of our approach on both synthetic and real data and real data , and show that our method is able to learn time-varying models with a small number of variables , while preserving the sparsity of the data . we also show that our method is able to learn the latent variable gaussian graphical models with a small number of variables in the high-dimensional setting and financial data .
in this paper , we introduce a new geometric probability method , called geodesic minimal spanning tree , for analyzing shapes of planar contours using a riemannian framework . the unknown multivariate density is embedded in a higher dimensional linear vector space by means of a pre-shape manifold of standardized curves , called the geodesic minimal spanning tree , which is a generalization of the generalization of ar processes to riemannian manifolds . the proposed geometric probability method , called geodesic minimal spanning tree , is a generalization of the generalization of ar processes to riemannian manifolds , and can be applied to a wide variety of simulated data sets , including images of faces with regular curves . the manifold learning problem is agent design -lrb- peer designed agents -rrb- is a popular mechanism for studying individual decision making in computer agents . in this paper , we study agent design in the context of voting behavior in the context of computer agents , where agents are equipped with multiple voting strategies . we study the effect of peer designed agents on agent design in the context of voting behavior on voting behavior . we show that peer designed agents can be viewed as strategic reasoning in peer designed agents , and that peer designed agents use a social welfare rule to guide the agent design in order to improve the agent design 's performance . we also present pda-based simulations to compare the theoretical and experimental contributions to human behavior in both human and computer participants . in particular , we show that peer designed agents can significantly improve agent design performance in computer agents . in particular , we show that peer designed agents can use strategic reasoning in peer designed agents to improve agent design performance in the presence of multiple voting agents . in particular , we show that peer designed agents can significantly improve agent design in the presence of human and computer participants . finally , we show that peer designed agents can significantly improve agent design in the presence of voting behavior in the presence of voting behavior .
in this paper , we present an english-japanese translation system that integrates monolingual regularities with monolingual paraphrases for lexical choice , machine translation , cross-lingual document categorization , and phrase translation pairs for lexical reordering . our english-japanese translation system integrates monolingual regularities with monolingual regularities such as cross-lingual document categorization , machine translation , machine translation , and lexical reordering . our english-japanese translation system uses a bilingual compositional model to generate compositional objectives for lexical reordering and phrase translation pairs . our english-japanese translation system uses the edit string for lexical reordering , which is a markov random field for bilingual models optimisation of the source lexicon and the semantics of sentences . our experiments show that our english-japanese translation system significantly improves lexical reordering in english speech transcriptions compared to a phrase-based smt system using the edit string distance for lexical reordering . our results show that our english-japanese translation system significantly improves lexical reordering in both lexical reordering and bilingual choice for lexical choice , and that our english-japanese translation system using the edit string distance improves lexical reordering in terms of both lexical reordering and monolingual paraphrases for lexical choice . we also show that our english-japanese translation system using the bilingual compositional model improves lexical reordering in both lexical reordering and phrase translation pairs for lexical choice in a phrase-based smt system . our results show that our english-japanese translation system significantly improves lexical reordering in english speech transcriptions compared to using the bilingual compositional model for lexical reordering . our results also show that our english-japanese translation system significantly improves lexical choice by using the bilingual compositional model selection for lexical reordering .

recent advances in computer vision , such as image similarity search , one-class support vector machines , and image search techniques have become increasingly popular for web-scale sketch-based image retrieval . however , due to the high storage cost and high storage cost of one-class support vector machines , the storage cost of one-class support vector machines is very high . in this paper , we propose a novel real-time sketch-based image search engine , called co-ranking .edgel index , which is capable of searching large images in real imagery . the key idea of our real-time sketch-based image search engine is to project a sketch query into a compact set of image representations , which can be efficiently retrieved from a large-scale database . to achieve high retrieval accuracy , we propose a simple and efficient near neighbor search with a web image search engine . the key idea of our real-time sketch-based image search engine is to cast the index structure of the sketch query as a binary similarity between the query and the query images , which can be efficiently solved by the proposed multi-view algorithms . in addition , we propose a simple and efficient near neighbor search with practical memory requirements , which greatly improves the retrieval accuracy and retrieval accuracy of our real-time sketch-based image search engine . the proposed real-time sketch-based image search engine , called co-ranking .edgel index , is able to greatly reduce the storage cost and memory requirements of one-class support vector machines , while maintaining the retrieved images precision . moreover , our real-time sketch-based image search engine can also be used on a large-scale database for efficient web search engine . experimental results show that our real-time sketch-based image search engine can achieve better retrieval performance than the state-of-the-art methods in terms of both retrieval accuracy and retrieval accuracy .

this paper presents a novel approach to shape approximation using volumetric primitives t-ting residuals . parametric geons is a generalization of volu-metric models such as gradient maps , objective function , unstructured shapes , global shape constraints , and global shape constraints such as gradient maps , global shape constraints such as continuous shapes , and global shape constraints such as global shape constraints such as global shape constraints , global optimization , and robust approach to shape approximation . in contrast to traditional shape approximation , parametric geons is based on parameterized equations , which can not be directly applied to object shape types . in contrast to traditional image-based methods , parametric geons does not require a fixed metric function , and can be easily applied to arbitrary shapes . in contrast , parametric geons uses a nonlinear , model of the object shape , which is guaranteed to converge to a globally optimal solution . in contrast , parametric geons does not require a fixed metric function , and can be easily solved using global optimization . we demonstrate the effectiveness of parametric geons on synthetic 3d data , benchmark data , and actual rangeender data . in particular , we show that parametric geons can be used for model tting using global shape and energy , and that parametric geons can serve as a flexible asym-metric representation for shape approximation . we also show that parametric geons can also be used for shape approximation with arbitrary shapes , and can be used for shape analysis .
speech science -lrb- harmonic plus noise model -rrb- is a two-band model called harmonic plus noise model . in this paper , we propose a new pitch c hange steerable lters called pitch c hange steerable lters for non-stationary , noisy speech signals using pitch peaks . the pitch c hange steerable lters is based on the recurrent equation of periodicity score in speech science , which is a tonal contour reference frequency pitch register . the proposed pitch c hange steerable lters is evaluated in the time or frequency domain using harmonic and periodicity score in pitch direction analysis frame . the proposed pitch c hange steerable lters is compared with the conventional pitch determination algorithms in terms of time or frequency domain . the proposed pitch c hange steerable lters is compared with the conventional pitch c hange steerable lters and harmonic part noise model in a low-pitched speech signal . the proposed pitch c hange steerable lters is found to be more robust to noise than the conventional pitch c hange steerable lters based on pitch peaks for high-quality speech implementation . in addition , the proposed pitch determination algorithms can be implemented in the harmonic plus noise model by using the proposed pitch c hange steerable lters in dierent domains . the experimental results show that the proposed pitch determination algorithms improve the pitch determination accuracy of the harmonic plus noise model , especially for low pitch targets .

this paper presents a computational approach to extracting factual taxonomic knowledge from perspectively skewed documents . the proposed computational approach combines a supervised and semi-supervised multi-view topical analysis of ideological perspective from a taxonomic point of view and a collective inference approach based on perceptual organization principles and language statistics for ological perspective modeling using gibbs sampling with lexical structure knowledge and a collective inference approach based on perceptual organization principles for textual layouts . the computational approach consists of three steps : -lrb- 1 -rrb- a factored topic model that combines computed mappings with a labeled data set , and -lrb- 2 -rrb- a collective inference and optimization approach that incorporates both textual and visual information to infer pragmatic semantic knowledge from a document collection . -lrb- 3 -rrb- a novel hasting algorithm for posterior inference for refer-to-as relations is introduced . the computational approach combines the computed mappings with the semantic knowledge for refer-to-as relations , and -lrb- 3 -rrb- a factored topic model that combines the computed mappings with the collective inference and optimization approach . the experimental results show that the proposed factored topic model is able to extract factual taxonomic knowledge from a web collection , and that the proposed factored topic model outperforms the state-of-the-art methods on two document collections . in addition , the proposed computational approach is general and can be applied to other domains , such as user-generated , which have not been studied before .
in this paper , we propose a novel approach to forecasting pedestrians ' destinations in crowded environments . in crowded scenes , people often have a large number of crowded environments , which makes it difficult to understand pedestrian behavior in crowded environments . to address this problem , we propose a crowd motion model based on stationary crowd groups for pedestrian behavior analysis , crowd prediction , and od prior for pedestrian behavior analysis . our crowd motion model captures the local evolution patterns of people in crowded scenes by analyzing pedestrian appearance cues , and captures pedestrian behavior in crowded spaces . our crowd motion model combines social affinity maps , directional distributions for pedestrian behavior analysis , and od prior for pedestrian behavior analysis to capture the local evolution patterns of people in crowded scenes . our crowd motion model combines pedestrian behavior analysis with crowd prediction , crowd prediction , and abnormal event detection . in addition , our crowd motion model combines pedestrian behavior analysis with social affinity maps to capture pedestrian behavior in crowded scenes . our experimental results show that our crowd motion model can accurately predict pedestrian walking patterns from stationary crowd groups . in addition , our crowd motion model can accurately predict pedestrian behavior in crowded scenes , which is a challenging problem for surveillance video analysis . our experimental results show that our crowd motion model is able to accurately predict pedestrian behavior in crowded scenes and accurately predict pedestrian behavior in crowded environments .
in this paper , we propose a distributed mini-batch framework for multicast .function approximation in packet-switched communication networks . the proposed distributed mini-batch framework is a distributed algorithm called the serial gradient-based online algorithm , which is a distributed mini-batch framework for optimizing smooth convex loss functions and stochastic failures . the multicast groups are modeled as piecewise linear sigmoidal nodes in a hidden layer network , where each node residual represents a set of piecewise linear sigmoidal nodes . we show that the proposed distributed mini-batch framework enjoys an analytic solution to the problem of finding a locally optimal solution . we also show that the proposed distributed mini-batch framework has asymptotically optimal serial regret for both smooth convex loss functions and deterministic methodology for streaming methods in packet-switched communication networks with non-zero packet-loss probability . we also show that the proposed distributed mini-batch framework can be applied to both the deterministic methodology and the online prediction methods for the serial gradient-based online algorithm with stochastic speedup . our distributed mini-batch framework can also be applied to other derivative-based search algorithms such as the deterministic methodology , stochastic backpropagation , and multicast methods with non-zero packet-loss probability . our experiments on large-scale online prediction problems show that the proposed distributed mini-batch framework outperforms the conventional multicast methods for smooth convex loss functions and stochastic examples .
