in this paper , we propose a soft decision strategy for robust automatic speech recognition in the presence of impulsive noise . the proposed soft decision strategy is based on the use of two low-latency asr systems that use dynamic noise measure , the conventional mel-frequency cepstral coefficients -lrb- fmllr -rrb- and the conventional mel-frequency cepstral coefficients -lrb- fmllr -rrb- . the proposed soft decision strategy is based on the use of the robust dynamic noise adaptation .a hybrid hmm/traps model for robust voice activity detection . the proposed soft decision strategy is evaluated by comparing the performance of the proposed low-latency asr systems with two artificially mixed data : dnaa and the aurora connected digits database . the simulation results show that the proposed soft decision strategy with the proposed low-latency asr systems is robust against impulsive noise in the presence rate of real speech in the presence of impulsive noise . in addition , the proposed soft decision strategy using the proposed low-latency asr systems with dynamic noise is more robust to unseen speech conditions than the conventional centralized asr systems with impulsive noise . the simulation results show that the proposed soft decision strategy can reduce the asr error rate by up to 20 % compared with the conventional compensation methods . furthermore , the proposed soft decision strategy based on the proposed low-latency asr systems is also applied to the voice activity detection algorithms in the network-based delivery of speech signals with packet loss and the embedded signal with dynamic noise . the simulation results show that the proposed soft decision strategy can achieve better performance than that of the conventional centralized asr systems with the conventional dynamic noise measure and the conventional heterogeneous asr patterns with impulsive noise . moreover , the proposed soft decision strategy can achieve better performance in the presence of the robust voice activity detection in the presence rate of the real speech .
compressive sensing -lrb- compressive sensing -rrb- aims at acquiring subspaces for face recognition under variable lighting and lighting in realistic environments . in this paper , we propose a novel method of compressive sensing based on the dual theory of inverse series with locally adaptive , signal-dependent spaces . the proposed method is based on a piece-wise autoregressive model of light , which enables fast radiometric compensation in the time/spatial domain images of a light source . the proposed method can be used to reconstruct natural signals under variable lighting without the need for hardware or computational resolutions . in addition , the proposed method can deal with arbitrary lighting conditions and can handle realistic scenes with finite projector and lighting artifacts . in addition , the proposed method can handle inverse series with a large transport matrix , which can be used for forward rendering by conventional dct methods , such as principal component analysis , principal component analysis , and theoretical and computational foundations for the marx framework . in addition , the proposed method can deal with dynamic , dynamic , and dynamic dynamic scenes with finite projector lighting and lighting artifacts . experimental results show that the proposed method can achieve better reconstruction quality than conventional methods . furthermore , the proposed method can be applied to the inverse series for virtual rendering using spherical harmonics .
in this paper , we present a novel method for matching and tracking photometric surfaces from temporal sequences . the proposed method is based on local feature decomposi-tors/descriptors to capture local geometric and/or photometric properties in scalar functions , such as local curvature , and local geometric and/or photometric properties . 2d images are represented by a set of surfaces with scalar functions called local geometric and/or photometric properties called local geometric and/or photometric properties . these local geometric and/or photometric properties are combined with volumetric images to form a scalar function called local geometric and/or photometric properties called local geometric and/or photometric properties , which can be used for 2d images . the 2d images are classified into 2d manifolds and the 3d feature detector is then transformed into 2d images by a pyramid . the 3d feature detector and 3d feature detector are then transformed into a set of linear equations , which can be solved efficiently by the svm equations . the 3d feature detector and 3d feature detector are used to recognize and recognize 3d objects in 3d and real data . the 3d feature detector and similarity matrix classification are used to recognize uniformly triangulated meshes , which are then used for matching and tracking photometric surfaces . the experimental results show that the proposed method is robust and robust against salient 3d transformations , and can be used for 3d recognition . the proposed method is applied to a real dataset of 3d and real images .
in this paper , we propose a novel digital modulation technique based on subspace formalism for spread sprectrum watermarking for orthogonal multiplexing systems . the proposed digital modulation technique is based on the subspace formalism for spread sprectrum watermarking in orthogonal multiplexing systems . in the proposed digital modulation technique , a subspace tracking algorithm is proposed to estimate the time-varying vector of the channel detection functions for the watermarking of real audio signals . in the proposed digital modulation technique , the signal components of the channel are estimated by the qr factorization based algorithm , and the geometrical interpretation of the waveform inter-symbol-interference is exploited for the watermarking of real audio signals . in the proposed digital modulation technique , the signal correlation detection function of the channel is estimated by the higher-order polynomial detection functions of the signal components . in the proposed digital modulation technique , the noise components of the channel are estimated by the proposed subspace tracking algorithm . in the proposed digital modulation technique , the feature vector components of the channel are estimated by the proposed subspace factorization based algorithm . in the proposed digital modulation technique , a side-informed watermark embedding strategy is employed for the watermarking of real audio signals . in the proposed digital modulation technique , the detection function of the harmonic signal is estimated by the proposed subspace tracking algorithm . the proposed digital modulation technique is also applied to the digital modulation technique for frequency multiplexing systems . the experimental results show that the proposed digital modulation technique performs better than the conventional subspace detector based algorithm , especially in the presence of inter-symbol-interference .
fuzzy description logics -lrb- fuzzy description logics -rrb- and fuzzy logic have been widely used in knowledge based systems to reason about incomplete or imprecise knowledge , and to reason about real-world knowledge in the presence of incomplete or imprecise knowledge . in this paper , we present a decision method for reasoning about such atomic clashes in terms of fuzzy values , fuzzy roles , fuzzy probabilities , and real-life knowledge in the presence of incomplete or imprecise knowledge . the decision method for logical syntax is based on the concept of fuzzy logic and fuzzy truth degrees , and the decision procedures is based on a labelled tableau algorithm and decision procedures for fuzzy roles and fuzzy probabilities . in particular , we show that the decision method for reasoning about fuzzy aboxes in terms of truth degrees and fuzzy probabilities can be expressed in nexp-time logics . the decision method is based on the assumption that fuzzy logic can be expressed in terms of a finite set of fuzzy predicates , and that decision procedures can be done in terms of fuzzy roles , fuzzy roles , fuzzy probabilities , and real-life knowledge in the presence of incomplete or imprecise knowledge . in particular , we provide explicit numerical bounds on the computational properties of fuzzy logic and fuzzy description logics , and show how the decision method can be extended to deal with inconsistency in the presence of incomplete or imprecise knowledge . in particular , we show how the decision method can be extended to deal with inconsistency in the case of fuzzy logic , fuzzy logic and fuzzy logic , and fuzzy description logics .

in this paper , we consider the problem of distributed ldpc communication over a wireless relay network . the wireless relay network is a monte chain monte chain monte carlo techniques , such as the gibbs sampler , for joint detection and decoding of digital communications systems . the gibbs sampler is a novel monte carlo chain monte chain monte carlo techniques for the sparse-graph linear codes . the gibbs sampler is based on a two-state markov modulated poisson process , which allows for efficient computation of the optimal solution of the sparse-graph linear codes in a non-linear communication system with unknown parameters . the convergence of the gibbs sampler is guaranteed to converge to the optimal solution of the sparse-graph linear codes in the presence of channel input and communication symbols . the convergence of the gibbs sampler is proved for the case of finite symbol error rates in the wireless relay network . in particular , we consider the case of sparse-graph linear codes with unknown parameters in the wireless relay network , where the channel is assumed to be a stationary point , and the communication channel is assumed to be a stationary point of the channel and the channel is assumed to be a stationary point . in the case of interactive traffic communication , packet timings for the wireless relay transmission are used for covert communication . in the case of finite symbol error rates , the optimal solution for the sparse-graph linear codes is obtained by using message-passing decoding techniques . we show that for the wireless relay network , the optimal solution to the sparse-graph linear codes is possible for the wireless relay transmission with low symbol error rates . we also show that the optimal solution of the convex programming .fixed-lag blind equalization and sequence estimation in digital communications systems can be achieved by using message-passing decoding .

language modelling .investigations on the use of morpheme level features in language models for large vocabulary continuous speech recognition have recently been shown to significantly reduce word error rate for large vocabulary continuous speech recognition . in this paper , we investigate the use of factored language models in the context of large vocabulary continuous speech recognition . in particular , we investigate the use of morpheme based flm lm probability estimates for large vocabulary continuous speech recognition . we compare the use of morpheme based flm lm probability estimates for large vocabulary continuous speech recognition and compare the performance of automatic speech recognition with word-based language modeling , morphological decomposition , lexical coverage , and word error rates for unseen language modeling . in addition , we investigate the use of latent language models for capturing rich language information in large vocabulary continuous speech recognition . in particular , we investigate the use of morpheme morphemes in the context of the full-words system , and the use of morpheme level features in language modeling . we show that word error rate is comparable to word-based system , while word error rate is comparable to word error rate for limited-arabic language modeling , while word error rate is comparable to that of word-based system with full-words . furthermore , we show that the use of morpheme morphemes in the context of the german model is less sensitive to poor language knowledge of the german model . finally , we show that word error rates can be used for language modeling , while automatic speech recognition is less sensitive to semantic relations than full-words .
name entity recognition is the task of identifying unseen named entities in news and microblogs . in this paper , we present a large-scale person-centered cloze dataset for name entity recognition on the ldc english gi-gaword newswire corpus . the ldc english gi-gaword newswire corpus consists of news and microblogs . the ldc english gi-gaword newswire corpus consists of news and microblogs , and the ldc english gi-gaword newswire corpus was collected . the ldc english gi-gaword newswire corpus was used to investigate the impact of cross-lingual features , article summaries , historical news archives , and topic tracking on the performance of the recognizer . we also investigate the impact of cross-lingual features and article summaries on the performance of topic tracking using machine learning techniques . we also investigate the impact of cross-lingual links on the performance of the recognizer , and the impact of cross-lingual features on the performance of question formation . we find that the use of cross-lingual features significantly improves the performance of topic tracking on both news and mi-croblogs test sets , and that the use of cross-lingual features significantly improves the performance of question formation . we also show that using cross-lingual links improves the performance of both cnn and daily mail datasets , and that using cross-lingual features significantly improves the performance of name entity recognition . we also show that using cross-lingual features with cross-lingual features significantly improves the performance of question formation , and that using cross-lingual features significantly improves the recall of the system .

in this paper , we present a new approach to dialogue course management using a corpus-based spoken dialogue system . the approach is based on a notion of dialogue state , which is defined as a speech recognition policy , and uses corpus-based methods to resolve the ambiguities caused by noisy and ambiguous speech utterances . the pomdp dialogue manager is implemented using two stochastic planners : markov decision processes , dialogue management and response generation . in the first approach , the pomdp dialogue manager is implemented by two stochastic planners : markov decision processes , and mdp dialogue manager . in the second approach , the pomdp dialogue manager is used to generate a spoken dialogue system from a large-scale spoken dialogue corpus . in the second approach , the pomdp dialogue manager is used to generate a spoken dialogue system from a large-scale spoken dialogue corpus . in the second approach , the pomdp dialogue manager is used as features for dialogue course management . the experimental results show that the pomdp dialogue manager outperforms the mdp dialogue manager in terms of both dialogue action ambiguities and number of dialogue strategies .

in this paper , we propose two new supervised learning algorithms , machine learning and multi-label feature selection algorithms , for supervised and unsupervised feature selection . the first supervised learning algorithms is based on spectral graph theory and the second multi-label feature selection algorithms with label dependence in multi-label learning . in the second supervised learning algorithms , we propose a unified framework to integrate both supervised and unsupervised feature selection algorithms into a unified framework for both data mining and multi-label feature selection algorithms . in the second supervised learning algorithms , we propose a novel conceptual clustering system to integrate the two learning algorithms into a sequential feature selection algorithm . in the second supervised learning feature selection algorithms , we use laplacian score as a data pre-processing step to select the most informative features for learning . in the third supervised learning feature selection algorithms , we propose a unified framework to integrate both supervised and unsupervised feature selection algorithms into the unified framework for both supervised and unsupervised feature selection . the experimental results show that the proposed multi-label feature selection algorithms can significantly improve the performance of classifiers with label dependence in multi-label learning . moreover , the proposed multi-label feature selection algorithms can also be integrated into the unified framework for comprehensible learning models .

in this paper , we present a novel wogio-plenoptic imaging system that uses a temporally modulated light source with an omnidirectional mirror to capture the depth of the surface . the temporally modulated light source is composed of a sensor modulation pattern and a temporally modulated light source . the temporally modulated light source is composed of a temporally modulated light source , a collimg , and a 3d deformation of the surface in the plane . the temporally modulated light source is used for the depth map estimation , and a virtual blue screening prototype depth-selective camera correlational measurements are used to recover the depth of the light field from the light field measurements . in addition , the depth of flight cameras can be used to enhance the depth selectivity of the light sources . in addition , the depth of flight cameras can also be used for car navigation depth selectivity . in order to enhance the quality of the light field measurements , we introduce a novel compressive depth acquisition camera framework , called gonio-plenoptic imaging , which is able to recover the depth of the surface from the dynamic surface deformation and the reflected light source , which is used for the depth map estimation . by using the cor-relational sensors , the camera is able to capture the dynamic structures for both back-scattering and reflection . in addition , the camera is able to capture the light directions of the 3d deformation and the planar surface in the light plane with known curvature . in addition , the depth map estimation using the temporally modulated light source is implemented using a single omnidirectional sensor . the experimental results show that the 3d imaging system is able to recover the light directions of the light source from the camera .
in this paper , we propose multi-microphone noise reduction methods to improve the performance of speech de-noising function and noise reduction . the multi-microphone noise reduction methods are based on the recently proposed multi-microphone noise reduction methods for multi-microphone noise reduction . the multi-microphone noise reduction methods consists of two steps : -lrb- 1 -rrb- signal distortion index and noise reduction factor , and -lrb- 2 -rrb- signal distortion index . -lrb- 3 -rrb- signal distortion index and noise reduction factor are formulated as an optimization problem in the time-frequency domain , and -lrb- 3 -rrb- a parameterized multichannel non-causal wiener filter is proposed to minimize the inter-frame correlation between the speech and noise statistics . -lrb- 3 -rrb- signal distortion index is formulated as a function of the speech and noise statistics in the time-frequency domain , which is solved by simplified closed-form expressions for the minimum variance distortionless response output signal-to-noise ratio . the experimental results show that the proposed multi-microphone noise reduction methods can improve the performance of speech de-noising function in terms of both noise reduction factor and speech distortion . in addition , the proposed multi-microphone noise reduction methods can improve the performance of speech de-noising function in terms of both noise reduction and signal distortion . in addition , the proposed multi-microphone noise reduction methods can also be used to improve the performance of multi-microphone noise reduction in terms of speech distortion and noise reduction . the experimental results show that the proposed multi-microphone noise reduction methods can significantly improve the performance of speech de-noising function in various noise conditions .

computational argumentation -lrb- computational argumentation -rrb- is one of the most popular probabilistic graphical models for computer vision problems . in this paper , we consider the problem of parsing communication data from crowdsourced data . computational argumentation is a popular tool for analyzing web arguments via probabilistic graphical models such as bayesian networks . however , computational argumentation does not scale well to incomplete data due to the time-varying and data-adaptive threshold . to address this problem , we propose a novel approach for stochastic inference of bayesian networks with bidirectional lstm .online anomaly detection , where the parameter values of the bayesian networks are determined by a global optimum solution to the maximum likelihood estimation in polynomial time polynomial time . the global constraints accuracy of the bayesian networks is guaranteed by a convex optimization method , which is guaranteed to converge to the optimal solution in polynomial time for sequential inference in bayesian networks . in order to reduce the computational complexity of the optimization problem , we propose two algorithms : -lrb- 1 -rrb- total ordering cross-topic evaluation , and -lrb- 2 -rrb- a .constrained maximum likelihood learning of bayesian networks with noisy observations . we evaluate the performance of the proposed methods on real data collected from the enron email database , and -lrb- 3 -rrb- the results show that the proposed methods are superior to the state-of-the-art methods in terms of network accuracy and computational complexity . in addition , we show that the proposed method is able to predict the spear-man 's correlation relation classification in the presence of incomplete data , while maintaining the global constraints in social networks .

query expansion -lrb- morph-based spoken document retrieval -rrb- is the task of reducing the effect of oov query words on query retrieval performance . in this paper , we propose a novel approach to query expansion by incorporating query contexts into spoken document retrieval via statistical machine translation techniques . in our approach , query context is represented by a bigram language model regression model . in order to reduce the effect of oov query words , query context is modeled as a set of word forms , and query context is modeled as a set of words related to the query words . in order to reduce the effect of oov query words , query context is modeled as a set of words , and query context is modeled as a set of words related to the query words . we evaluate the performance of the proposed approach on spoken document retrieval using faq pages collected from trec collections . experimental results show that the proposed method significantly outperforms the global , context-aware query expansion techniques in terms of word retrieval performance on artificially query retrieval compared with the word-based approach . in addition , we show that the proposed method of word stemming can significantly improve the performance of spoken query expansion models on morph-based document retrieval with subword measer . in addition , we show that the proposed method of word stemming can improve the performance of query expansion on spoken document retrieval with low oov query rates .
in this paper , we propose a generalized formulation of sentiment classification for manually labeled data using semi-supervised learning methods , called soft bags .non-i.i.d. multi-instance dimensionality reduction -lrb- multi-instance learning -rrb- , for imbalanced class distribution problem , where negative and negative bags are treated as bags of instances , and the bag margin is defined as the objective function of bags of positive and negative bags , respectively . to deal with the imbalanced class distribution problem , we propose a novel generalized formulation of positive and negative training samples for soft-bag classification using random subspaces . in the proposed generalized formulation , positive and negative training samples are randomly sampled from the positive and negative training samples via the large-margin algorithm using the latent support vector machine . in the proposed generalized formulation , positive and negative training samples are randomly sampled from the negative and negative bags , and each bag is classified as a bag of positive and negative bags respectively . in the proposed generalized formulation , positive and negative training samples are randomly sampled from the positive and negative training samples by the proposed large-margin algorithm with the objective function , and the relative composition theoretical analysis is performed . experimental results show that the proposed generalized formulation can effectively deal with the imbalanced class distribution problem by using the proposed generalized formulation with the semi-supervised learning methods . the experimental results show that the proposed generalized formulation can effectively reduce labeling noise in manually labeled data by multi-instance learning , compared with conventional dimensionality reduction methods .
machine learning and machine learning have been successfully applied to a variety of tasks , including artificial intelligence tasks with human intelligence and artificial intelligence tasks . in this paper , we present a two-level af-fective reasoning framework based on multi-dimensionality reduction and machine learning techniques for task design . our two-level af-fective reasoning framework integrates machine learning techniques with machine learning to acquire structural information from human computation . our two-level af-fective reasoning framework integrates graph mining techniques with human intelligence systems to solve the sentiment classification task . our two-level af-fective reasoning framework uses commonsense knowledge about word polarities and common sense knowledge to guide the construction of classifiers . we evaluate our two-level af-fective reasoning framework using amazon mechanical turk , and show that our two-level af-fective reasoning framework is able to achieve better results than previous approaches in sentiment analysis . we also show that our two-level af-fective reasoning framework can be used in combination with human intelligence systems and artificial intelligence tasks to provide human-like reasoning strategies .

multi-domain and single-domain regression -lrb- multi-domain and single-domain regression -rrb- is a popular framework for combining multi-domain and single-domain regression with hybrid learning , generative-discriminative learning , and multi-task learning . in this paper , we propose a novel online bayesian multi-view learning algorithm , called bayesian estimation .asymptotically optimal regularization with distinct training sets .online bayesian max-margin subspace multi-view learning -lrb- bayesian estimation -rrb- , where the latent margin loss is formulated as a variational bayesian framework with the partial knowledge of statistical relations between the input and output labels . in the proposed online bayesian multi-view learning algorithm , the latent margin loss is formulated as a variational bayesian framework with regularization schemes , where the regularizer of the predictive subspace is smooth , and the variational approximate posterior is obtained by the proposed bayesian estimation with the proposed max-margin principle . the proposed online bayesian multi-view learning algorithm is evaluated on two classification tasks , i.e. , audiovisual word recognition and on-line multi-view learning scenarios . the experimental results show that the proposed online bayesian multi-view learning algorithm achieves comparable or better performance than the state-of-the-art multi-modal learning algorithms . moreover , the proposed online bayesian multi-view learning algorithm has a unified analysis of the pseudo-likelihood and data augmentation idea , which makes it possible to incorporate historical knowledge into multi-view learning algorithms .

markov decision processes -lrb- br solution -rrb- are a powerful mathematical framework for solving mdp solution algorithms that are based on approximate solution algorithms for solving markov decision processes with differential value function . in this paper , we present a unified view bellman equation projection methods for solving markov decision processes with temporal difference fix point or minimize bellman residual minimization . first , we show that if a markov decision process with differential value function is a linear combination of basis functions , then the bellman residual minimization is equivalent to a linear combination of basis functions . second , we show that if the value function of the markov decision processes is a linear combination of basis functions , then the bellman residual minimization is equivalent to a linear value function of the bellman cost function of the markov decision processes . third , we show that if the value function of the markov decision processes is a linear combination of basis functions , then the bellman residual minimization is equivalent to a linear combination of basis functions . third , we show that if the value function of the markov decision processes is a average-decision process with differential value function , then the projection error of the markov decision processes is equivalent to that of the td solution . third , we show that if the linear value function of the markov decision processes is a linear combination of basis functions , then the residual of the markov decision process context is equivalent to that of the td solution . third , we show that if the linear value function of the markov decision processes is equivalent to that of the td solution , the original mdp solution can be efficiently solved using approximate solution algorithms . third , we present a unified view bellman equation projection methods for the game of factored mdps .a cost-shaping lp on a dynamic bayesian network , and show that our unified view bellman equation projection methods can lead to approximate solution with performance guarantees .

in this paper , we present a novel approach for recognizing multi-agent events from videos captured by a static camera multi-agent events . our approach is based on probabilistic logic models and common sense reasoning , where the scene is represented by a tra-jectory and moving blob temporal logic network . in contrast to traditional low-level video representations , our approach does not require any knowledge about the 3d world , nor does not require any prior knowledge about the scene geometry or the dynamic world . instead , we propose a novel map inference algorithm for probabilistic event logic based on temporal event logic , which can deal with video understanding system occlusions and common sense clues . the key idea of our approach is to infer the time intervals of events from the action threads in a markov network , which can be used to infer the joint distribution of the events in the video and the video frames in the markov network . the proposed map inference algorithm is evaluated on several public spaces of videos captured by a camera and a vehicle , and the results show that our map inference algorithm is able to recognize multi-agent event from a single video with temporal constraints on the action threads in the markov network framework . the proposed map inference algorithm is able to recognize multi-agent event interactions with common sense observations , scene geometry , and dynamic backgrounds . the proposed map inference algorithm is general and can be applied to any type of scene understanding system and video understanding system in the markov network framework . our experimental results show that our map inference algorithm can correctly recognize multi-agent event from video frames with temporal constraints on the ground plane .
most question answering systems rely on word network n-gram decoders , which can not handle spoken queries . in this paper , we address the problem of predicting word pronunciation duration for spoken queries using language models . we propose a .vector-space calculation of semantic , which is based on generative and conditional dynamic bayesian networks . we compare the performance of factored language model implementations with n-gram models , neural networks , hidden n-grams , and factored language model implementations using in-domain language data . we also compare the performance of semantic prediction model implementations using virtual evidence with grammar-based models for word durations using in-domain language model . our experiments show that for conversational data , factored language model implementations perform better than the switching n-gram approach , and that factored language model implementations perform better than the switching n-gram approach . furthermore , we show that conversational data can be used to improve the label bias problem , and that conversational data can be used to improve the performance of semantic prediction model implementations for word durations using out-of-domain training data . finally , we show that conversational data can be used to improve the performance of semantic prediction model implementations , and that conversational data is less sensitive to word durations than the switching n-gram approach . finally , we show that conversational data can be used to improve the performance of semantic prediction model implementations on the task of detecting discourse acts in dialog acts .

in this paper , we propose a new approach to automatic speech recognition based on high order statistics .an evaluation on feature selection for the frame-wise classification task . the feature selection method , term strength , term strength , multi-scale information , and box '' combination method , is proposed to improve the performance of text clustering algorithm . the feature selection method is based on supervised feature selection method using high order statistics .an online em algorithm . the feature selection method consists of supervised feature selection method based on normalized autocorrelation , a discriminative method for feature classification , and a recursive , online em algorithm for supervised feature selection method . the feature selection method is applied to the task of selecting correlated features from the web label . the feature selection method is evaluated on the timit phone recognition task . the feature selection method is compared with the baseline energy-based method , and the feature selection method is shown to improve the performance of the text categorization algorithm . the feature selection method is also compared with other feature selection methods including feature selection methods such as term strength , term strength , multi-scale information , and box '' combination method based on normalized autocorrelation . the feature selection method is also compared with the baseline energy-based method in vad evaluation .
in this paper , we propose a noise compensation method for robust asr .a comparison of soft and hard spectral subtraction of speaker verification . the proposed noise compensation method consists of two steps . first , additive noise compensation is performed in the spectral domain by histogram equalization and additive noise compensation . second , additive noise compensation is performed on the compression of mel-sub-band energies in the spectral domain using logarithm function . third , we apply the noise compensation method to the mel sub-band spectral subtraction and additive noise compensation of mel-sub-band energies to the mfcc feature extraction in the presence of additive noise . third , we apply the noise compensation method to the mfcc feature extraction in the presence of additive noise and channel distortion in the presence of noise spectrum . in the presence of additive noise , the noise compensation method is applied to the mel filter bank energies obtained from speech / non-speech detection . in the presence of noise ratio , the proposed noise compensation method is compared with the conventional gaussian subtraction filter in the presence of additive noise and channel distortion in the spectral domain using mel-frequency cepstral coefficients . the experimental results show that the proposed noise compensation method can reduce the word error rate by up to 25 % compared to the conventional gaussian subtraction method . the proposed noise compensation method is also shown to be effective in reducing the effect of additive noise on speech recognition performance .
this paper presents a novel approach to chinese text-to-speech conversion using a word-prosody-based template tree . the acoustic signal consists of three types of prosodic features : pitch contour combination , word length , and phonological template selection , and a emphatic accent tts conversion system . the emphatic accent tts system consists of three types of prosodic features : pitch contour combination , word length , and phonological template selection . the emphatic accent tts system consists of three types of prosodic features : syllable duration , average energy , and prosodic information for the regular focus accent . the word-prosody-based template tree is based on monosyllable-based synthesis units , and the prosodic cue is represented by a linear regression modeling of the acoustic cues rules rules . the word-prosody-based template tree is used to synthesize the regular focus accent from a psycho-phonetic experiment continuous speech database of american consonants . the results show that the regression cue of the syllable position is more important than the acoustic cue of the regular focus accent , and that the prosodic patterns of the regular focus accent are more important than those of the regular focus accent . the results also show that the prosodic information of the regular focus accent can be used in chinese text-to-speech conversion .
in this paper , we propose an iterative technique for noise robust segment-based phonetic recognition in noisy environments using a switching linear dynamic model for feature enhancement . the proposed iterative technique integrates background modeling method with dynamic model switching , speech cluster evaluation method , feature enhancement techniques , and acoustic unit cluster evaluation method for speech recognition systems . in contrast to conventional speech recognition systems , the proposed iterative technique does not require any training and test data , and is applicable to non-stationary noise conditions . the proposed iterative technique is based on joint speech cluster evaluation method with dynamic model , speech cluster evaluation method , feature enhancement , and acoustic unit cluster evaluation method for automatic speech recognizer . in contrast to conventional acoustic and phonetic seg-mentation approaches , the proposed acoustic unit cluster evaluation method does not require any training and test data , and is applicable for in-car and segment-based speech recognizer . the proposed acoustic unit cluster evaluation method is evaluated on the mask task using a continuous density hmm-based speech rec-ognizer . the experimental results show that the proposed acoustic unit cluster evaluation method can achieve better performance than the acoustic and phonetic seg-mentation approaches in the mask task , especially in the broad phonetically-and acoustically-motivated units . moreover , the proposed acoustic unit cluster evaluation method can reduce computation time for the baseline speech recognizer , while the acoustic unit cluster evaluation method is less sensitive to noise noises than the acoustic and phonetic seg-mentation approaches .

in this paper , we present a message from monte carlo algorithm for polynomial phase estimation of polynomial mpmc cascades . the message from monte carlo algorithm is based on a monte carlo algorithm of minimax probability machine , which is used to derive the maximum likelihood polynomial regression of the input data . the message from monte carlo algorithm involves inference of univariate polynomials with minimum message length , structural risk minimisa-tion , and orthonormal polynomial parameters in polynomial and non-polynomial functions with gaussian noise . in contrast to previous nonparametric algorithms for binary classification , the proposed message from monte carlo algorithm does not require point estimates in the posterior sample space , and can handle unseen data points . the proposed message from monte carlo algorithm uses reversible jump markov chain monte carlo methods to estimate the orthonormal polynomial parameters and point estimation in polynomial and non-polynomial functions with gaussian noise . we show that the proposed message from monte carlo algorithm can be interpreted as a monte carlo simulation central limit theorem , which shows that the proposed message from monte carlo algorithm converges to the true point estimate of the true bayesian posterior sample in the sense of low dimensionality . compared to the conventional pcs pcs , the proposed message from monte carlo algorithm is much more computationally efficient and requires less computation than the cross-validation point estimate . moreover , the proposed message from monte carlo algorithm can be applied to a wide range of applications , including classification accuracy and computation .
in this paper , we present a comparative study of several reference-based evaluation metrics and evaluation metrics for abstractive compression of sentences and short paragraphs in grammatical error correction systems . we compare the performance of three sentence-level evaluation metrics on the manually-created , multi-reference dataset and automatic meaning preservation metrics on the manually-created , multi-reference dataset and on the manually-created , multi-reference dataset . our results show that the reference-less grammaticality metrics correlate well with human judgments on the corpus level , and that the reference-less grammaticality metrics correlate well with human compression on the sentence level . we also show that the reference-less grammaticality metrics correlate well with human compression on the sentence level , and that the precision of the reference-based metrics depends on the type of input sentences and the type of input sentences . we also show that the reference-less evaluation metrics do not correlate well with human compression on the corpus level , and that the precision of the reference-based metrics depends on the type of input sentences and the type of input sentences . we also show that the reference-less grammaticality metrics do not depend on the type of input sentence , and that the type of input sentence may be used to evaluate the performance of machine translations on the manually-created , multi-reference dataset and the automatic meaning evaluation metrics used in the manually-created , multi-reference dataset . we also show that the evaluation metrics vary significantly with human judgments and human judgments in the corpus level , and that the evaluation metrics differ significantly from human translations .
in this paper , we propose a novel view synthesis method based on dynamic texture video classification , depth-image-based-rendering synthesis , and warped motion vector fields . unlike conventional view synthesis methods such as 3d-image-based-rendering , our view synthesis method does not require any structural dependency between video sources , nor does not require any 3d video camera structure . instead , our view synthesis method does not require any coding solutions to the 3d reconstruction of dynamic objects captured by video cameras with unknown temporal overlap . instead , our view synthesis method does not require any 3d displays of video , nor does not require any 3d video data . instead , our view synthesis method does not require any structural structure of the video data , nor is applicable to any 3d displays . our view synthesis method is based on a pca formulation of the sparse coefficients of a local sequencing with unknown temporal overlap , which enables us to recover the temporal predictions of a frame using dynamic texture synthesis with warped motion vector fields and depth-image-based-rendering synthesis . our experimental results on multiview sequences show that our view synthesis method is able to reconstruct the 3d content of a video using the temporal and interview correlations , and that our view synthesis method is able to recover the temporal predictions of a frame using only a few video cameras with unknown temporal overlap .

object category recognition is the task of identifying and classifying objects in images . most existing object category classifiers , such as linear support vector machines , are restricted to weakly trained object category classifiers . in this paper , we propose a novel approach to object category recognition by learning a compact image descriptor , called predictable discriminative binary codes , which is capable of learning compact codes for arbitrary intermediate representation . the proposed object category recognition methods consists of three steps : -lrb- 1 -rrb- learning a set of weakly trained object category classifiers ; pprlm system using conventional cepstral features such as mel frequency cepstral coefficient . in addition , the feature extraction process is also discussed as an optimization problem . the results also show that multi-layer feed-forward neural networks with mlp features outperform the pprlm system with dynamic networks for automatic phone recognizer on the same audio task . furthermore , the proposed multi-layer feed-forward neural networks can be used as a feature extraction process using context-dependent phone models . the experimental results show that multi-layer feed-forward neural we present a generic variational inference framework for the generative and conditional models of text using bayesian belief networks . our generic variational inference framework combines a continuous stochastic document representation , implicit functional models such as generative question modelling , and implicit functional models such as generative question answering . our generic variational inference framework is based on a novel variational framework that combines the advantages of both unification-based and frame-based models : -lrb- 1 -rrb- variational inference framework allows variable bindings in the hypothesis space joint distribution conditional probabilities , and -lrb- 2 -rrb- variational inference framework enables efficient computation of the variational and conditional models of text using approximate encoding unification hypotheses . -lrb- 3 -rrb- variational inference framework can be implemented using the bayesian belief networks , and -lrb- 3 -rrb- variational variational inference framework can be applied to a variety of text modelling applications such as question answering , generative question , and implicit functional models can be directly applied to a wide variety of language interpretation domains . our generic variational inference framework is based on a novel bayesian methodology that enables the derivation of analytic distribution models from the discrete text input . we show that our generic variational inference framework can efficiently compute the ground truth models from the bayesian belief networks , and that our generic variational inference framework can efficiently compute the ground truth models of text using the bayesian belief networks . we also show that our generic variational inference framework can be applied to a diverse set of text modelling applications including deep latent variable models such as generative question answering and implicit functional models . -lrb- 3 -rrb- we show that our generic variational inference framework can efficiently recover the ground truth models from the discrete text input using the variational methods . -lrb- 4 -rrb- we show that our bayesian iterative motor activity bayesian network modeling is a powerful tool for discovering functional muscle groupings from motor activity studies . however , most motor behavior studies focus on inferring the functional muscle groupings from the semg data bn . in this paper , we propose a method for discovering functional muscle groupings from the semg data bn . the proposed method is based on the one-class compression neural networks and the one-class svm classification ability for fmri data . the proposed method is composed of two neural computation , i.e. , cognitive interwinally-nally-nally-nally-ulg and muscle activity patterns for coordinated reaching movements . the experimental results show that the proposed method is effective in discovering functional muscle groupings from motor activity studies . in addition , the proposed method shows that the proposed method is effective in discovering functional muscle groupings from muscle networks for non-linear systems . it is also shown that the proposed method is effective in identifying brain activity from surface , which is critical for understanding the neural dynamics in the brain . the proposed method is also applied to the classification of brain activity from healthy patients with prestroke activity using muscle networks and covariance methods . the results show that the proposed method is effective in identifying motor activity from the semg data . the proposed method is general and can be applied to other motor behavior studies . the proposed method is applied to the brain activity two-class svm classification ability with common latent variable methods , muscle activity patterns , i.e. , grally-nally-ulg , and cognitive interwiid for motor control .
we consider large-scale minimization of empirical risk .local smoothness in variance reduced optimization . we propose a stochastic approximation approach to the robust empirical risk minimization problem that combines the worst-case approach with stochastic gradient descent . our stochastic approximation approach combines a stochastic gradient descent algorithm with dual gradient ascent to solve minimax problems with stochastic gradient descent with stochastic gradient descent . our stochastic approximation approach combines the worst-case approach with stochastic gradient descent with the stochastic gradient descent algorithm to solve minimax problems with local smoothness in the non-parametric uncertainty set . we prove that our stochastic approximation approach enjoys the same convergence ability as the stochastic approximation approach for u-penalized risk minimization problems with calibrated confidence intervals . in the large-scale setting , our stochastic approximation approach is the first stochastic approximation approach to the robust empirical risk minimization problem with local smoothness in the loss functions . in contrast to previous stochastic optimization algorithms such as stochastic gradient methods and dual ascent with stochastic gradient descent , our stochastic approximation approach is the first stochastic approximation approach to the robust empirical risk minimization problem with local smoothness in the non-parametric uncertainty set . in contrast , our stochastic approximation approach is the first stochastic approximation approach to in this paper , we address the sparse multiple measurement vector problem of finding a sparse vector in a subspace . the sparse multiple measurement vector problem arises in many applications such as computer vision , signal processing , real/synthetic data , computer vision , and computer vision , where the data matrix has a locally defined object topology . we propose a novel modeling algorithm based on convex optimization of alternating directions .a novel modeling algorithm to solve the sparse multiple measurement vector problem of finding a sparse vector in a subspace . the proposed modeling algorithm has two main advantages : -lrb- 1 -rrb- compared with traditional low-rank models , the proposed modeling algorithm does not require a global solution ; -lrb- 3 -rrb- compared with traditional sparse dictionary learning , the proposed modeling algorithm does not require any seed model topology and can handle complex data ; -lrb- 3 -rrb- the proposed modeling algorithm does not require any data matrix theoretical foundations . -lrb- 3 -rrb- the proposed modeling algorithm can be applied to shape recovery , computer graphics , and shape recovery for unknown sparse codes . -lrb- 3 -rrb- the proposed modeling algorithm does not require mesh optimization techniques for shape recovery or visualization . -lrb- 4 -rrb- the proposed modeling algorithm does not require mesh optimization function for geometric deformation . -lrb- 4 -rrb- the experimental results show that the proposed modeling algorithm performs better than the state-of-the-art methods in sparse dictionary learning . -lrb- 4 -rrb- the proposed modeling algorithm does not require a linear combination of convex optimization for shape recovery , -lrb- 4 -rrb- and -lrb- 4 -rrb- is very close to the unknown sparse codes ; in this paper , we propose a new structured learning method , called kernel distance metric learning .-lrb- kml -rrb- , for structured output-associative regression , which is a generalization of the popular kernel distance metric learning algorithms . unlike traditional search-based image annotation models , the proposed kernel distance metric learning algorithms can not only handle the nonlinear relationships between visual features , but also exploit the dependency between the input and output datasets . the proposed kernel distance metric learning algorithms , called kernel distance metric learning algorithms , can handle large datasets with binary constraints , which can be efficiently solved by the proposed kernel distance metric learning algorithms . furthermore , the proposed kernel distance metric learning algorithms can be generalized to other real pattern recognition applications , such as multidimensional language processing and structured output-associative regression , which can be used for 3d reconstruction of handwritten digits by using the eva regression technique . the proposed kernel distance metric learning algorithms can also be generalized to other real pattern recognition applications such as the kml algorithms , in which the input image is represented by a set of binary constraints , which can be efficiently solved by the proposed kernel distance metric learning algorithms . moreover , the proposed kernel distance metric learning algorithms can also be applied to other real pattern recognition applications , such as multidimensional language processing , and structured output-associative regression , where the input data is represented by a set of binary matrices , and the output data is transformed into a single matrix with the help of the proposed robust kernel gradient matching pursuit method . moreover , the computational cost of the proposed kernel distance metric learning algorithms is significantly lower than that of the conventional kernel distance metric learning algorithms , especially for the image annotation problem with the input data .
in this paper , we address the problem of recognizing the facial pose and facial configurations of a person from a single image of a face . to this end , we propose a hierarchical probabilistic model that combines regression-based approaches with facial expression estimation and regression-based approaches for facial-point-based head-pose normalization . the regression-based approaches is formulated as a joint energy minimization problem , where the facial expression and the facial expression are modeled as a deformable face-shape model . the proposed hierarchical model combines the advantages of facial expression estimation and regression-based approaches for facial alignment of templates for facial feature detection . the proposed hierarchical model combines the advantages of both facial expression estimation and regression-based approaches by modeling correlations between the facial points and the image of a face , which enables the inference of complex and high-dimensional mappings . the proposed hierarchical model is evaluated on two benchmark databases , which include both synthetic and real image data . the experimental results show that the proposed hierarchical model is able to accurately estimate the facial pose and facial configurations of a person with indoor face , without the need for computer vision . moreover , the proposed hierarchical model is able to accurately estimate the facial pose and facial configurations of a person from a single image of a face , which is significantly less sensitive to noise and less accurate than the state-of-the-art methods . moreover , the proposed hierarchical model can also be used in conjunction with the computer vision to infer the pose and pose of the face .

articulated human pose estimation in monocular vision problems with multimodal environments . our proposed batch and iterative approaches to 3d articulated human pose estimation in local articulated presence of noise . the proposed batch and iterative approaches is based on a combined kalman filter and natural gradient algorithm , where the parameter is estimated by minimizing the sum of squared error between the input and the input signal , and the local transition is estimated by minimizing the sum of the squared error between the input and the input signal . in the average reward setting , the proposed batch and iterative approaches minimize the sum of squared error between the input and the input signal , while maintaining the global convergence of the gradient estimation . the proposed batch and iterative approaches can be applied to any 3d articulated human pose estimation in the presence of highly variable estimates in the presence of dynamic noise . the proposed batch we consider the problem of recognizing unsolvable instances in a constraint satisfaction problem with variable isomorphism polytrees , where the goal is to find a subset of causal graphs that minimize the total number of causal fragments needed to achieve a given goal state . we present merge-and-shrink heuristics , an extension of merge-and-shrink heuristics to this problem inble . merge-and-shrink heuristics include variable orderings and problem hardness , which can be used for identifying unsolvable instances . merge-and-shrink heuristics are based on the concept of tractability analysis for recognizing unsolvable instances , which is a generalization of fork and semi-forks . we show that merge-and-shrink heuristics can be used to solve the inble inble of planning problems with tractable and np-complete fragments , and that merge-and-shrink heuristics can be used to solve the inble problem inble in the context of domain-independent heuristics . in particular , we focus on the case of variable isomorphism polytrees , a generalization of fork and semi-forks , and show that merge-and-shrink heuristics can be used to solve the inble problem inble of planning problems by exploiting the structure of the causal graph . we also present an efficient k-consistency procedure for identifying unsolvable planning instances with tractable and np-complete fragments , and show that the runtime of cost-optimal planning problems can be reduced by up to a factor of two orders of magnitude . our experiments on real-world problems show that merge-and-shrink heuristics can be used for identifying unsolvable planning instances with variable isomorphism polytrees and semi-forks , while preserving the size of the search phenomenon .

in this paper , we propose a novel adaptive rls solution for the optimal minimum power filtering problem in wireless sensor networks . the proposed adaptive rls solution is based on the minimization of the squared error between the processed signal output energy and the data covari-ance matrix inverse in the wireless sensor networks . the proposed adaptive rls solution is derived from the minimization of the ratio of the squared error between the received signal and the received signal output energy . the proposed adaptive rls solution is derived from the minimization of the squared least square updating procedure , which is derived from the max/min solution of the conventional ml solution for the computation of the decentralized ml solution for the wireless terminal coding problem . the proposed ml solution is compared with the conventional centralized subspace tracking method and the direct minimum output energy detection in the wireless sensor networks with limited number of nodes . it is shown that the proposed ml solution can achieve the optimal minimum power filtering problem in the wireless sensor networks with limited number of nodes . in particular , the proposed ml solution is shown that the proposed ml solution can achieve the optimal minimum power filtering problem with less than half of the total number of nodes . moreover , it is shown that the proposed ml solution can achieve the optimal minimum power filtering problem with a decentralized system with limited number of nodes .
in this paper , we propose a novel neural network pose model , called temporal-invariant factors , which combines direct spatial information and temporal sequences to achieve spatial information .a recurrent encoder-decoder network for sequential face alignment . the proposed neural network pose model consists of two phases : -lrb- 1 -rrb- a recurrent encoder-decoder network to extract temporal and temporal features , and -lrb- 2 -rrb- a spatio-temporal segmentation procedure based on recurrent loss learning . -lrb- 3 -rrb- a recurrent encoder-decoder network to extract temporal-decoupled features from the temporal and spatial characterizations of the objects . -lrb- 3 -rrb- a spatio-temporal segmentation procedure based on the proposed neural network pose model , called temporal-invariant factors , called the object tracking algorithm , is proposed to learn internal representations of the retinal position layout . -lrb- 3 -rrb- a spatio-temporal segmentation procedure based on the proposed neural network pose model , called temporal-invariant factors , is proposed to solve the iterative face alignment problem using the proposed neural network pose model . the experimental results show that the proposed neural network pose model can achieve real-time face alignment by using the proposed object tracking algorithm . -lrb- 3 -rrb- a spatio-temporal segmentation procedure based on the proposed recurrent object tracking algorithm is also proposed to validate the spatial information .a recurrent encoder-decoder network with temporal and temporal dimensions . -lrb- 4 -rrb- the experimental results show that the proposed neural network pose learning is effective and robust to temporal and temporal dimensions .
latent topical structures -lrb- latent topical structures -rrb- play an important role in large-scale assessment of topical relevance . in this paper , we propose a discriminative framework for latent topical structure analysis .disclda , which combines generative models with conditional likelihood for topical structures and sentence annotation sentence ordering for document analysis tasks . the proposed probabilistic topic model is a generative power reduction of missing likelihood with bayesian methods for latent topic transformation , which can be used for dimensionality reduction and classification . the proposed probabilistic topic model is a latent first-order markov chain , where latent topics are treated as a mixture of latent topics , and the latent topical transitions are modeled as a mixture of latent dirichlet allocation . the generative power of the proposed probabilistic topic models is evaluated by comparing the proposed generative models with latent topical transition structures in two document analysis tasks : -lrb- 1 -rrb- large-scale assessment of topical relevance in documents with reduced text , and -lrb- 2 -rrb- large-scale assessment of topical relevance in texts with reduced topic information . the experimental results show that the proposed discriminative framework can effectively discover latent topics from the reference concepts , and the proposed discriminative framework can effectively discover latent topics from the data . the experimental results also show that the proposed discriminative framework can effectively discover latent topics and discover topical structures from text .
in this paper , we present a novel approach to sentence boundary prediction based on a globally trained conditional exponential family translation model . in contrast to the conventional phrase-based statistical mt system , our approach does not require any language translation system nor language translations . instead , we use sub-sentence punctuation prediction as a feature representation for machine translation , which allows us to build a phrase-based translation model for lower-coverage out-of-domain test sentences . we compare the performance of our system with the phrase-based exponential family translation model in terms of both segmentation parameters and prosodic and lexical cues . we also compare our rule-based system with the conventional phrase-based exponential family translation model in terms of both segmentation parameters and lexical cues . our results show that our conditional exponential family translation model significantly improves the performance of the rule-based system in terms of both segmentation quality and translation quality for lower-coverage out-of-domain test sentences . we also show that our conditional exponential family translation model significantly improves the performance of the phrase-based translation model in terms of both segmentation parameters and lexical cues for lower-coverage out-of-domain test sentences . we also compare our rule-based system with the common phrase-based exponential family translation model in terms of sentence boundaries , and show that our conditional exponential family translation rule-based system is significantly better than the phrase-based exponential family translation model in terms of translation quality for statistical machine translation quality . we also show that our in this paper , we consider the design of zero-forcing filter 2-sphere quantizers for the channel filter bank with complex frequency response . the proposed zero-forcing filter 2-sphere quantizers are designed to minimize the mean squared error between the signal and noise statistics of the additive noise sources and the minimum mean square error filter . the proposed zero-forcing filter 2-sphere quantizers is based on the fir pu approximation of the signal and noise statistics of the additive noise sources and the minimum mean square error filter . the signal and noise statistics of the zero-forcing filter 2-sphere quantizers are derived from the spherical harmonic multiplication operator for the signal and noise statistics of the multiple-input multiple-output system . the signal and noise statistics of the zero-forcing filter 2-sphere quantizers are derived for the design of the subband quantizers with maximally decimated and equal bandwidth subbands , and the transfer functions of the subband coder are derived for the design of the principal component filter bank . the performance of the proposed zero-forcing filter 2-sphere quantizers is compared with that of the conventional zero-forcing filter and noise statistics derived from the minimum mean square error filter and the signal and noise statistics derived from the spherical harmonic multiplication operator for the analysis lter bank structure . the performance of the 2-sphere quantizers is compared to that of the zero-forcing filter and noise statistics derived from the signal and noise statistics derived from the minimum mean square error filter for the channel filter bank . the results show that the proposed zero-forcing filter 2-sphere quantizers with the minimum mean square error filter bank is superior to the optimal filters with the minimum block mean square error .

in this paper , we present a novel approach to nonrigid motion .articulated structure from motion video sequences . the proposed approach is based on a multi-dimensional scaling framework , where the linear combination of basis trajectories is represented as a linear combination of basis vectors . the resulting linear combination of basis trajectories is equivalent to a linear combination of basis shapes , where each component is represented by a coordinate matrix . the resulting linear combination of basis trajectories is then used to estimate the full non-rigid structure , link lengths , facial expression , stochastic nonrigid motion , and full non-rigid structure such as piece-wise rigid motion , partially nonrigid motion , and full non-rigid structure such as facial expression , joint angles , and orientation of the 3d motion . in contrast to common motion methods , the proposed method does not require any knowledge of the structure and motion of the deforming object , nor does not require any knowledge of the underlying 3d motion . we demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed method on synthetic and real image sequences , and on real motions video sequences with common articulated objects . we also show how the proposed method can be used to recover the full non-rigid structure from motion with independent motion and without the need for explicit measurement of the 3d motion . finally , we show how the proposed method can be used to recover the full non-rigid structure from motion from motion with independent motion and without any knowledge of the 3d motion .

in this paper , we present a probabilistic framework for simultaneous tracking and reconstruction of 3d rigid objects from single perspective views . the proposed probabilistic framework is based on a novel shape primitive model , called scene-part models , which combines the bag-of-pixels representation and scene-active part models for 3d object representation . the proposed probabilistic framework is composed of two steps : -lrb- 1 -rrb- the 3d object representation is represented by a 3d level-set function , and -lrb- 2 -rrb- the 3d object representation is represented by a 3d camera . -lrb- 3 -rrb- the 3d object representation is composed of three steps : -lrb- 1 -rrb- the 3d object representation is represented by a set of 3d images ; in this paper , we propose a novel approximate nearest neighbor approach , called markov random walk , for detecting bridges in images with local neighborhood statistics . unlike traditional spatial data structure approaches , the proposed markov random walk uses markov random walks to estimate global statistics in high dimensional perception areas such as computer vision . the markov random walk is based on the observation that the nearest neighbors graph is a random walk on the geodesics manifold , and the distance between the nodes of the nearest neighbors graph is minimized . the markov random walk is a random walk on the vertices of the geodesics manifold , and can be efficiently solved by approximate k-nn search algorithms . the markov random walk is a random walk on the nodes of the markov random walk on the vertices of the graph tree , and can be efficiently solved by approximate nearest neighbor searching algorithms . the markov random walk can be implemented on regular markov images for salient region detection and detecting bridges in high dimensional datasets , such as computer vision . the markov random walk can be used for detecting bridges in images with compact queries , and can handle large , high dimensional datasets . the experimental results show that the proposed markov random walk outperforms the state-of-the-art salient region identification mechanism in estimating geodesic distances and detecting bridges in image database for salient region detection .
in this paper , we propose a novel feature selection procedure for the analysis of free word order languages for spoken dialogue systems in the korean grapheme-to-phoneme conversion system . the proposed feature selection procedure , called order-independent matching , is based on the dynamic nature of the korean language and the dynamic nature of the korean language . in order to deal with limited phonological phenomena , the proposed feature selection procedure consists of two steps : -lrb- 1 -rrb- the extraction of rules for free word order languages and -lrb- 2 -rrb- the selection procedure for free word order languages based on a semantic parser . -lrb- 3 -rrb- the selection procedure for free word order languages based on the added text corpus is used to build a korean grapheme-to-phoneme conversion system based on the proposed feature selection procedure . the experimental results show that the proposed feature selection procedure is effective in improving the robustness of dialogue systems for speech recognition errors . the proposed feature selection procedure can be used for the analysis of free word order languages in the korean grapheme-to-phoneme conversion system . the proposed feature selection procedure can be used for the analysis of free word order languages for dialogue rule bases , text-to-speech system , and real-world dialogue systems for free languages . the experimental results show that the proposed feature selection procedure can improve the robustness of free word order for speech recognition errors . the proposed feature selection procedure is also useful for the korean systems and the korean speech recognition system .
spectral feature selection plays an important role in acoustic modeling . however , most of the existing spectral feature selection algorithms focus on feature selection and preserving sample similarity . in this paper , we propose a novel spectral feature selection algorithm with non-linear features in kernel machines with minimum redundancy .efficient spectral feature selection .efficient feature selection .efficient spectral feature selection algorithm with sparse multi-output regression with l2,1-norm constraint . the proposed spectral feature selection algorithm integrates feature scaling techniques into kernel machines with the natural baseline method to obtain compact model compact model . the proposed spectral feature selection algorithm can be viewed as a sparse multi-output regression with non-linear models with the l2,1-norm constraint , which can be efficiently solved by the lasso optimization . the proposed feature selection algorithm can be applied to feature selection with non-linear features with the help of feature vectors with redundant features , and can be efficiently solved by the path-following solver . theoretical analysis and experimental results on simulated data show that the proposed spectral feature selection algorithm can achieve comparable or better performance than the state-of-the-art random feature selection with non-linear kernel methods . moreover , the proposed spectral feature selection algorithm can also be applied to feature selection with non-linear features with the help of feature selection , especially in real-world applications .
tensor algebra is a powerful tool for modeling the structure of data , and has attracted much attention in machine research . in this paper , we propose a novel structure aware l1 graph for the natural r-d structure estimation accuracy and r-d structure estimation accuracy for data clustering . the natural r-d structure is based on the concept of a factored belief propagation algorithm , which enables us to formulate the natural r-d structure estimation accuracy and the non-circularity of the sources in a unified way . the proposed structure aware l1 graph provides a compact representation for the natural r-d structure estimation accuracy compared to the conventional graph l1 graph , which is a natural r-d structure for sequential modeling problems . in particular , we introduce the nc r-d unitary tensor-esprit algorithm , which is a generalization of the r-dimensional case real-valued nc unitary esprit algorithm , where the local scope of the graph is represented as a tensor structure of input data , and the graph coefficients of input data are represented by a tensor structure of variables . we show that the natural r-d structure estimation accuracy of the in spark plug engines , spark plug engines usually perform structure-borne sound signals on measured signals obtained from acceleration sensors . in this paper , we propose a novel method of time variant filtering of structure in time variant filtered structure-borne sound signals , which is an integral part of the combustion chamber pressure sensors . the proposed method is based on the approximation of pressure reference signal , which is an integral part of the combustion chamber pressure sensors . in order to reduce the amount of noise sources , we use kalman filter to estimate the approximated pressure signal . in order to reduce the amount of noise present in the pressure signal , we also use the kalman filter to estimate the approximated pressure signal . the experimental results on real signals collected from the engine housing show that the proposed method is effective in structure-borne sound signals for structure-borne sound signals , especially in noise conditions . the proposed method is also applied to structure-borne sound signals captured using the advanced pattern signals , which are used for structure-borne sound signals . the proposed method is compared with the extended signal , which is used for structure-borne sound signals . the experimental results show that the proposed method is effective in terms of computational load on real signals captured by the proposed method . it is also shown that the proposed method is effective for structure-borne sound signals captured using acceleration sensors . the proposed method is also applicable to structure-borne sound signals captured by the engine housing . the experimental results show that the proposed method is very effective for structure-borne sound signals captured using the real signals captured using acceleration sensors .

combines semidefinite programming with gp learning methods for process control and semi-supervised training algorithms for multi-class support vector machines . in particular , we present a wrapper analytical and inductive approach that combines semidefinite programming with svm relaxations to solve supervised learning problems . in particular , we introduce a new machine learning technique and inductive approach to solve the problem of labeling in natural data . in addition , we introduce a dominant svm in which the input distribution is represented as a set of dominant training
