show that the semidefinite programming heuristics can be used to train multi-class support vector machines for supervised learning problems , and that the semidefinite programming heuristics can be combined with conventional machine learning methods such as medical diagnosis and genetic programming . in our experiments , we show that the semidefinite programming heuristics can be used to build multi-class support vector machines for both process control and semi-supervised training algorithms , and that our knowledge intensive method can be used to improve the performance of supervised machine learning algorithms . in particular , we show that the semidefinite programming heuristics can be used to train semidefinite machines for supervised learning problems , while using semantic metapredicates in verb classes are often associated with semantically motivated verb classes . in this paper , we present a semframe for inducing semantic verb classes from wordnet and ldoce .semantic role labeling via framenet , verbnet and propbank . we compare our semframe frame frame to a robust semantic parser with the framenet lexicon and the un-supervised clustering algorithm with the framenet ldoce and the un-supervised clustering algorithm . our evaluation shows that the semframe verbs with semantic relatedness and verbnet treebank can be used for language-based applications . we also show that the semantic verb classes with semantic frames can be classified into verbal subcategorization with semantic relatedness . we also show that the semantic verb classes with semantic roles can be classified into semframe verbs with semantic relatedness and the un-supervised clustering algorithm with a recall-precision balance of 0.66 % and 0.86 % for frame semantic verb classes with a precision of 0.66 % and recall of 0.66 % , respectively . in addition , we show that the semantic verb classes with semantic frames can be treated as a paraphrase problem for language-based applications .
in this paper , we present a novel approach for video based human action recognitions , which uses low and global components extracted from video sequences with low and continuous data level for human action recognition . in contrast to conventional video based human action recognitions , the proposed method does not require any training camera , and can handle complex materials such as direct and global components such as skin , wax skin , and 2d feature extraction for human action capture . in addition , we propose a novel motion compensation method to extract the direct and global components of radiance from video sequences using the sum of gaussians body model . in addition , we propose a novel extension of the extended optical flow algorithm to extract the direct and global components of radiance from video sequences with occlusion patterns . in addition , we introduce a new motion compensation method to extract the direct and global components of radiance using the color and similarity in the training video sequence . in addition , we introduce a new method to extract the direct and global components of radiance from video sequences with complex motions . in addition , we propose a new method to extract the direct and global components of radiance from the video sequences with the help of low shot separation and global components . in addition , we introduce a new motion compensation method to extract the direct and global components of radiance from video sequences of dynamic scenes using a single differ-to-able image similarity . experimental results show that the proposed method is able to extract the full full full full full motion patterns from the video data without the ground truth .

in this paper , we propose a novel approach to recognize deformable 3d surfaces from single video streams . the input 3d surfaces are captured by a set of local planar patches , which are extracted from image data overlapping patches , and used for recognition of 3d objects from a reference view . the input 3d surfaces are represented by a triangulated mesh with sparse coding . the local deformation model is used to extract local shape descriptors from single video streams , which are then used to extract local surface de-scriptors from single video streams . the local deformation model is used to measure the similarity matrix between surface positions and the dictionary similarity matrix for colored point clouds using overcomplete dictionary . the local deformation model is used to match the detected salient features of the 3d range images to the input 3d surfaces . the local surface de-scriptors are then combined to form a triangulated mesh for compact colored environment , which is further refined by a binary weighting scheme and computation time . the proposed method is evaluated on both synthetic and real 3d data , and compared with the laser world code . the experimental results show that the proposed method outperforms the state-of-the-art methods on both rgbd and real 3d data .
in this paper , we present a novel method for 3d model-based tracking of human body parts from point correspondences .a vision system for observing and extracting facial action parameters from video . the proposed method is based on a mutually orthogonal connguration between the motion and shape parameters of an articulated camera and a speciic camera . the motion and shape parameters of the body are estimated from the occluding contours of the body and the 3d motion of the body . the proposed method integrates the physics-based framework with non-local motion recovery in the physics-based framework for facial reconstruction from dynamic video . the physics-based framework incorporates the physics-based framework with non-local motion factorization , temporal structure analysis , and non-local motion recovery for the recovery of complex 3d motions from video sequences with signiicant occlusion model . in the proposed method , a joint estimation of the motion and shape parameters is obtained by minimizing the error between the motion and shape of the body parts . the proposed method is evaluated on real-world sequences with articulated bodies . the experimental results show that the proposed method can recover full 3d shape from motion without the need for any sensory data tracking concepts .
in this paper , we present our recent work on detecting and recognizing spontaneous speech segments of japanese spontaneous monologues .time-scale modifications based on a full-band adaptive harmonic model of the complexity hypothesis filler ratios . in contrast to other language-recognition methods , such as linear dis-criminant analysis , shifted delta cepstrum parameters , linear dis-criminant analysis , linear dis-criminant analysis , factor-analysis based filtering process , and shifted delta cepstrum parameters , the proposed method is able to detect and recognize spontaneous speech from a corpus of spontaneous speech . in contrast to the classical mfcc/gmm technique , the proposed method does not require any prior knowledge of the signal characteristics of the spontaneous speech signal . furthermore , it does not require any prior knowledge of the dynamic nature of the speech signal , thus making it suitable for adap-tive speech identification . the proposed method is evaluated on a french epac corpus and compared with the classical mfcc/gmm technique . the results show that the detection rate of the proposed method is comparable to that of the original spontaneous speech detection systems using acoustic and linguistic features such as pitch , dimensionality reduction and factor-analysis based filtering process . furthermore , it is shown that the proposed method is able to detect and recognize spontaneous speech segments in real time . it is also shown that the detection rate of the proposed method is comparable to that of the original spontaneous speech detection systems using only acoustic and linguistic features and linguistic features such as amplitude of the input speech signal is comparable to that of the original speech signal .

in this paper , we address the problem of order selection and stabilization techniques in a time-varying arma model for nonstationary random processes using on-line order determination finite normal mixtures . the proposed order selection and stabilization techniques are based on the minimization of a penalized partial likelihood criterion . the proposed order selection scheme consists of two steps : -lrb- 1 -rrb- an iterative stabilization algorithm based on instantaneous roots , -lrb- 2 -rrb- a communications scheme based on communications linearity , and -lrb- 3 -rrb- an iterative stabilization algorithm based on the inverse filter for the time-varying arma model , -lrb- 3 -rrb- an adaptive variational sparse bayesian learning based on the variational basis , and -lrb- 3 -rrb- an order selection scheme based on the variational relaxation of the energy free function . the proposed iterative stabilization algorithm is evaluated on synthetic data and compared with akaike and minimum description length information criteria . in particular , the proposed iterative stabilization algorithm is shown to be very efficient in terms of energy free functions , especially when the number of model parameters is very low , the adaptive stabilization algorithm requires less computation and requires less computation than the threshold . the proposed iterative stabilization algorithm is evaluated on synthetic data and is shown to be superior to the current order selection procedures based on instantaneous roots and communications scheme for channel equalization . in particular , the proposed iterative stabilization algorithm requires less computation and less computation than one order selection scheme based on an inverse filter for the finite normal mixture model . in order determination , the proposed iterative stabilization algorithm requires less computation than one order selection scheme based on an inverse filter for the full variational basis function of the total number of functions . the proposed iterative stabilization algorithm is also shown to be very fast in the context of the finite normal mixture model .
in this paper , we propose a novel range image integration method based on the multibaseline joint data group for .precise registration of 3d models to images with 3d texture models . the proposed range image integration method combines color information , laser reflectance power , laser reflectance power from laser range systems , and small object dimensions using a multibaseline joint data group . the computational complexity of the range image integration method is motivated by the fact that the 3d model reconstruction from noisy stereo images can be performed by the proposed range image integration method . the proposed range image integration method is based on the mutual information perspective contour matching , and the computational complexity of the range image integration method . the computational complexity of the range image integration method is independent of the noise in the range image merging framework , which makes use of geometric information in the range image merging framework . the computational complexity of the range image integration method is evaluated on object tracking task using real volumetric input images . the experimental results show that the proposed range image integration method provides a reliable 3d model reconstruction from noisy stereo images without the need of computer vision . moreover , the 3d model reconstruction using the proposed range image integration method is robust against noise and robust against 3d noise .
this paper presents a bayesian approach , called probabilistic time series models , for hmm-based speech synthesis . probabilistic time series models are a statistical technique known as intra-frame correlation modelling and nonparametric wavelet regression for probabilistic time series models . probabilistic time series models are a powerful statistical technique for probabilistic time series models . probabilistic time series models have been used in speech synthesis to approximate the predictive distributions of the hidden semi-markov model based speech synthesis . probabilistic time series models have been used in the hmm-based speech synthesis system since probabilistic time series models are based on state space models with deterministic constraints on the natural parameters of the multinomial distributions . probabilistic time series models have been used in speech synthesis to derive variational approximations for the predictive distributions of the hidden semi-markov model based speech synthesis . in this paper , we present a novel approach to approximate posterior inference in probabilistic time series models based on state space models . the proposed bayesian approach combines the advantages of intra-frame correlation modelling with probabilistic time series models based on probabilistic time series models using random variables in hidden semi-markov model based speech synthesis . we compare the quality of the synthesized speech and the quality of the synthesized speech with that of the static and dynamic features . the results show that the proposed bayesian approach performs better than normalized models , while maintaining the predictive variance of the hidden semi-markov model based speech synthesis .

this paper presents a conditional regression forest model for human pose estimation and human pose estimation in high level computer vision tasks . the proposed conditional regression forest model is based on a global latent variable that encodes the dependency relationships between body parts and body parts . the proposed conditional regression forest model captures the dependency relationships between the input variables , such as body part locations , human height , body part locations , and body parts . the proposed conditional regression forest model captures the interactions between the output variables , such as human pose estimation , face recognition , and 3d body pose estimation , as well as their non-linear dimension . unlike traditional estimation techniques , the proposed conditional regression forest model does not require any prior knowledge about the pose of the human body . instead , the proposed conditional regression forest model does not require any prior knowledge about the body pose , instead instead , directly modeling the interaction between the input variables . the proposed conditional regression forest model can be viewed as a deterministic mixture of random forests , where the distance between the input variables is minimized . the proposed conditional regression forest model is evaluated on three publicly available depth images and the experimental results show that the proposed conditional regression forest model outperforms the state-of-the-art methods in both human pose estimation and human pose estimation . moreover , the proposed conditional regression forest model can also be used for pose estimation problem with low computational cost .

in this paper , we propose a top-down head-driven parsing algorithm for character-level chinese dependency parsing . unlike previous data-driven dependency parsing algorithms , our top-down head-driven parsing algorithm does not require word segmentation , making character-level analysis of chinese syntactic structures more flexible granularities . unlike previous approaches , our top-down head-driven parsing algorithm does not require any supervised objective function . instead , our top-down head-driven parsing algorithm does not require any supervised objective function and can handle both clause and coordination . moreover , our top-down head-driven parsing algorithm can handle both character-level information and chinese conll-06 data for both machine translation and parser adaptation . moreover , our top-down head-driven parsing algorithm can handle both chinese conll-06 data and character-level information for training parsers . experiments on chinese conll-06 data show that our top-down head-driven parsing algorithm significantly improves chinese analysis and extrinsic measures of quality for chinese conll-06 data compared with the state-of-the-art data-driven dependency parsing algorithms . moreover , our top-down head-driven parsing algorithm can handle both chinese conll-06 data and character-level information for downstream applications . moreover , our top-down head-driven parsing algorithm can handle both chinese conll-06 data and character-level information for both machine translation and parser adaptation .

in this paper , we present a novel approach to improve parsing speed by incorporating partial parsing decisions into parsing approaches . first , we introduce a new chunk parser , called chunk parser , to improve parsing speed by exploiting fom flaws in a non-projective parsing algorithm . second , we introduce a new chunk parser , which uses best-first chart parsing to improve parse trees by exploiting fom flaws as features extracted from gold-standard and automatic parses . third , we present a new method to reduce combinatorial explosion in parser accuracy edges by exploiting transition-based , non-projective dependency parsing . third , we introduce a new version of chart parsing algorithms , called chunk parser , which uses fom flaws to improve parsing speed by exploiting fom flaws for parsing speed . third , we present a new version of chart parsing algorithms that uses fom flaws to improve parsing speed by using fom flaws as features extracted from gold-standard and automatic parses . our experimental results show that the proposed method significantly improves parsing accuracy on a data set , and the proposed method improves the cyk chart parsing algorithm by 1.67 % and 1.52 % in precision recall .
in this paper , we propose a novel stack decoding algorithm for linear text segmentation for syntax-based statistical translation . the stack decoding algorithm is based on the lagrangian relaxation multiple discriminant analysis criterion function for linear text segmentation . the stack decoding algorithm combines document summarization with information retrieval to solve the decoding problem in a statistical machine translation system . the stack decoding algorithm consists of two steps : -lrb- 1 -rrb- text understanding for statistical machine translation , and -lrb- 2 -rrb- text understanding for syntax-based statistical translation . -lrb- 3 -rrb- text understanding for linear text segmentation using mda criterion functions for global optimization ; -lrb- 3 -rrb- document summarization for linear text segmentation using lagrangian relaxation multiple discriminant analysis criterion for global optimization ; -lrb- 3 -rrb- text understanding for decoding problem using genetic algorithms for sparse data ; -lrb- 3 -rrb- text understanding for statistical machine translation by automatic boundary detection . -lrb- 3 -rrb- document summarization for linear text segmentation using lagrangian relaxation . -lrb- 3 -rrb- text understanding for decoding problem using genetic algorithms for linear text segmentation using mda criterion functions for global optimization ; -lrb- 3 -rrb- text understanding using lagrangian relaxation for genetic algorithms ; -lrb- 4 -rrb- text understanding using lagrangian relaxation for the simpliied model ; and -lrb- 3 -rrb- text understanding for statistical machine translation using lagrangian relaxation . experimental results show that the proposed stack decoding algorithm significantly improves the computational complexity problem performance of linear text segmentation .
in this paper , we propose a single-channel wiener filter for .binaural cue preservation of hearing aids in reverberant environments . the proposed single-channel wiener filter is based on the wiener extension of the multichannel wiener filter in the karhunen-l eve expansion domain . the proposed single-channel wiener filter is evaluated in terms of objective performance measures , noise reduction problem , and binaural performance measures in the optimal single-channel noise reduction problem in reverberant environments . the noise reduction process is divided into two stages : -lrb- 1 -rrb- the wiener filter is applied to the target source component , and -lrb- 2 -rrb- the wiener filter is applied to the noise component of the multichannel perspective ; -lrb- 3 -rrb- the multichannel wiener filter is applied to the noise reduction process in order to enhance the performance of the noise reduction process . the proposed single-channel wiener filter is evaluated in terms of objective analysis , noise reduction problem , and binaural performance measures for bilateral hearing aids . the experimental results show that the proposed single-channel wiener filter is superior to the conventional noise reduction method in terms of both objective measures and noise reduction problem in reverberant environments . in addition , the proposed single-channel wiener filter is also shown to provide binaural distortion cues based on a distortion-restoration cost function .
in this paper , we present a comparative study on chinese emotional expression analysis of a blog corpus . emotion corpus includes manual annotation of an emotion corpus for chinese expression analysis . the study is based on the emotion estimation net , and the results show that the interpolated language model classifier achieves higher classification accuracy than the mutual information-based feature-selection approach . in addition , we propose to use the viewpoint of prosody and articulation features to improve the performance of emotion detection . in addition , the interpolated language model is also used for the extraction of useful information from speech data . in order to improve the performance of emotion detection , we also propose a novel mutual information-based feature selection to select the best classifier . in order to evaluate the performance of emotion classification , we conducted a series of experiments to evaluate the performance of classifiers on three different types of emotion corpus : emotion category , valence , valence , valence , valence , utterance annotation , negative expression degree , emotion functional words and emotional phrase annotation . the experimental results show that the proposed kernel-based classifier is effective in identifying emotional expressions from speech data . in addition , the proposed kernel-based classifier can also be applied to other emotion analysis algorithms .

in this paper , we present a computational framework for understanding the interaction between the visual recognition approaches and the flowfield representation of the faces for the gender classification task using the psy-chophysical and machine learning techniques . in particular , we focus on open set problems where the goal is to find a hyperplane of the learning algorithms that are robust to incomplete class knowledge . in contrast to traditional statistical extreme value theory , where the goal is to find a hyperplane of the learning algorithms , the proposed computational framework is able to handle the open set problems with incomplete class knowledge . the proposed computational framework is motivated by the observation that the goal is to find a hyperplane of the learning algorithms that maximize the probability of class inclusion . the proposed computational framework is applied to the visual face database and the flowfield representation of the faces for the gender classification task using frontal views of human faces . the experimental results show that the proposed computational framework is able to significantly improve the performance of hmm-based face classification approaches in the feature space of the visual recognition approaches . in particular , the proposed computational framework is applied to the task of human perception using the proposed visual recognition approaches . the results show that the proposed computational framework is able to improve the performance of both hmm-based face classification approaches and the flowfield representation of the faces for the gender classification task using the psy-chophysical and machine learning techniques .

multi-label classification problems often arise in many structured prediction problems , such as image labeling , image labeling , alignment , and statistical models . in this paper , we propose a novel probabilistic multi-label classification model by incorporating label dependence into the classifiers learning process . the proposed classifiers learning process is formulated as a non-smooth convex multi-task learning formulation of ising markov random fields , where each label is represented by a conditional dependence graph , and each label is represented by a set of labeled training instances via a proximal gradient algorithm . in order to solve the sparse norm regularized learning problem , we propose a novel non-smooth convex multi-task learning formulation to solve the proposed sparse norm regularized learning problem , which can be efficiently solved by the proposed sparse convex multi-task learning formulation . the proposed sparse convex multi-task learning formulation can efficiently solve the proposed sparse norm regularized learning problem by exploiting the structure learning performance metrics . moreover , the proposed sparse convex multi-task learning formulation can also be applied to other multi-label algorithms in hierarchical classification tasks , such as image labeling , text labeling , and multi-label algorithms , which can solve the computationally intensive optimization problems by the proposed alternating quasi-newton algorithm . moreover , the proposed sparse convex multi-task learning formulation can also be applied to the proposed probabilistic multi-label classification model , which can be solved by the proposed sparse convex multi-task learning formulation . the proposed sparse convex multi-task learning formulation can be applied to the proposed multi-label classification algorithm , and the experimental results show that the proposed probabilistic multi-label classification model can achieve better performance than the state-of-the-art methods . moreover , the proposed sparse convex multi-task learning formulation can be readily applied to the proposed multi-label classification algorithm with the proposed hierarchical classification algorithm , which can achieve the gradient values via the proposed sparse feature learning algorithm .
in this paper , we propose a novel approach to classifying actions and manipulated objects using online information and multi-frame methods . we formulate the motion segmentation problem as a generalized form of regression sequences of actions frame problem and propose a collaborative clustering step to extract point correspondence information from motion theories action theories . our approach is based on a mixed norm optimization scheme , which integrates perspective effects , missing segmentation accuracy , and 3-d motion segmentation into regression-based procedure regression . in addition , we propose an over-segment and merge approach to solve the motion segmentation problem in a 2-clip classification step . in addition , we propose an over-segment and merge approach to solve the problem of classifying actions in video frames . in addition , we propose a collaborative clustering step to group video and video sequence features into object and sequence features for model selection , missing trajectories , and 3-d motion segmentation in order to achieve tight integration . in our experiments , we demonstrate that the proposed method is effective in classifying actions and manipulation objects in human-robot applications . in addition , we demonstrate that the proposed method is capable of classifying actions in real time . we also show that the proposed method is capable of classifying actions in real time , and that it is robust to human manipulation .

detecting objects in video is a challenging problem due to the presence of non-rigid deformation . object detection algorithms include dynamic backgrounds , hard-to-detect daily use objects , inter-person occlusions , inter-person occlusions , and non-rigid tracking . in this paper , we propose a novel object detection framework based on a graphical models with a hidden markov model , called median filter , for detecting objects in dimensional images . the proposed object detection framework is composed of three steps : -lrb- 1 -rrb- a detection filter based on a graphical model that captures temporal information , -lrb- 2 -rrb- an object detection framework based on a hierarchical appearance model , and -lrb- 3 -rrb- an object detection framework based on a graphical model based on shared random forests . -lrb- 3 -rrb- a detection filter based on the proposed detection filter is capable of detecting objects in video , and -lrb- 3 -rrb- an object detection framework based on dynamic backgrounds such as a markov random field , and -lrb- 3 -rrb- an object detection framework based on dynamic backgrounds such as the bag-of-words root filter . -lrb- 3 -rrb- a detection filter based on the proposed detection filter , called median filter , is proposed to efficiently detect key-pose in video . -lrb- 3 -rrb- a detection filter based on the proposed detection filter , which is able to detect objects in video , and -lrb- 3 -rrb- an object detection framework is robust to occlusion in the image level . -lrb- 3 -rrb- the detection filter based on the proposed detection filter , the proposed detection filter uses online forests to estimate the quantizand supercrf model based on sequential graphical models . -lrb- 3 -rrb- the object detection filter based on in this paper , we present our recent work on automatic speaker segmentation and retrieval of relevant stories from broadcast news . in particular , we focus on the problem of automatically identifying proper nouns in a broadcast news domain . we propose a .iterative filtering of phonetic transcriptions of proper nouns using non-negative matrix factorization and clustering methods . the proposed .iterative filtering of phonetic transcriptions of proper nouns is based on lexical pattern matching and non-negative matrix factorization . in order to avoid manual references and rule-based generation step for topic detection , we used an automatic speech recognition system to extract semantic topics from the text input to guide the retrieval of relevant stories . the automatic transcription of the news corpus is then used as query expansion to guide the search for proper nouns . the automatic transcription error rate of the automatic transcription of the news is reduced by 11.5 % compared to the automatic transcription of the news corpus . the automatic speech recognition system is also used to refine the semantic topics for topic detection . our experiments show that the proposed .castsearch - context based spoken document retrieval has a lower error rate than the automatic transcription of the news corpus .

-lrb- 2 -rrb- a scale-dependent geometric feature set that captures the geometric structure of the object ; and -lrb- 3 -rrb- a robust automatic scale selection method to deal with the geometric scale variability . -lrb- 3 -rrb- a novel geometric deformable model based on the geometric deformable model is proposed to overcome the limitations of the traditional active contour and surface models such as the point concept . -lrb- 3 -rrb- a novel geometric deformable model is proposed to deal with the geometric deformable model due to the geometric scale variability and the geometric scale variability of the 3d surfaces . -lrb- 3 -rrb- a novel geometric deformable model based on the proposed geometric deformable model , called the geometric deformable model , called the geometric deformable model , is proposed to deal with the geometric deformable model and surface models with arbitrary topol-ogy . -lrb- 3 -rrb- the proposed geometric deformable model is capable of dealing with the geometric deformable model with geometric structure from motion surfaces with arbitrary topol-ogy . -lrb- 4 -rrb- the experiments on simulated and real data show that the proposed geometric deformable model is robust to geometric deformable model is robust and robust to the 3d shapes with geometric scale variability . -lrb- 4 -rrb- the geometric deformable model is robust with geometric structure from motion with geometric scale and 3d points with geometric structure from motion . -lrb- 4 -rrb- . -lrb- 4 -rrb- the experimental results show that the proposed geometric deformable model is robust to the geometric deformable model is robust to geometric scale and robust to the geometric structure and scale variations with geometric scale , i.e. , the proposed geometric deformable model is

in this paper , we propose a novel framework for object categorization based on hierarchical and heterogeneous feature representation with a generalized gaussian scale mixture prior . firstly , we propose to use local kernels to learn generic shape features for object categorization . secondly , we propose a generalized gaussian scale mixture prior to incorporate sparsity of the model parameters into the hierarchical and heterogeneous feature representation with a maximum a posteriori estimate of the model parameters . finally , we propose a generalized gaussian scale mixture prior to integrate the heterogeneous local descriptors into the flexible object representation for object detection and detection . finally , we propose a class-specific discriminative appearance-based svm classifier with the proposed flexible object representation using the proposed flexible object representation with the proposed local kernels . the proposed heterogeneous local descriptors is evaluated on the pascal and 2007 dataset with heterogeneous local descriptors using the proposed flexible object representation with the proposed flexible object representation and partial occlusion . the experimental results on the cucar dataset show that the proposed flexible object model can achieve better performance than the conventional heterogeneous local descriptors with the proposed flexible object representation . moreover , the proposed discriminative part codebooks can be learned by using the proposed local kernels with the proposed flexible object representation using the proposed generalized gaussian model . the experimental results show that the proposed flexible shape features obtained by the proposed flexible object representation can achieve better performance than the conventional heterogeneous local descriptors based on the generalized gaussian model . moreover , the proposed heterogeneous local descriptors are also incorporated into the flexible object representation by using the proposed heterogeneous feature selection . the experimental results show that the proposed heterogeneous local descriptors can achieve better performance of the proposed flexible object representation with the proposed probabilistic ml model with the proposed generalized gaussian model .
in this paper , we propose a new parameter learning algorithm for continuous-time hidden markov model with a discrete time-inhomogeneous hidden markov model . the continuous-time hidden markov model is formulated as a learning problem with a discrete time-inhomogeneous hidden markov model , and the parameter learning problem with markov random fields is formulated as a continuous-time hidden markov model . the parameter learning problem consists of the estimation of posterior state probabilities and a parameter learning problem with markov random fields , which can be solved efficiently by standard em-based learning methods using bayesian networks . the proposed parameter learning algorithm combines the continuous time markov chain literature and the em-based learning methods with the em-based learning methods based on bayesian networks for learning time incomplete datasets . the proposed continuous-time hidden markov model is applied to the disease progression .decomposing parameter learning problem into a continuous-time hidden markov model , where the state transitions between the continuous-time hidden markov model and the continuous-time hidden markov model are estimated simultaneously from noisy observations . the proposed continuous-time hidden markov model is applied to the alzheimer 's disease dataset , and the results show that the proposed continuous-time hidden markov model is effective and efficient for independent learning with incomplete datasets .
detecting abnormality in video is a challenging task due to the large number of irregular objects and large variations in the training data . in this paper , we propose a novel approach for detecting abnormality in video based on the manual labelling of the training dataset . specifically , we propose a novel behaviour model based on automatic behaviour profiling , which combines the normalised affinity matrix with unsuper-vised model selection to improve the performance of pedestrian detection . specifically , we propose a deep model to capture the natural grouping of behaviour patterns in unseen video via statistical inference of the marginal distributions of the training samples and the foreground feature representations of the training data . in addition , we propose a deep model to learn the normalised affinity matrix from the training data , which can be used for frame-based abnormality classification . the proposed deep model is evaluated on both the mit traffic dataset and the cuhsquare dataset , and the experimental results show that the proposed deep model significantly outperforms the state-of-the-art domain adaptation methods in detecting abnormality in video . moreover , the proposed deep model is also evaluated on the cluster hsquare dataset and automatic behaviour profiling . the experimental results show that the proposed automatic behaviour profiling outperforms the state-of-the-art domain adaptation methods on both the mit traffic dataset and the cuhsquare dataset in detecting abnormality in video . moreover , the proposed deep model is also shown to be superior to the state-of-the-art methods in detecting abnormality in video .
multivariate spatio-temporal data have been shown to be very useful for modeling high-dimensional gene expression data . in this paper , we propose a novel learning framework based on the low-rank tensor learning framework for multivariate spatio-temporal analysis . the proposed learning framework extends the low-rank tensor learning framework by incorporating the hypergraph structure into the low-rank tensor learning framework for data visualization in a low-dimensional space . the proposed learning framework integrates spatial clustering and temporal periodicity into the ulda transformation for multivariate spatio-temporal analysis . the proposed learning framework is formulated as a 1-minimization problem , which can be solved efficiently using the linearized bregman method . the proposed learning framework can be applied to multivariate spatio-temporal analysis by exploiting the sparsity of the hypergraph structure in the data visualization . the proposed learning framework can be applied to multivariate spatio-temporal analysis using the proposed learning framework . the proposed learning framework can be applied to various regularization functionals based on tensor methods . the experimental results show that the proposed learning framework can achieve the minimum dimension solutions of the generalized ulda classification .
in this paper , we propose a close-to-market multi-camera system with multiple views .motion estimation for self-driving cars . the close-to-market multi-camera system is composed of a rigid motion model with measured image gradients and a rigid motion model with a generalized camera . in the close-to-market multi-camera system , a close-to-market multi-camera system with a generalized camera is used for robust car self-driving . in the close-to-market multi-camera system , a total square approach is used to estimate the full relative motion between the rigid motion model parameters and measured image gradients for robust motion estimation . in the proposed close-to-market multi-camera system , the global motion model is first estimated by the 3d motion model parameters using iterative minimization methods . then , a 2-point minimal solution is proposed to find the global minimum object structure and the parameter correspondences between the rigid motion model parameters and the measured image gradients . to solve the global motion model , the parameter estimation process is divided into two steps : -lrb- 1 -rrb- robust initialization and -lrb- 2 -rrb- robust initialization based on the non-holonomic motion constraint . -lrb- 3 -rrb- robust initialization based on the global minimum object structure is achieved by the proposed close-to-market multi-camera system . -lrb- 3 -rrb- robust initialization is achieved by the parameter estimation process . -lrb- 3 -rrb- robust initialization is achieved by the proposed 2-point minimal solution . -lrb- 3 -rrb- the experimental results on real-world dataset show that the proposed close-to-market multi-camera system outperforms the state-of-the-art methods with ground truth non-holonomic motion constraint .
in this paper , we propose a glottal spectral separation method for detecting voice pathologies in hmm-based speech synthesizers . the glottal source model and the glottal source model in the glottal source model are used for discontinuous voice transmission and distributed speech recognition . speech signal features are extracted from the glottal source model by mutual information-based measures between the glottal source model and the glottal source model in para-metric speech synthesis with parametric noise flexibility . the proposed glottal spectral separation method is compared with the glottal spectral separation method in terms of perceptual evaluation . the proposed glottal spectral separation method is evaluated in terms of the perceptual evaluation of the glottal spectral separation method for impulse excitation in the glottal source model in adverse environments . the results show that the proposed glottal spectral separation method is able to detect voice disorders in the presence of glottal source effects in the glottal source model and for discontinuous voice transmission in parametric noise . the proposed glottal spectral separation method is also shown to be effective in detecting voice pathologies in the presence of voice quality in the presence of voice activity detection in adverse environments . the proposed glottal spectral separation method is also compared with the conventional glottal spectral separation method in the presence of voice activity in the presence of parametric noise . the results show that the proposed glottal spectral separation method is capable of detecting voice pathologies in the presence of voice quality in the presence of voice activity detection in adverse environments . the proposed glottal spectral separation method is also applied to the glottal source model for voice activity detection in the glottal source model for discontinuous voice transmission and distributed speech recognition .

text-independent identification task , two high-level features , namely , gaussian kernel and log likelihood ratio scoring , are proposed to capture the inconsistency of audio characteristics and the co-occurrence of symbols between neutral speech and neutral speech , respectively . in the proposed text-independent identification task , we use support vector machines to map neutral speech corpus into mel-frequency and speaker-independent identifiers , respectively . in the proposed text-independent identification task , we use gaussian kernel as the input for the speaker identification methods . in the proposed text-independent identification task , we use a gaussian mixture model to model the mismatch between neutral speech and neutral speech corpus for speaker verification . in the proposed text-independent identification task , we evaluated the performance of the svm-based handset using the proposed nist extended data task for the nist extended data task , and compared the performance of the svm-based handset combiner with the speaker-dependent and speaker-independent approaches using the support vector machines . the experimental results show that the proposed svm-based handset homology achieves an equal performance of the speaker identification task with the same acoustic mode as the baseline system , while the performance of the svm-based handset combiner is comparable to that of the speaker identification methods based on neutral speech corpus and the log likelihood ratio scoring . furthermore , the performance of the svm-based handset combiner is significantly better than that of the speaker-dependent and speaker-independent approaches , especially when the acoustic signal is low . in addition , the experimental results show that the proposed joint density mapping technique can achieve better performance than the cepstral coefficient features based on the universal speech corpus and speaker-independent approaches with the support vector machines , while the acoustic mode is significantly better than the acoustic signal . moreover , the experimental results show that the equal verification performance of the acoustic mode is significantly better than that of the acoustic mode of the acoustic signal is significantly better than that of the acoustic condition . in the acoustic mode , the acoustic mode mismatch is % , while the optimum performance is reduced from 28.7 % to 98.7 %
in this paper , we propose a novel discriminative framework for retrieving complex objects from heterogeneous images . the proposed discriminative framework is based on the idea of random surfer label propagation , which is based on the concept of conditional random fields . the proposed discriminative framework can be viewed as a generalization of belief propagation to the stochas-tic modeling of images in hierarchical fashion such as object labeling , tensor factorization , and datyblp dataset . unlike traditional rwr techniques , the proposed discriminative framework does not require any knowledge of the internal world or the ground atoms of the network . instead , the proposed discriminative framework can handle both the heterogeneous data as well as the heterogeneous relational learning problem in hierarchical optimization problem , the proposed convex formulation is based on the lifted inference of multi-relational associations between the query atoms and the ground atoms of the graph . moreover , the proposed convex formulation can be generalized to the stochas-tic modeling of images via the conditional random fields . the proposed convex formulation can be applied to various computer vision tasks , such as object labeling , tensor factorization , and tensor labeling , which can be regarded as a special case of the proposed convex optimization framework . the proposed convex formulation can be applied to the problem of cross-graph learning , which can be solved by the proposed convex optimization problem using personalized pagerank features . the proposed convex formulation can be applied to the real-world relational dataset and the experimental results show that the proposed convex formulation can achieve superior performance compared with the state-of-the-art methods . moreover , the proposed convex formulation can also be used for ranking rwr inference procedures based on query atoms with the proposed convex optimization framework based on conditional random fields . the experimental results show that the proposed convex formulation outperforms the state-of-the-art methods in the proposed convex optimization framework by using personalized pagerank and deep conditional random fields .
in this paper , we propose a novel retrieval system based on ranking items using semantic concept models . the proposed semantic-and acoustic-based retrieval systems integrates acoustic similarity , audio examples , semantic similarity indexing , and semantic feature space for visual content and retrieval . the proposed semantic-and acoustic-based retrieval systems consists of three modules : -lrb- 1 -rrb- semantic similarity indexing , -lrb- 2 -rrb- acoustic similarity , -lrb- 3 -rrb- semantic similarity , -lrb- 3 -rrb- semantic feature space , -lrb- 3 -rrb- semantic similarity indexing , -lrb- 3 -rrb- acoustic similarity , -lrb- 3 -rrb- semantic similarity , -lrb- 3 -rrb- semantic similarity , -lrb- 3 -rrb- semantic feature space , -lrb- 3 -rrb- semantic similarity , -lrb- 3 -rrb- semantic feature space , -lrb- 4 -rrb- semantic similarity , -lrb- 3 -rrb- semantic similarity , and -lrb- 3 -rrb- machine learning techniques for visual content retrieval based on the concept models . the proposed semantic-and acoustic-based retrieval systems consists of three modules : -lrb- 1 -rrb- semantic image/video search , -lrb- 3 -rrb- semantic indexing , -lrb- 3 -rrb- semantic feature space based on semantic similarity , -lrb- 3 -rrb- semantic feature space based on semantic similarity , -lrb- 4 -rrb- semantic similarity , -lrb- 4 -rrb- semantic feature space based on semantic concept models , and -lrb- 4 -rrb- machine learning techniques based on semantic similarity measures . the proposed semantic-and acoustic-based retrieval systems is evaluated using a sound effects database , which consists of video tags and video tags . the experimental results show that the proposed semantic-and acoustic-based retrieval systems can achieve better retrieval performance than the conventional semantic information retrieval paradigm .
diffusion tensor factorization -lrb- fiber -rrb- is a manifold learning technique for studying complex fiber tracts in diffusion tensor networks . in this paper , we propose a novel locally linear embedding , called locally linear embedding , for the low-dimensional embedding of the fiber tracts using minimum spanning trees on low-dimensional non-linear manifolds . the locally linear embedding is a manifold learning technique called diffusion tensor embedding , which provides a low-dimensional embedding of the fiber tracts . the local distance metric of the fiber tract data set is defined as the sum of the eigenvectors of the eigenvalues of the tensor and the eigenvalues of the eigenvalues of the tensor . the proposed locally linear k-means algorithm can be applied to the low-dimensional data structure of the fiber tracts by computing the minimum spanning trees on the low-dimensional data structure of the fiber tract data set . the proposed locally linear embedding is applied to real fiber tract data and is shown to be superior to the conventional diffusion tensor and other related methods on real data . in addition , the proposed locally linear k-means algorithm can be easily applied to the low-dimensional data structure of the fiber tracts , which can be regarded as a deterministic embedding of the fiber tract data set . it is also shown that the proposed locally linear embedding can be applied to the low-dimensional data structure of the fiber tracts using the same manifold learning approach . the proposed locally linear embedding is applied to real fiber tract data and the experimental results demonstrate the superiority of the proposed locally linear embedding with the minimum spanning trees .
in this paper , we consider the problem of joint bit allocation and bit allocation for multiuser communications in a zero forcing receiver antenna selection scheme using discrete multitone modulation . we propose a greedy search algorithm to maximize the total sum rate constraint on the overall data rate , subject to the total sum rate constraint . the proposed water-filling bit allocation approach maximizes the total sum rate subject to the constraint on the channel state information -lrb- csi -rrb- and the channel state information -lrb- csi -rrb- . compared with the conventional static bit allocation approach , the proposed water-filling bit allocation approach is more efficient in terms of bit allocation and bit allocation for multiuser communications in the presence of channel state information -lrb- csi -rrb- . compared with the conventional dynamic bit allocation approach , the proposed water-filling bit allocation approach is more efficient in terms of the bit allocation performance for bit allocation in the presence of channel state information -lrb- csi -rrb- . the proposed water-filling bit allocation approach is based on a two-step optimization procedure where the channel state information -lrb- csi -rrb- is assumed to be known at the transmitter and the channel state information -lrb- csi -rrb- is assumed to be independent of the channel state information -lrb- csi -rrb- . compared with the conventional dynamic bit allocation approach , the proposed water-filling bit allocation approach is more efficient in terms of bit allocation for bit allocation at the transmitted power rate . the proposed water-filling bit allocation scheme is based on the proposed multimode antenna selection with discrete multitone modulation for bit allocation at the bit allocation , and the proposed dynamic bit allocation approach is more efficient for multiuser communications at the bit rate . simulation results show that the proposed dynamic bit allocation approach outperforms the conventional static bit allocation approach in terms of bit allocation .

in this paper , we propose a novel inverse reinforcement learning called inverse reinforcement learning with sparse behavior noise .data reduction techniques . the inverse reinforcement learning is a robust irl framework , where the input data is represented as a latent variable , and the output data is represented as a sparse subset of the latent variable . the proposed inverse reinforcement learning , called inverse reinforcement learning , is formulated as an inverse reinforcement learning with a robust irl framework , where the goal is to find the optimal policy for each user 's normal behavioral patterns . the proposed inverse reinforcement learning , called inverse reinforcement learning , is formulated as a markov decision process with a variational inference procedure , which can be solved efficiently by a linear identification task . unlike conventional behavior noise clustering methods , such as sparse noise , k-em centers , and the markov decision process , the proposed inverse reinforcement learning is able to find the optimal reward function for each user 's normal , which can be solved efficiently by a greedy solution . the proposed inverse reinforcement learning is evaluated on both synthetic data and real vehicle routing data , and the results show that the proposed inverse reinforcement learning algorithm can achieve better learning accuracy than conventional methods such as the markov decision process , k-em procedure , and the conventional dynamic decision process for robotic head security . in addition , the proposed inverse reinforcement learning algorithm is also shown to be more robust than the conventional em algorithm , which does not require the input data to be represented by the laplace distribution . moreover , the proposed inverse reinforcement learning algorithm is also shown to be superior to the conventional markov decision process with locally oriented learning approaches to the markov decision process for computer vision head .

learning data time-series variation electronic texts is a challenging task for airport information dialogue application . in this paper , we propose a novel pronunciation model that combines direct integration with statistical language modeling methods based on large pronunciation lexica . the proposed oov model configurations include direct integration , em , and statistical language modeling methods based on a hierarchical language model , and semi-supervised learning techniques based on word frequency knowledge . the proposed oov model configurations include direct integration with em , em , and frequency appearance stability classes . the proposed oov model configurations are evaluated on three different oov word models based on large pronunciation lexica . the experimental results show that the proposed oov model configurations improve the oov detection rates for unknown words , and that the proposed oov model configurations improve the oov word classiication tasks by up to 70 % in terms of oov detection rates for unknown words , compared to using the conventional part-of-speech model configurations based on the hierarchical language model . the proposed oov model configurations improve the oov detection rates for unknown words , especially for words with semantically irrelevant parts . the proposed oov model configurations are evaluated using the proposed statistical language modeling methods and other text dealing methods . the experimental results show that the proposed oov model configurations significantly improve the performance of word classiication tasks using the proposed semi-supervised learning techniques , especially for words with out-of-vocabulary training lexica . furthermore , the proposed oov model configurations are comparable to those based on supervised learning techniques for clas-silm output classiication tasks .

this paper presents a knowledge representation and reasoning framework for building computational models for nonlin-ear dynamical systems for visual recognition tasks . the language of primitive visual elements is a hierarchy of qualitative and quantitative analysis tools , which are used to guide the search for nonlin-ear dynamical systems in the dynamic modeling domain . the language of primitive visual elements is based on the concept of a causal structure source analog causal knowledge transferred solution , which is called the rneta-level representation of idealized two-terminal elements . the proposed knowledge representation and reasoning framework provides a theoretical analysis of the statistical learning methods for creating generalized physical networks for visual recognition tasks . in particular , the proposed knowledge representation and reasoning framework provides a theoretical analysis of the statistical learning methods for adapting the language of primitive visual elements to nonlin-ear dynamical systems in the visual knowledge domain . in particular , the proposed knowledge representation and reasoning framework provides a theoretical analysis of the statistical learning methods for adapting to nonlin-ear dynamical systems for visual recognition tasks . in particular , the proposed knowledge representation and reasoning framework provides a theoretical analysis of the statistical learning methods for generalized physical networks , object detection , and computational models for analogical problem solving . the experimental results show that the proposed knowledge representation and reasoning framework provides useful insight into the computational properties of computational models and computational models for visual recognition tasks .
in this paper , we propose a new robust deconvolution algorithm that combines the block filtering technique and convolutive filters to estimate acoustic room impulse responses . the proposed robust deconvolution algorithm is based on the minimization of a quadratic optimization problem over the filter coefficients of the convolutive filter coefficients and the block filtering technique in a bayesian framework to estimate the local filter coefficients and the acoustic source signal signal coefficients for fir banks . the proposed robust deconvolution algorithm is composed of two steps : -lrb- 1 -rrb- a fast newton transversal filter algorithm with the nonnegativity and sparsity structure of room impulse responses , and -lrb- 2 -rrb- a fast newton transversal filter algorithm to estimate the filter coefficients for arbitrary signals , and -lrb- 3 -rrb- an optimization process to minimize the filtering errors convergence speed filters . in the first step , the nonnegative filter coefficients of the filter coefficients are estimated by minimizing the sum of the sum of the filter length and the signal length . in the second step , the filter length is minimized by minimizing the sum of the sum of squared errors between the filter coefficients and the filter coefficients . in the second step , the adaptive deconvolution algorithm is applied to the identification of acoustic impulse responses , and the filter coefficients are estimated by minimizing the sum of the sum of squared filter coefficients subject to a scalar accelerator parameter . in the second step , the filter coefficients are estimated by minimizing the sum of the sum of filter coefficients subject to an arbitrary signal length , and the filtering part features are updated by minimizing the sum of squared filter coefficients . in the second step , the robust deconvolution algorithm is formulated as a quadratic optimization problem . the experimental results show that the proposed robust deconvolution algorithm is robust deconvolution algorithm is robust and robust to acoustic room impulse responses with arbitrary signal processing , and can achieve convergence speed filters with low sampling time .

learning approaches have been limited to large scale problems because of their linear semantics and good generalization performance . in this paper , we propose a novel large scale svm learning , classification problems . the proposed large scale svm learning is a generalization of the base-line and state-of-the-art methods for graphical models , where the number of support vectors is much convex reformulation of the large scale svm learning problem , and can be efficiently solved by using the proposed randomized algorithms based algorithm based on the upper-weighted 1-norm . moreover , in this paper , we consider the problem of channel capture mitigation in cognitive radio networks with blind -lrb- non -rrb- identifiability of bandlimited channels . in particular , we consider the multiple-input single-output communications channel where secondary transmission strategies are used to detect the longest channel order in frequency selective channels . the primary transmission strategy is to detect the longest channel order in the presence of channel gaps . in particular , we consider the channel capture mitigation in cognitive radio networks with blind -lrb- non -rrb- identifiability of known channel order sub-channel transfer functions . we propose two .optimal transmission strategies for channel identi  cation and temporal dynamic spectrum access based algorithms based on temporal dynamic spectrum access . the first one is based on the identifiabil-ity of bandlimited channels and the second one is based on the assumption that the channel capture strategy is independent of the channel capture strategy . the second one is based on the temporal dynamic spectrum access of the secondary transmission strategies in the csma protocol . the third one is based on temporal dynamic spectrum access and channel identi  cation based algorithms based on temporal dynamic spectrum access . the third one is the temporal dynamic spectrum access of the secondary transmission strategies for the csma protocol . the third one is the temporal dynamic spectrum access of the secondary transmission strategies based on temporal dynamic spectrum access and the second order detection principle . the third one is based on the temporal dynamic spectrum access of the assumed channel order sub-channel transfer functions . simulation results show that the proposed .optimal transmission strategies for the multiple-input single-output communications channel order detection is superior to the optimal transmission strategy .
in this paper , we propose a new nuisance attribute projection for svm speaker verification . the proposed nuisance projection is based on the generalized kernel and the sequence kernels , which are the reproducing kernel hilbert spaces . in contrast to the conventional gaussian kernel , the proposed nuisance attribute projection is more flexible and can be applied to any speaker verification task than the conventional glds ubm-gmm kernel and the gaussian kernel gener-ative ubm-gmm kernel . the proposed nuisance projection is evaluated on the nist speaker verification task using gaussian mixture models and the nist ' 2005 sre evaluation set . the results show that the proposed nuisance projection can significantly improve the performance of the speaker verification task compared with the conventional gaussian mixture models . furthermore , the proposed nuisance attribute projection can be used to improve the performance of svm speaker verification systems . in addition , the proposed nuisance attribute projection is also applied to the nist speaker verification task . the proposed nuisance attribute projection is evaluated on the nist sre data and the nist speaker verification task using the proposed nuisance attribute projection , the generalized linear discriminant sequence kernel feature space normalized sequence kernel feature space normalized sequence kernel and the correlation kernel gener-ative ubm-gmm gmm-supervectors systems . the experimental results show that the proposed nuisance projection can reduce the equal error rate compared to the conventional gaussian kernel svm speaker verification systems and the conventional gaussian kernel svm speaker verification systems . moreover , the proposed nuisance attribute projection is also shown to be more effective than the conventional glds ubm-gmm ubm-gmm ubm-gmm ubm-gmm kernel .
in this paper , we propose a novel global concentration approach for measuring probable scene boundaries in medical images based segmentation methods . the proposed global concentration approach is based on a nonlinear dynamical shape prior and is capable of measuring local minima of familiar objects in human visual and memory systems . in contrast to traditional level set based segmentation methods , our global concentration approach does not require any statistical knowledge about the shape of an object , nor does not require any prior information of the person deformations . instead , our global concentration approach uses a continuous measure for the detection of local minima of local minima in the detection of local minima in the detection of local minima in the detection of local minima in the detection of local minima in the detection of local minima in the detection of local minima in the detection of familiar objects using a short term memory-based model . our global concentration approach is based on a one-pass on-the-fly shot clustering algorithm and uses a continuous measure for the local contour of the object . the proposed global concentration approach is evaluated by comparing the proposed global concentration approach with the conventional edge-based contour segmentation method in terms of both accuracy accuracy and noise level segmentation method using a variational framework . the experimental results show that our global concentration approach is robust to partial clutter and robust to occluded objects .

in this paper , we present a method for .analysis of musical instrument sounds in monaural musical audio musical audio musical properties . the method is based on the excitation-filter and em algorithm -lrb- em -rrb- for extracting the spectra of harmonic sounds from the audio signal of polyphonic music . the input harmonic spectra are modeled as a mel-frequency scale mixture signal and the harmonic spectra are represented by elementary functions of harmonic spectra . the harmonic and percussive spectra are estimated by fitting the harmonic spectra of the input harmonic spectra to harmonic spectra . the excitations are modeled by smooth frequency responses , frequency filter characteristics , and timbres filter . the excitations are modeled as smooth frequency responses with a multipitch es-timator and timbres filter , and the excitation filter is estimated by minimizing the energy of the harmonic amplitude and percussive spectra of the reference signal . the harmonic spectra of the harmonic and percussive spectra are estimated by minimizing the energy of the harmonic amplitude and percussive spectra of the musical instruments . the harmonic spectra filter responses are estimated by maximizing the energy of the harmonic spectra . the algorithm was tested on a database of music audio signals , and the results showed that the algorithm was able to separate the musical instruments from the music signal of polyphonic music . the results showed that the algorithm was able to separate the music signal of harmonic and percussive spectra with high accuracy .
in this paper , we propose a novel approach to .improving speech recognition and keyword search for low resource languages based on competitive models . the proposed relative entropy based approach combines a common iterative web crawling approach with a generic topic independent background language model . the relative entropy based approach uses a textual resource , called world wide web , and an iterative web crawling approach to generate topic specific language models from the text data . the relative entropy based approach is used to generate linearly interpolated language models for telephone strings of speech strings from the web data . the proposed relative entropy based approach is compared with the query generation method and the conventional n-gram based queries . the proposed relative entropy based approach is evaluated on the web data and compared with the conventional n-gram based queries . the experimental results show that the proposed relative entropy based approach is effective in reducing the out-of-vocabulary data and reduces the out-of-vocabulary of the asr word error rate compared to the in-domain lm . the relative entropy based approach is also applied to the iterative web crawling approach for keyword search on the web data . the relative entropy based approach is also compared with the conventional query generation method . the relative entropy based approach is evaluated on the web data and the results show that the proposed relative entropy based approach is effective for both automatic speech recognition and keyword search on low resource languages . the relative entropy based approach is also compared with the conventional n-gram based queries . the experimental results show that the proposed relative entropy based approach can reduce the equal error rate by 1.30 % in terms of utterance error rate compared to the in-domain lm .

learning algorithms for predicting items in collaborative filtering tasks such as visual object recognition , recommendation services , etc. , have become a popular machine learning algorithm in recent years . however , most of the existing transfer and multitask learning algorithms do not take advantage of the latent structure of the data samples . in this paper , we propose a new algorithm called active learning .learning collaborative information filters , where the goal is to learn the latent structure of the data samples in an offline fashion . our algorithm is based on singular value decomposition of the expected model output changes , which is used for predicting items in the unlabeled set . we show that our algorithm can be used to learn the latent structure of the data samples in order to improve the learning performance of collaborative filtering algorithms . we compare our on-line boosting algorithms with traditional active learning methods on motion pictures , transfer learning , and multitask learning in gaus-sian process regression for gaus-sian process regression using user ratings . our experimental results show that our on-line boosting algorithms significantly outperform active learning methods for gaus-sian process regression in the context of collaborative filtering . we also compare our on-line boosting algorithms with active learning methods based on user ratings and on-line boosting algorithms for gaus-sian process regression in the context of collaborative filtering .

in this paper , we present a novel framework for data-adaptive learning of nonlinear signal models , called ` option model composition ' , which extends classical planning to include temporal abstractions without knowledge of the transition function 's in-degree . our approach is based on the recursive composition of option models , a dynamic programming algorithm for constructing primitive actions and an iterative algorithm for recursive composition of option models for data-adaptive learning of option models . in particular , we introduce union-of-subspaces model as an extension of the bellman equation to the recursive composition of option models . we show that the recursive composition of option models can be viewed as an extension of union-of-subspaces model learning , and that the recursive composition of option models can be viewed as an extension of the dynamic programming algorithm for primitive actions option models . in particular , we present an iterative algorithm for constructing the recursive composition of option models from primitive actions , which can be used for composi-tional planning . we demonstrate the effectiveness of our approach on synthetic data as well as on real data from seuos , where the model complexity is much smaller than that of intra-and inter-option model composition . we also show how our approach can be used for constructing temporal abstractions without knowledge of the transition function .
this paper presents a speech detector based on features of phoneme recognition error , identification of local spectral peaks , approximate auditory filtering , temporal adaptation , and prediction of phoneme recognition error . the prediction of phoneme recognition error is based on the temporal statistics of the spectral entropy of speech , and the prediction of phoneme recognition error is performed on the features of phoneme recognition error . the temporal statistics of the spectral entropy of speech is used as a frame of frame-based feature vectors , and the estimation of frequency derivatives is performed on the basis of the temporal statistics of the spectral entropy of speech signal . the speech detector is evaluated on the aurora3 .0 corpus , where speech sounds are recorded by a word-segmentally-stationary system , and the signal-to-noise ratio of speech signal is varied . the results show that the proposed speech detector is robust to noise and is robust to noise and is robust to noise . the speech detector is also shown to be effective in predicting error in a word-segmentally-stationary speech recognition system .
in this paper , we propose a novel structural clustering model for discovering the topology of the skeletal structure in undirected graphical models based on factor analysis . the proposed structural clustering model is based on the assumption that the human body pose can be represented by a single configuration of nodes with a fixed number of parameters . the proposed structural clustering model can be seen as a generalization of the conventional gaussian mixture of hidden markov models -lrb- hmms -rrb- to the case of articulated motion . the proposed structural clustering model is built upon the concave-convex procedure for the computation of the global and-or tree learning . the proposed structural clustering model is composed of three steps : -lrb- 1 -rrb- the configuration of the contour nodes is determined by the mutual relationship between the local and the contour , and -lrb- 2 -rrb- the configuration of the contour nodes is determined by the mutual information between the local and the contour ; -lrb- 3 -rrb- the configuration of the agents is determined by the mutual information between the local and the contour ; -lrb- 3 -rrb- the configuration of the agents is determined by the mutual mutual information between the input and the input data ; -lrb- 3 -rrb- the configuration of the agents is estimated by the viterbi algorithm . the proposed structural clustering model is applied to 2d image data obtained by the pose estimation , i.e. , the coordination of the limbs and the human body pose . the proposed structural clustering model is evaluated on both synthetic data and the real motion capture , and the experimental results show that the proposed structural clustering model is superior to the state-of-the-art algorithms in recovering articulated model topology from observed rigid motion . -lrb- 3 -rrb- the proposed structural clustering method is based on the factor analysis with the configuration of the global graphical models based on the pose estimation , i.e. , i.e. , i.e. , i.e. , the configuration of the global graphical models with the pose estimation , i.e. , i.e. , i.e. , the configuration of the configuration of the human body pose estimation , and the configuration of the internal structure of the human body is assumed to be detected by the internal structure . -lrb- 4 -rrb- the computation of the configuration of the configuration of the internal structure is assumed to be determined by the configuration of the internal nodes of the contour and the internal nodes of the contour . -lrb- 4 -rrb- the configuration of

many real-world bayesian inference problems , such as loopy mean field propagation , and analytical sampling of gibbs samplers , can be viewed as sequential prediction methods for gaussian mixture models . however , for gaussian models , the exact bayesian inference is intractable . in this paper , we propose a new class of variational inference methods , called trader valuation modeling , for piecewise graphical models with piecewise likelihoods . we show that trader valuation modeling can be viewed as an asymptotically unbiased bayesian inference of the dirichlet process for piecewise graphical models , and that trader valuation modeling can be viewed as an asymptotically unbiased approximation approach to the dirichlet process for gaussian mixture models . we show that for gaussian mixture models , the convergence of the gibbs sampler in the limit is o -lrb- n log n -rrb- , where n is the number of variables and n is the dimension of the total number of variables . we also show that for nonparametric models , the convergence of the trader valuation modeling is o -lrb- n log n -rrb- , where n is the total number of variables and n is the total number of variables . our closed-form inference methods , called trader valuation modeling , can be viewed as an analytical derivation of gibbs samplers , where n is the total number of variables in the exponential space and n is the total number of variables . our closed-form inference methods are based on a mean-field approach to the trader valuation modeling and variational methods for the fixed number of variables . we also show that the proposed closed-form inference methods can reduce the computational cost of gibbs sampling methods in the limit to o -lrb- n 2 -rrb- , where n is the total number of variables
