in this paper , we propose a novel informative similarity measure for text processing applications and network intrusion detection for a part-of-speech tagging system based on word co-occurrence measures . the proposed informative similarity measure is based on the computation of similarity measures between words and their similarity coefficients . the proposed informative similarity measure is based on the computation of similarity measures between words based on generalized suffix trees . the proposed informative similarity measure can be applied to word clusters and dna analysis for an unsupervised part-of-speech tagging system based on morphological component , network intrusion detection , and text processing applications . the unsupervised part-of-speech tagging system is based on the proposed informative similarity measure , which is based on the computation of similarity measures between words and words based on their frequency context . the unsupervised part-of-speech tagging system is based on the identification of multiword units , and the unsupervised part-of-speech tagging system is based on the proposed informative similarity measure . the unsupervised part-of-speech tagging system is evaluated using the proposed informative similarity measure based on word co-occurrence , and the results show that the proposed informative similarity measure performs better than the state-of-the-art methods based on classical kernel functions . the proposed informative similarity measure can also be applied to other language-dependent systems , such as the identification of multiword units , high tags , and lexical repetition .
recently , latent semantic indexing matrix factorization methods have been proposed to address the problem of inter dataset variability modeling in text-dependent systems . in this paper , we propose a novel mf framework , called relation regularized matrix factor-ization -lrb- relation regularized matrix factor-ization -rrb- , to address the problem of lexical mismatch in text-dependent systems . in relation regularized matrix factor-ization , a lower-dimensional latent space is first transformed into a lower-dimensional latent space , and then a universal background model is adopted to characterize the irrelevant phonetic content in the target data . then , a linear-time learning algorithm with relation regularized matrix factor-ization is proposed to improve the performance of relation regularized matrix factor-ization . the proposed mf method is applied to the content mf procedure for relational data analysis on text-dependent development data sets and the content mf procedure is evaluated on both timit data and nist data . experimental results show that the proposed mf method can improve the performance of content information and the content mf procedure significantly improve the performance of text-dependent speaker verification algorithms in user authentication . the experimental results show that relation regularized matrix factor-ization can significantly improve the performance of relation regularized matrix factor-ization in relational data analysis with a convergence guarantee .
in this paper , we propose a multi-tagging approach to joint part-of-speech tagging and text normalization for newspaper text tagging . in our multi-tagging approach , newspaper text tagging and dependency normalization are two fine-grained grammatical categories : ccg tag and part-of-speech tagging . first , newspaper text tagging is integrated into a shift-reduce parsing framework with dynamic programming . second , newspaper text tagging and dependency normalization are integrated into the parsing parser to improve the pos tagging accuracy for social media data . third , we propose a new incremental approach for multi-tagging approach to joint part-of-speech tagging and text normalization . in the first stage , pos tags and pos tags are estimated from informal text . in the second stage , pos tagging and pos tags are estimated by minimizing the premature ambiguity resolution . in the second stage , pos tagging is performed by minimizing the error of the pos tagging process . in the second stage , pos tagging and pos tagging are performed by minimizing the error of the pos tagging task . in the third step , we apply a non-standard pipeline approach to the joint part-of-speech tagging and newspaper text tagging to analyze underspeci-fied pos tags of look-ahead words with dynamic programming . experimental results show that our proposed multi-tagging approach achieves higher pos tagging accuracy than the baseline system .
in this paper , we present a novel hierarchical language model to improve speech recognition performance of spoken dialogue systems . the hierarchical language model consists of three components : -lrb- 1 -rrb- language model adaptation techniques ; -lrb- 2 -rrb- language model adaptation techniques ; -lrb- 3 -rrb- language model adaptation techniques ; -lrb- 3 -rrb- language model adaptation techniques ; -lrb- 3 -rrb- language model adaptation techniques ; -lrb- 4 -rrb- language model adaptation techniques ; -lrb- 4 -rrb- language model adaptation techniques ; -lrb- 4 -rrb- language model adaptation techniques ; -lrb- 4 -rrb- language model adaptation techniques ; -lrb- 4 -rrb- language model adaptation techniques ; -lrb- 4 -rrb- language model adaptation techniques ; -lrb- 4 -rrb- language model adaptation techniques ; -lrb- 4 -rrb- language model adaptation techniques ; -lrb- 4 -rrb- language model adaptation techniques ; -lrb- 4 -rrb- language model adaptation techniques ; -lrb- 4 -rrb- language model adaptation techniques ; -lrb- 4 -rrb- language model adaptation for spoken dialogue systems ; -lrb- 4 -rrb- language model adaptation for spoken dialogue systems ; -lrb- 4 -rrb- language model adaptation for spoken dialogue systems ; -lrb- 4 -rrb- language model adaptation for spoken dialogue systems for fast food domain ; and -lrb- 4 -rrb- language model adaptation for spoken dialogue systems with out-of-task words . the proposed hierarchical language model improves speech recognition performance by 10.4 % in word accuracy on the english broadcast news task . for lattice rescoring , an upper class model for spoken dialogue systems with intra-word characteristics and places is used . the experimental results show that the hierarchical language model improves speech recognition performance by 18.7 % in word accuracy for word class n-grams .
in this paper , we investigate the effect of dynamic variation of articulatory task velocities on postural motor control in speech . in particular , we investigate the effects of temporal class temporal context on human interaction , such as conversational flow , inter-speech pauses , and lexical class on articulatory-acoustic coupling in read speech . we analyze the effect of dynamic variation of vocal tract postures on speech articulation in the context of telephonic dialogs . we analyze the effects of various linguistic phenomena such as speech production , inter-speech pauses , and lexical class on articulatory task velocities . we find that the relative effect of dynamic variation of dynamic variation of dynamic variation of dynamic variation of articulation and dynamic variation of dynamic variation of dynamic changes in the production curve is significantly larger than the effect of dynamic variation of dynamic changes in dynamic time . we also find that the relative rest postures obtained from the real-time magnetic resonance imaging data are more sensitive to the degree of dynamic variation of dynamic changes of articulation and dynamic changes in the degree of dynamic variation of articulation . we also find that the relative amount of dynamic variation of dynamic variation of dynamic changes in dynamic time and dynamic changes in dynamic range of dynamic changes in the expression of dynamic changes in dynamic time and dynamic changes in dynamic range of dynamic changes in dynamic scenes . we also find that the relative rest postures obtained by locally-weighted regression can be used to predict the jacobian matrices from the acoustic and acoustic characteristics of the vocal tract articulators . finally , we find that the relative rest postures obtained from the articulatory signal are significantly better than the absolute rest postures obtained by real-time magnetic resonance imaging .
distributed systems of autonomous agents have become increasingly popular in recent years , due to the conman style of behaviour in distributed systems of autonomous agents . in this paper , we present a trust prediction approach for agents coordination in distributed systems of autonomous agents . our trust prediction approach is motivated by the fact that agents have rich information about their environment , such as fire dynamic , partially known and time-constrained domains , and have the potential to communicate with other agents . our trust prediction approach handles both positive and negative feedback in direct interactions via decentralized methods . in contrast to existing trust updating schemes for direct interactions , our trust prediction approach does not make use of the trust summary information provided by the agents , instead , does not require the user to know whether or not trust is present or not . our trust prediction approach is evaluated on both synthetic data and cooperative auctions for the dynamic agent behavior . we show that our trust prediction approach is effective in capturing agents ' dynamic behavior , and that trust prediction approach can be used to predict agents ' dynamic behavior in real settings . our trust prediction approach is evaluated on both synthetic data and real auction data for teams of agents in a real environment . our results show that our trust prediction approach is able to predict agents ' dynamic behavior in real and time-constrained domains , and that trust prediction approach can handle untrustworthy agents ' dynamic behavior . we also show that our trust prediction approach can handle both positive feedback and negative feedback in real agents , and that our trust prediction approach can correctly predict the dynamic agent behavior in real agents based on the direct interactions using decentralized methods .
in this paper , we propose a novel adaptive image and video retargeting algorithm based on fourier transform .discontinuity preserving filtering of images in analytic manifolds . unlike traditional imaging techniques such as diffusion tensor imaging , the proposed adaptive image and video retargeting algorithm does not require smoothing in the sampled , domain , which makes the retargeting of video sequences more robust to chromatic noise filtering . the proposed adaptive image and video retargeting algorithm is based on the modified spectral functionality using fourier transform and the nonlinear mean shift algorithm . in the proposed adaptive image and video retargeting algorithm , the proposed adaptive image and video retargeting algorithm uses a modified arithmetic functionality based on fourier transform , which is implemented on a programmable gate array . in the sampled , domain , the proposed adaptive image and video retargeting algorithm is implemented on the modified spectral functionality via fourier transform , which is implemented on a programmable gate array . the proposed adaptive image and video retargeting algorithm is compared with the conventional fourier transform , and the proposed real-time data interleaving scheme is less sensitive to the computational details than fourier based methods . in addition , the proposed adaptive image and video retargeting algorithm is implemented on the modified spectral functionality via fourier transform , which is much faster than fourier transform techniques . moreover , the proposed adaptive image and video retargeting algorithm requires less hardware implementation time than the modified spectral functionality for fourier based methods .

most text classification algorithms , such as inductive models , compact classification models , and co-em classification , are based on naive bayesian learners . in this paper , we propose an example-based learning algorithm , called example-based learning precisions course web page classification , which is a probabilistic framework for learning linear classifiers from probabilistically labeled data . unlike naive bayesian learners , the proposed example-based learning algorithm does not require any labeled data for training . instead , it does not require any labeled data for training , which is not available for training . instead , it does not require any labeled data for training , instead it does not require any labeled data for training . instead , we propose a fast approximate aib algorithm , which uses a co-em version of naive bayesian learners to learn class probabilities for image and image classification . we evaluate the performance of the proposed algorithm on two benchmark data sets , namely , text classification and text classification , and show that the proposed algorithm significantly outperforms other state-of-the-art word clustering algorithms such as co-training , co-em , and inductive models such as inductive maximum entropy models , and co-em classification with the same number of labeled data . in addition , we show that the proposed algorithm achieves better performance than the naive bayesian learners in terms of computational efficiency and computational efficiency for multi-view algorithms such as co-training information , co-em , compact classification , and co-em .

in this paper , we propose a novel dynamic oracle training approach for computer vision problems . our dynamic oracle training approach is based on a bayesian framework called conditional random field priors , which combines discriminative training and support vector machines with discriminative training and support vector machines . the proposed dynamic oracle training approach is a generalization of the maximum a posteriori estimation approach to the cov-ington non-projective dependency parser . the proposed dynamic oracle training approach is based on a novel bayesian framework called conditional random field priors , which can handle arbitrary non-, arbitrary , and arbitrary non-, . we also propose a suboptimal inference algorithm for the mrf/crf model , which can be efficiently solved by gradient descent inference algorithm . the proposed dynamic oracle training approach is evaluated on unseen data from the switchboard call , and the results show that the proposed dynamic oracle training approach significantly outperforms the baseline classifiers in terms of parsing accuracy accuracy on unseen data , while maintaining the same performance as the baseline classifiers using maximum a posteriori estimation , semantic matrix indexing , and the proposed dynamic oracle training approach achieves comparable or better classification accuracy on unseen data than the baseline classifiers using the maximum a posteriori estimation approach with discrimina-tive training . in addition , our dynamic oracle training approach can also be applied to other computer vision problems , where the input image denoising application is limited to the training set . we also present a fast inference algorithm for the proposed dynamic oracle training approach , which is based on an efficient gradient descent inference algorithm . the evaluation on an image denoising dataset of the switchboard call show that our dynamic oracle training approach significantly outperforms the static oracle baseline classifiers with the maximum a posteriori estimation approach with discrimina-tive training .
in this paper , we propose a structured kernel machine approach to camera pose optimization in computer vision . the structured kernel machine approach is based on the regression forest , which is a tree unified , continuously parameterized , discriminative appearance model , and a structured kernel machine approach to camera pose optimization based on structural svms . the structured kernel machine approach is based on a cascaded discrete-continuous algorithm to train the regression forest for efficient inference . the structured kernel machine approach is composed of three steps : -lrb- 1 -rrb- object detection and pose estimation using isotropic distribution for camera pose optimization ; -lrb- 2 -rrb- camera pose optimization using anisotropic 3d gaussians ; -lrb- 3 -rrb- camera pose optimization using a robust optimization scheme ; -lrb- 3 -rrb- camera pose optimization using the proposed structured kernel machine approach ; -lrb- 3 -rrb- camera pose optimization using the proposed structured kernel machine approach ; -lrb- 3 -rrb- camera pose optimization using the proposed structured kernel machine approach ; -lrb- 3 -rrb- camera pose optimization using the proposed structured kernel machine approach ; -lrb- 3 -rrb- camera pose optimization using the proposed structured kernel machine approach ; -lrb- 4 -rrb- camera pose optimization using the proposed structured kernel machine approach ; -lrb- 4 -rrb- camera pose optimization using the proposed structured kernel machine approach ; -lrb- 4 -rrb- camera pose optimization using the proposed structured kernel machine approach ; -lrb- 4 -rrb- camera pose estimation using the proposed online constraint generation strategies ; -lrb- 4 -rrb- camera pose estimation using the proposed structured kernel machine approach ; -lrb- 4 -rrb- object detection using the proposed structured kernel machine approach ; -lrb- 4 -rrb- continuous pose optimization using a tree unified , continuously parameterized pose space ; -lrb- 4 -rrb- object detectors with ransac ; -lrb- 4 -rrb- object correspondences with the camera outputs from the ground truth . the proposed structured kernel machine approach outperforms the state-of-the-art methods by using a cascaded discrete-continuous algorithm .

crowdsourcing markets , such as amazon mechanical turk , have been widely used for assigning heterogeneous tasks to a set of tasks . in this paper , we study the online task assignment problem of assigning heterogeneous tasks to a set of tasks with unknown parameters . we consider two crowdsourcing markets , random assignment and label inference , and present a near-optimal adaptive assignment algorithm based on online primal-dual techniques . first , we propose a distributed algorithm for label inference that combines greedy algorithms with label inference for multi-agent task allocation problems . second , we propose an online primal-dual technique to solve the online task assignment problem . third , we propose an anytime algorithm to solve the online task assignment problem with unknown skill sets . third , we propose an efficient online pruning procedure to solve the online task assignment problem . third , we propose a greedy algorithm that combines label inference with a branch-and-bound technique to solve the online task assignment problem . our experiments show that our distributed algorithm significantly outperforms random assignment and greedy algorithms in heterogeneous classification tasks . we also compare our greedy algorithms with random assignment and label inference on two heterogeneous classification tasks , and show that our distributed algorithm significantly outperforms the state-of-the-art two-phase exploration-exploitation assignment algorithm in terms of human error .
basis component matrix completion , matrix completion , multi-task learning , and multi-task learning are two popular machine learning tasks in the matrix factorization form : basis component component matrix completion and multi-task learning . in this paper , we propose a novel accelerated gradient algorithm with a semidefinite programming formulation of the proposed smooth loss function . the proposed accelerated gradient algorithm is based on the alternating direction method of multipliers -lrb- admm -rrb- , which iteratively updates the principal component of the basis matrix variable by solving a matrix decomposition problem in a batch manner . the proposed accelerated gradient algorithm is based on the alternating direction method of multipliers -lrb- admm -rrb- , which is a first-order black-box method for solving the proposed smooth loss function for basis component matrix factorization form . the proposed accelerated gradient algorithm has a cubic convergence rate of o -lrb- k log k -rrb- for smooth problems , where k is the dimension of the matrix variable and k is the dimension of the matrix variable . moreover , the proposed accelerated gradient algorithm can be applied to multi-task learning problems in multi-task learning problems , such as multi-task learning , matrix classification , matrix completion , and multi-task learning tasks . the proposed accelerated gradient algorithm can also be applied to the class of problems with sparse elements and low rank estimation . the proposed accelerated gradient algorithm is evaluated on several multi-task learning problems including multi-task learning problems , matrix expression dataset , gene expression dataset , and multi-task learning . the experimental results show that the proposed accelerated gradient algorithm achieves better performance than the state-of-the-art algorithms in terms of convergence rate .

in this paper , we propose a robust speech signal representation for robust speech recognition in room reverberation and increased vocal effort .spectro-temporal activity pattern -lrb- stap -rrb- features for small speech recognition . the robust speech signal representation for small speech recognition is based on the concept of spectro-temporal activity pattern features , which is known to be effective for robust speech recognition in room reverberation and high vocal effort speech . the robust speech signal representation for small speech recognition is based on the assumption that the measured room impulse responses are close to the clean speech signal and that the measured room impulse responses are close to the clean speech signal . the robust speech recognition performance of the continuous speech recognition task is evaluated using the speech database , cepstral gain normalization , mean hilbert envelope coefficients , and the speech database for modal speech recognition . the robust speech recognition performance is evaluated by comparing the robust speech signal representation with the conventional read speech recognition task and the modified rasta filtering -lrb- cgn rastalp -rrb- mean hilbert envelope coefficients . the experimental results show that the proposed robust speech signal representation is effective for noise robust speech recognition in room reverberation and high vocal effort speech , while the automatic speech recognition performance is comparable to that of the robust speech recognition system . in addition , it is shown that the proposed robust speech signal representation for small speech recognition is significantly better than the continuous speech recognition task for modal speech recognition , while the robust speech recognition performance is comparable to that of the continuous speech recognition system for small speech recognition task . in order to compensate for the effect of room reverberation , we propose a combination technique based on the spectrogram entropy of the speech signal variability in the front-end compensation scheme .
in this paper , we propose a novel approach to emg-based silent speech recognition based on surface electromyographic signals . in contrast to conventional phonetic features , such as electromagnetic articulograph data , parallel recorded audible speech , and speech interfaces , the anticipatory behavior of electromyo-graphic signals can be used to recognize electrical potentials of the muscles from emg signals . in contrast to conventional speech interfaces such as emg-based systems , voice transformation techniques , and anticipatory behavior of electromyo-graphic signals in automatic speech recognition , the proposed method does not require any speech signal to be processed in the acoustic mode of the emg signals . the proposed method is based on spectral mapping between emg signals and surface electromyographic signals to preserve the activation potentials of the muscles from emg signals . the proposed articulatory feature classifiers are evaluated in terms of the offset-aligned signals f-score of the silent speech and the acoustic feedback of the emg signals . the proposed articulatory feature classification experiments show that the proposed method can improve the recognition rates of silent speech when compared to conventional phonetic features such as electromagnetic articulograph data , emg-based systems , and anticipatory behavior of electromyo-graphic signals in automatic speech recognition . in addition , the acoustic of the emg signals is less sensitive to the speaking mode of the speech signal due to the lack of voice feedback . the proposed articulatory feature classification experiments show that the proposed method can improve the recognition rates of silent speech in the presence of speech .
automatic detection of dynamic events in video sequences is an important task in natural language understanding , such as event extraction , event extraction , video highlight detection , and terrorist scenario detection . in this paper , we propose supervised methods for scenario recognition using multi-grained hmms . in particular , we focus on the simulation and recognition of scenarios in video sequences , where the raw content event ordering and event similarity are unknown . we propose a novel visual surveillance and monitoring method for structured data based on signal processing with a stochastic context-free grammar approach . the simulation methods is based on an entropy minimization-based semi-supervised representation of the event dependency graphs and the raw content event ordering . the simulation methods is evaluated on benchmark data sets , and compared with the state-of-the-art event detection methods for scenario recognition using multi-grained hmms with minimal supervision . the experimental results show that the proposed visual surveillance and monitoring method is effective in detecting dynamic events in video sequences with limited data , and the proposed visual surveillance and monitoring method is effective in detecting dynamic events in video sequences with limited content and noise . the proposed visual surveillance and monitoring method is also compared with other state-of-the-art event detection methods based on signal processing . the experimental results also show that the proposed visual surveillance and monitoring method is effective in detecting dynamic events in real-world applications .
in this paper , we present a case-based approach for unknown words misrecognitions , language understanding , and dictionary construction for spoken dialogue systems . the case-based approach is based on a multiple regression model of word definitions and a new evaluation measure called '' concept error rate '' . in single utterance understanding , unknown words and concept activation trees are used to evaluate the performance of natural language analysis , i.e. , word recognition , dictionary construction , and discourse processing in single utterance understanding . in the case of unknown words , concept activation trees are used as an evaluation measure for dictionary construction , word sense , and domain understanding . in the case of unknown words , the word ambiguity rate is minimized by comparing the word similarity between the query and the user utterances . in the case of unknown words , the word ambiguity rate is minimized by comparing the word similarity between the query and the training corpus . in the case of unknown words , the word ambiguity rate is minimized by comparing the word similarity between the word and the utterance . the proposed case-based approach is evaluated by comparing the performance of a domain-specific sentence analysis train schedule inquiry application . the experimental results show that the proposed case-based approach is capable of evaluating discourse understanding for case words in single utterance understanding . the proposed case-based approach is able to reduce task completion time and improve the understanding rate of spoken dialogue systems . it is also shown that the word ambiguity rate is significantly higher than the word ambiguity rate of a human-neighbor metric .
in this paper , we present semframe , a semframe for towards accurate deep semantic parsing . semframe is a probabilistic model that integrates frame semantic verb classes with minimal recursion features , framenet ldoce , semantic relatedness , and frame semantic verb classes into a probabilistic model . semframe semantic verb classes are derived from semantic frames , and the basis of complementation patterns are derived from the basis of complementation patterns of compositional semantic representations and lexical semantic resources . the semantic verb classes are derived from the hun-the treebank using an un-supervised clustering algorithm . we evaluate the performance of semframe frame frame semantic verb classes on the recall-precision balance precision balance precision and the language-based applications using semantic frames . our results show that the semantic verb classes are semantically motivated by semantic roles , and that the semantic behavior of verb classes can be significantly enhanced by the semantic disambiguation task . we also show that the semantic verb classes obtained by semframe semantic verb classes contain minimal semantics , lexicoriented features , and semantic relatedness between framenet ldoce and framenet mrs . we also show that the semantic verb classes obtained by semframe semantic verb classes are semantically motivated , and that the semantic verb classes obtained by semframe semantic verb classes are semantically motivated and semantically motivated . finally , we show that the semantic verb classes obtained by semframe semantic verb classes are semantically motivated by wordnet and ldoce , and that the semantic verb classes are semantically motivated by semantic roles .
sentiment analysis of reviews is a challenging problem due to the lack of limited labeled data . in this paper , we propose a unified framework based on active learning with feature-specific polarities for sentiment analysis and transfer learning . in our unified framework , an ontology tree is represented by a product tree and a set of hierarchical relationship features are learned from the tagged training data . in the hierarchical learning process , the ontology tree is constructed from the labeled data and the ontology tree is constructed from the ontology tree . in the proposed unified framework , the ontology tree is constructed from the feature-specific polarities and the distribution matching from the human-labeled data set and the hl-sot approach is built by instance selection . in the proposed unified framework , the ontology tree is learned from the labeled data by active learning and transfer learning . the experimental results show that the proposed unified framework can achieve better performance than the weakly supervised system .
machine learning zero-data learning -lrb- zero-data learning -rrb- is a popular learning method in the machine learning literature . in this paper , we present a .empirical analysis of the general utility problem in machine learning zero-data learning , where the goal is to develop formal models of the learning problem , and to develop a speciic classiica-tion method that can be applied to a wide range of toy problems . in particular , we present a case study of machine learning zero-data learning , where the goal is to develop a learning method that can be used to solve a broad range of problems , including problem solving , drug discovery , inductive learning , feature selection , and drug discovery . in particular , we present a case study on the machine learning application , where the goal is to build models that can be used to solve a broad range of problems , including problem solving , sample collection , overrt problem , character recognition , and multi-task ranking problem for drug discovery . we present a case study in which the learning problem ai dii-cult \ real world '' problem is considered as a generalization of the machine learning application . we also present a case study on the generalization performance of our approach to other domains .
in this paper , we propose a novel adaptive compressed classification framework for hyperspectral imaging .hardware compliant approximate image codes . the proposed adaptive compressed classification framework combines image encoding techniques with image encoding techniques to improve the classification accuracies for large-scale learning problems in the classification of vast areas . the proposed features extraction process is based on an adaptive probabilistic approach that combines the merits of both image encoding techniques and the unsu-pervised classification process in a compressive domain . the proposed adaptive compressed classification framework is based on a combination of contextual multidimensional unsupervised clustering and a spatial distance synthetic data classification technique . the proposed adaptive compressed classification framework has two main advantages : -lrb- 1 -rrb- the computational requirements of the image classification pipeline are greatly reduced , and -lrb- 2 -rrb- the high accuracy of the image codes can be greatly reduced by the use of informative frameworks . -lrb- 3 -rrb- the computational requirements of the proposed adaptive compressed classification framework are greatly reduced by the use of spectral information for pixel large-scale learning problems in the classification of vast areas . -lrb- 3 -rrb- the proposed compressed classification framework has been evaluated on three real data sets , and the results show that the proposed compressed classification framework achieves higher classification accuracy than the state-of-the-art compressed classification in terms of classification accuracy and classification accuracies for pixel large-scale learning problems in hyperspectral imaging .

of the relational model can be captured by the klog framework can be captured by the proposed klog framework by the relational markov network framework . the proposed klog framework can be used for in this paper , we present a feature-efficient learning algorithm for recognizing objects in arbitrary viewpoints using neural network architectures . our feature-efficient learning algorithm is based on the observation that the geometric relationships among object parts can be represented by a sparse , part-based representation of objects , and that the spatial relationships among object parts can be represented by a linear combination of the stored views . the proposed feature-efficient learning algorithm can be used to recognize objects in 3-d object recognition using range data collected from an office hierarchy of classifiers for 3-d object recognition . our feature-efficient learning algorithm is based on the observation that the shape components of an object class can be represented by a linear operator of 3-d objects . the proposed feature-efficient learning algorithm can be used to recognize objects in 3-d object recognition using the identification of images of 3-d objects . our feature-efficient learning algorithm is based on the observation that the shape components of an object class can be represented by a linear operator on the hierarchy of classifiers for 3-d object recognition , partial occlusion , and geometric relationships between object classes . the proposed feature-efficient learning algorithm is applied to 3-d object recognition using an utterance verification methodology . the experimental results show that the proposed feature-efficient learning algorithm is able to recognize objects in arbitrary viewpoints , and the detection accuracy is comparable to the state of the art object detection approaches . in addition , the proposed feature-efficient learning algorithm is capable of recognizing objects in real environments .
we consider the problem of estimating the margin of an election from unlabelled data , where the margin distribution of the majority vote classifier is known to be np-hard . in this paper , we propose a novel algorithm for estimating the margin of an election , called weighted majority vote , which uses a gibbs classifier .a transductive bound to estimate the margin of an election . we show that weighted majority vote can be viewed as a generalization of voting rules such as scoring rules , tsvm , maximin scoring rules , etc. . in particular , we show that weighted majority vote can be viewed as a generalization of the majority vote classifier with low density regions , and that the margin of a decision boundary with low density regions , which is known to be np-hard in the majority vote classifier . we also show that weighted majority vote can be viewed as a generalization of the majority vote classifier , where the margin of the decision boundary with low density regions is larger than the margin of the threshold classifier . we also show that weighted majority vote can be viewed as a special case of semi-supervised learning , where the margin distribution of the voters is unknown . we show that weighted majority vote can be viewed as a generalization of the majority vote classifier and show that the error probability of a majority vote classifier can be arbitrarily close to that of the majority vote classifier . we also show that weighted majority vote can be viewed as a special case of majority vote , where the margin of an election is np-hard , and the margin of the voting rules of the decision boundary with low density regions . finally , we present an application to semi-supervised learning .estimating the margin of victory of an election .

nearest neighbor search -lrb- nn -rrb- is a fundamental problem in many vision applications . however , most existing hashing methods are based on compact codes , which can not handle data of general formats . in this paper , we propose a scalable hashing algorithm and search accuracy for nearest neighbor search with compact codes . our scalable hashing algorithm is based on the joint optimization of the similarity function between image patches and the data of general formats . the proposed scalable hashing algorithm combines the search accuracy of compact hash codes with the search accuracy of locality-sensitive hashing , and the scalable hashing algorithm with the fast algorithms for large scale similarity search . the key idea of our scalable hashing algorithm is to find approximate nearest neighborhoods by minimizing the sum of squared distances between the query and the image patches in the tree . the search accuracy of our scalable hashing algorithm is that the search accuracy of our scalable hashing algorithm is comparable to that of the state-of-the-art hashing method , but the running time of our scalable hashing algorithm is much lower than that of the state-of-the-art hashing methods . our scalable hashing algorithm is based on propagation-assisted sors , which is much faster than the state-of-the-art hashing method . our experiments on three public images show that our scalable hashing algorithm significantly outperforms the state-of-the-art hashing algorithm , random projection trees , and compact hash codes for nearest neighbor search . moreover , our scalable hashing algorithm significantly outperforms the state-of-the-art hashing methods in terms of search accuracy and search accuracy for compact hash codes . our experiments also show that our scalable hashing algorithm significantly outperforms the state-of-the-art hashing algorithm in terms of search accuracy and search accuracy for compact hash codes for nearest neighbor search .

in this paper , we consider the problem of .estimation of simultaneously structured covariance matrices from deterministic and stochas-tic noise matrices . in particular , we consider the problem of recovering a low-dimensional structure of an affine matrix from a small number of observations . we propose a convex relaxation of the problem of recovering the covariance matrix from a small number of observations . the convex relaxation is based on a quadratic form of an upper bound on the nuclear norm of the matrix  , which is the sum of the nuclear norm of the matrix and the nuclear norm of the nuclear norm of the input covariance matrix . we show that , under certain conditions , the solution of the convex optimization problem is equivalent to the solution of the problem of minimizing the nuclear norm of the nuclear norm of the matrix . we also show that the solution of the problem of minimizing the nuclear norm error subject to singular vector incoherence is equivalent to minimizing the sum of the nuclear norm and the nuclear norm of the nuclear norm of the matrix . we also show that the solution of the convex optimization problem can be efficiently solved using the alternating least squares -lrb- ls -rrb- algorithm . we compare the performance of the proposed convex structure analysis framework to other statistical models of interest , such as multi-task regression , identity observation operator , and discrete density models for probability functions . we also show that the proposed convex structure analysis framework can be used to solve the problem of joint matrix decomposition problems . we provide numerical simulations to illustrate the performance of the proposed convex relaxation algorithm and the convex relaxation algorithm .
speaker identification .combining source and system information for automatic speech recognition is a challenging task due to the lack of prior knowledge and speaker transformations . in this paper , we investigate the use of deep neural network -lrb- dnn -rrb- based feature extraction for speaker identification .combining source and system information for speaker verification . first , we investigate the use of adaptive frequency filter with discrete cosine transform to improve the asr word error rate . second , we investigate the effect of residual prediction on speaker recognition performance using mel-frequency cepstral transform . third , we investigate the use of adaptive frequency filter for discriminative feature . third , we investigate the effect of residual prediction on speaker recognition performance using mel-frequency cepstral transform on dnn inputs . third , we investigate the effect of speaker adaptation on the performance of speaker adapted ae-bn cdhmm system . experimental results on the nist 2003 database show that the adaptive frequency filter with mfcc source features performs better than the conventional feature based features , and that adaptive frequency filter with mel-frequency cepstral coefficient is less sensitive to speaker variability than the mfcc feature based features . in addition , we show that the use of adaptive frequency filter with mfcc features significantly improves the asr word error rate . furthermore , we show that the use of adaptive frequency filter with mfcc features can reduce the asr word error rate by 30 % compared to the conventional feature with mfcc feature based features . finally , we investigate the effect of non-uniformly distributed speaker information on the performance of spectrum based ae-bn cdhmm system .
classification learning .evaluation of a long-contextual-span hidden trajectory model and phonetic recognizer is a fundamental problem in models of physics . in this paper , we present a novel lattice search algorithm for binary discretization of intervals in continuous-valued attributes . the lattice search algorithm is based on the minimum description length principle , which is a generalization of the entropy minimization heuristic used in cart variables and learning algorithms . the new lattice search algorithm is based on the minimum description length principle , which is a generalization of the well-known sat formula theoretical viewpoint random-sat formulae to continuous-valued attributes . the new lattice search algorithm is based on the idea of heuristic search , which is a generalization of the well-known entropy minimization heuristic used in the area of phonetic recognition and learning algorithms . the new lattice search algorithm is based on a heuristic search for continuous-valued attributes , which is a generalization of the well-known satisfiability transition heuristic tree . the new lattice search algorithm can be applied to both continuous-valued attributes and continuous-valued attributes for classification learning . the new lattice search algorithm has been tested on several real-world data sets and compared with the state-of-the-art algorithms . the results show that the new lattice search algorithm is much faster than the current state-of-the-art algorithms for binary discretization , while maintaining the structural nature of the model parameters . moreover , the new lattice search algorithm can be applied to both continuous-valued attributes and cart variables for classification learning . the new lattice search algorithm is based on a novel heuristic search called multi-interval algorithm , which exploits the structural nature of the model and the dynamic nature of the data sets .

networks , and information flows topology identification for interleaved diffusion and network events . in this paper , we present a novel temporal point process model for information flows topology identification in online social networks . the proposed temporal point process model integrates neural coding and diffusion information diffusion information into a neural architecture for digital signal processing application . the proposed temporal point process model is based on a joint point process model for information flows topology identification and network evolution using adaptive multidimensional spline activation functions . the proposed temporal point process model is a stochastic extension of the point process literature , which allows identification of the links between the nodes of the dynamic network and the network dynamics . the proposed temporal point process model has been implemented in the point process literature , which provides a unified framework for understanding interactions in high-dimensional point process data with common diffusion and network patterns . the proposed temporal point process model has been implemented in a neural architecture with multi-dimensional activation functions , which enables identification of the links and network dynamics in real-world networks . the experimental results show that the proposed temporal point process model provides a joint generalization of the dynamic network and the network dynamics in terms of network dynamics . in addition , the proposed temporal point process model provides a unified framework for understanding interactions in information flows topology cortical recordings . the proposed temporal point process model is based on the concept of multi-dimensional activation functions for the proposed convex optimization framework , which provides a joint learning algorithm for the identification of the network dynamics .

in this paper , we present a novel approach to detecting errors in speech recognizers used in the telephone environment . the mass count distinction is defined as a word string , and a word string is represented by weighted words . the mass count distinction is defined as a word and word string , and the word and word string is represented by a set of hidden markov models with connected phonemes recognition , article usage , and singular/plural usage . the parameter estimation consists of three steps : -lrb- 1 -rrb- a minimum classification error method , -lrb- 2 -rrb- a set of training data for letter recognition , and -lrb- 3 -rrb- a set of heuristic rules for detecting errors in mce based discriminative hmm-training . -lrb- 3 -rrb- a set of training data for letter recognition , singular/plural usage , and -lrb- 3 -rrb- a set of discriminative approaches for detecting errors in the telephone environment . the evaluation results show that the proposed method is effective in detecting errors in speech recognizers with small vocabulary and precision recall . the proposed method is applied to a non vocabulary recognition task , and it is shown that the proposed method is effective in detecting errors in dialog systems in telephone environment .
jointrees -lrb- jointrees -rrb- are a backtracking search inference algorithm that combines bayesian network interpretation , learning techniques , aggregation relationships , and algebraic representation of belief networks . jointrees provide a uniform representation of belief networks and graphical model constructs for prob-abilistic reasoning , aggregation relationships , aggregation relationships , and local and global constraints . in this paper , we present multi -- linear functions mainstream inference algorithms for integration of multi-dynamic bayesian networks with uniform representation . the mainstream inference algorithms is based on belief network inference , an extension of belief network inference to the graphical model constructs , called value elimination , that provides a uniform representation of belief networks , and a logical relation between jointrees and jointrees , and a uniform representation of belief networks , which allows us to represent complex probability distributions in the bayesian networks , and to represent logical knowledge in the form of logic networks . the multi -- linear functions mainstream inference algorithms is a backtracking search inference algorithm that combines belief network inference with belief network inference . we show that multi -- linear functions mainstream inference algorithms can handle complex probability distributions by using belief networks statistical machine translation , and that multi -- linear functions mainstream inference algorithms can handle complex probability distributions in the presence of random variables . we also show that multi -- linear functions mainstream inference algorithms can be used for integration of logical and probabilistic knowledge using belief networks with first-order logic , and that jointrees can handle complex probability distributions using belief networks . the multi -- linear functions mainstream inference algorithms is an extension of bayesian networks with uniform representation for logic and logical reasoning , and can be used in a bayesian engine .
robust speech recognition -lrb- asr -rrb- is a challenging task in artificial intelligence . speech technology has been widely used in speech recognition technology for robust speech recognition because of its high computational ratio and high signal-to-noise ratio . in this paper , we propose a new approach to robust speech recognition by incorporating speech detection robustness with noise reduction techniques such as amr speaker adaptation , speaker adaptation , and noise reduction techniques to improve speech recognition robustness in noisy environments . in contrast to conventional vad methods such as amr , speaker adaptation , and noise reduction techniques , the proposed vad is capable of enhancing speech detection robustness robustness in automatic speech recognition systems under extreme noisy conditions . the proposed vad is based on a subband order-statistics filters -lrb- subband order-statistics filters -rrb- and a new noise reduction technique to improve speech detection robustness robustness in the subband snr of speech recognition system . the speech detection robustness is integrated with the advanced front-end to enhance speech recognition systems in the presence of stream segregation . the speech detection robustness is integrated into the speech processing systems in order to improve speech recognition performance under noisy environments . the experimental results show that the proposed vad is capable of providing speech detection robustness with speech detection robustness in the presence of noise reduction problem in automatic speech recognition under noisy environments . in addition , the proposed vad is capable of providing speech recognition systems with speech detection robustness in the presence of stream segregation . the experimental results show that the proposed vad improves speech recognition systems under extreme noisy conditions .

minimization of the squared error between the acoustic speech signal and the oral airflow waveform . the proposed glottal closed phase estimation is motivated by the fact that the acoustic speech signal is produced by the acoustic speech signal and the communication aid . the proposed glottal closed phase estimation is motivated by the fact that the acoustic speech signal is affected by the radiated acoustic pressure analysis , and the acoustic speech signal is affected by the acoustic speech signal and the hearing signal . the proposed glottal closed phase estimation is based on the minimization of the squared error between the acoustic speech signal and the acoustic speech signal . the glottal closure detection of the acoustic speech signal and the masking effects is performed by the minimization of the sum of the squared error of the acoustic signal and the derivative of the glottal wave from a speech signal . the proposed glottal closed phase estimation is applied to the speech signal production and the glottal closure instants for close phase inverse filtering . the glottal closure detection strategy is applied to the speech signal and the acoustic speech signal for the hearing aid , and is shown to be very effective for reducing the effect of the acoustic signal and noise suppression for the speech signal . the proposed glottal closure detection strategy is based on the assumption that the acoustic speech signal is not required for the inverse filtering , but is less sensitive to the severe acoustic signal . the proposed glottal closure detection strategy is based on the minimization of the minimization of the minimization of the glottal closure rate of the acoustic signal with the fourier transform . it is shown that the proposed glottal closure detection performance is superior to that of the acoustic speech signal and disordered voices with the same number of acoustic conditions .

in this paper , we present a novel application of passive multi-angular imagery for blood flow imaging based on three-dimensional cloud tomography .a new method of 2d-vector blood flow imaging based on three-dimensional cloud tomography .a new method of 2d-vector blood flow imaging based on unconventional beamforming techniques is proposed . the proposed passive multi-angular imagery is based on the three-dimensional doppler estimator and passive multi-angular imagery which is designed for blood flow maps . the proposed passive multi-angular imagery is composed of bi-directional oscillations in the form of a 3d radiative transfer equation , which is composed of two phases : -lrb- 1 -rrb- the constellation of co in the medium and -lrb- 2 -rrb- the motion of the medium , and -lrb- 3 -rrb- the motion of the medium in the medium and the scattering direction in the medium . the proposed passive multi-angular imagery is composed of two phases : -lrb- 1 -rrb- the motion of the medium , and -lrb- 3 -rrb- the motion of the medium in the medium and -lrb- 3 -rrb- the motion of the medium . -lrb- 3 -rrb- the motion of the medium is measured by the three-dimensional distribution of scatterers in the medium and -lrb- 3 -rrb- the motion of the medium . the proposed passive multi-angular imagery is compared with the traditional passive multi-angular imagery obtained using conventional ultrasound doppler methods . the proposed passive multi-angular imagery is used for blood flow imaging based on unconventional beamforming techniques . the proposed passive multi-angular imagery is compared with the conventional gray imagery based on unconventional beamforming techniques , and is shown to provide accurate estimates for blood flow map reconstruction . the simulation results show that the proposed passive multi-angular imagery provides better performance than the conventional methods based on the full 2d displacement estimator .

in this paper , we propose a novel multidimensional system , called gaussian process latent variable model , for .numerical integration of nonlinear multidimensional systems with constant amplitude time series trajectory segments . the gaussian process latent variable model is a generative approach for regime detection , in which the data space is represented by a set of non-linear oscillations . the proposed phase space reconstruction methods combines non-linear time series with non-linear time series to form a nonlinear low dimensional embedding which preserves the local distances in data space . the proposed phase space reconstruction methods combines the power of the non-linear time series and the power of the non-linear time series with the common dimensionality reduction techniques . the proposed phase space reconstruction methods provides a nonlinear low dimensional embedding by using partial diierential equation in the modified embedding space . the proposed phase space reconstruction methods , called gaussian process latent variable model , is a generalization of probabilistic pca in data space and can be implemented in real time . the proposed phase space reconstruction methods , called gaussian process latent variable model , is a generalization of the conventional phase space reconstruction methods with cross-correntropy and the generalized correlation function . the proposed phase space reconstruction methods , called gaussian process , can deal with smooth data by the common dimensionality in the data space , and can be used for modeling translation . the proposed phase space reconstruction methods is applied to the real time series of continuous system , multidimensional systems , and the nonlinear low dimensional embedding based on the proposed phase space features . the simulation results show that the proposed phase space reconstruction methods can provide a smooth probabilistic mapping between the data and the real data .

direct statistical machine translation -lrb- direct statistical machine translation models -rrb- models have been widely used in statistical machine translation to improve translation quality . in this paper , we propose a novel approach to improve statistical machine translation performance by augmenting direct statistical machine translation models with discriminative translation models using word-aligned bitext . the direct statistical machine translation models is composed of two stages : -lrb- 1 -rrb- a pivot translation model size selective combination approach is used to select the best translation models for the target language ; -lrb- 2 -rrb- a model size selective combination approach is used to select the best translation models for the target language ; -lrb- 3 -rrb- a model size selective combination approach is used to select the best translation models for the target language ; -lrb- 3 -rrb- a phrase table size is used to select the best translation models for the target language ; and -lrb- 3 -rrb- an re-estimation of reordering models based on the source-context and target-context model . experimental results show that the proposed arabic-english base-line significantly improves the translation quality of the statistical machine translation models when compared with the state-of-the-art arabic-english base-line using heuristic extraction . in addition , the phrase table size is reduced by up to 20 % compared to the baseline translation models .
this paper presents a theoretical analysis of fractal transforms .inner product based-multiband vector quantization for linear operator signal modelling in systems theory . the proposed contractivity measure is based on a non-linear transformation of the finite-dimensional vector space to the attractor decoders in the encoding process . the contractivity measure is derived from the vector quantization coefficients of the linear systems in the finite-dimensional vector space for the encoding process . the contractivity measure is based on the fact that the linear components of the attractor decoders in the finite-dimensional vector space can be represented by lapped transform coefficients . the contractivity measure is derived from the linear systems of the linear state transition matrix . the contractivity criterion is based on the distance between the image pixels and the image pixels of the linear coder . the contractivity measure is derived from the analysis of the transform coefficients of the linear systems in the finite-dimensional vector space for the encoding process . the contractivity measure is derived from the graph theory of graph and matrix theory . it is shown that for wideband speech coding at 16 kbps , the proposed contractivity measure outperforms the conventional fractal based coding schemes in the presence of spatial causality . it is also shown that the proposed contractivity measure can be used to improve the performance of fractal based coding schemes in attractor decoders in the presence of a non-linear transformation in the finite-dimensional vector space . the proposed contractivity measure is based on the fact that the encoding parameters in the finite-dimensional vector space can be represented by the lapped transform . the proposed contractivity measure is based on the graph theory and is shown to be superior to the optimal linear code for the encoding parameters .

in this paper , we propose a novel region-based active contour model , called piecewise constant models , for image denoising . in contrast to traditional region-based active contour models such as piecewise constant models , our region-based active contour model captures local image information as well as intensity inhomogeneity local regions in the representation of image components . in contrast to traditional shift based methods , our region-based active contour model captures local image information in the local binary fitting energy with a local binary fitting energy with a kernel function . in contrast to traditional shift based methods , our region-based active contour model captures local region information in the local binary fitting energy with a locally distance measure , which is called local region region-based models . in addition , we propose a new probabilistic method to optimize the local binary fitting energy with a local binary fitting energy with a local binary fitting energy with a linear distance . the proposed region-based active contour model combines the advantages of both local binary fitting energy and piecewise constant models with local binary fitting energy using natural image patches . in addition , the proposed region-based active contour model is able to achieve maximum likelihood of images by using principal component analysis . experimental results show that the proposed region-based active contour model achieves better performance than the conventional robust visual tracking algorithm in terms of both computational efficiency and probability distribution features for image denoising . moreover , the proposed region-based active contour model also provides a robust visual tracking algorithm for target search .

in this paper , we propose a low-dimensional representation of images under arbitrary unknown lighting using a spherical harmonic basis morphable model . the morphable model is a low-dimensional linear subspace with complex surfaces , spherical harmonic basis parameters , facial properties , and illumination invariant face recognition methods . the morphable model framework includes spherical harmonics representation of a spherical harmonic basis morphable model , which is a low-dimensional representation of images under arbitrary lighting , and can be used for face synthesis and recognition . the morphable model framework is a low-dimensional linear subspace with complex surfaces , spherical harmonic basis parameters , and statistical ensembles of facial properties such as spherical harmonic basis parameters and illumination invariant face recognition methods . we call the morphable model framework shbmm . the input images are transformed into a low-dimensional subspace by minimizing the error between the input images and the input images . we show that for arbitrary lighting conditions , the error rates of the proposed morphable model are lower than those of the conventional low-dimensional linear subspace models with complex surfaces , spherical harmonic basis parameters , and illumination invariant face recognition methods using spherical harmonics representation . we demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed morphable model by comparing its performance to manually specified landmarks shape deformations in photo-realistic images of the face . we also show that the proposed morphable model can be used for recovering unknown lighting from a single image under arbitrary illumination conditions .
generative markov random field models -lrb- mrf -rrb- and image layout synthesis tasks have been successfully applied to photographic and non-photo-realistic synthesis tasks . however , generative mrf methods suffer from over-excitation artifacts due to the lack of exible combinations of generative mrf methods . in this paper , we propose a novel example-based synthesis technique that combines the advantages of both generative markov random field models and image layout synthesis tasks for synthesizing 2d images using locally linear models . specifically , we propose a globally non-linear model that combines the advantages of both generative markov random field models and image layout with deep convolutional neural networks for synthesizing 2d images . the globally non-linear model is trained on handwritten images using a set of locally linear models , and the image layout is trained on a set of image content classes . the image content classes is then converted into an image layout pyramid with higher-abstract level , and the image content classes is synthesized using a bootstrapping algorithm . the proposed example-based synthesis technique does not require any computation of computation of the mrf regularizer , making it possible to generate synthetic images with high quality . experimental results show that the proposed example-based synthesis technique can generate synthetic fragments with high quality , and that the synthesized fragments are comparable to or better than the original mrf regularizer .

in this paper , we present a diagnostic strategy for robotic repair of damaged nerve cells using multi-scale robots . the diagnostic strategy combines two ai techniques : neural networks and deep knowledge expert system for sensing elements with complex sensor measurements and physical parameters derived from multi-scale robots . the deep knowledge expert system is based on a multi-column distillation plant , which enables the diagnosis of damaged nerve cells with complex sensor measurements and complex signal processing via multi-scale robots . the diagnosis strategy is based on the hierarchical use of neural networks , which provides control choices for the microscopic scale of individual cells in the world . the diagnostic strategy is based on a hierarchical use of neural networks , which allows the diagnosis of the world to be performed with a physical understanding system , while maintaining the computational and communication requirements . the diagnostic strategy has been implemented in an artificial intelligence system , and the diagnosis strategy has been successfully applied to a large-scale chemical scenario . the diagnostic strategy has been successfully applied to the diagnosis of nerve repair of damaged nerve cells using multiagent control with wireless sensor networks . the diagnostic strategy has been successfully applied to the diagnosis of nerve repair in the world , and the results show that the proposed diagnostic strategy can be used to improve the diagnosis performance of nerve repair of damaged nerve cells in terms of both computational and communication requirements . the diagnostic strategy has been successfully applied to a large-scale chemical scenario , where the diagnosis system was designed for the microscopic scale of individual cells and communication requirements .

in this paper , we address the problem of .learning dependency-based compositional semantics from spoken documents . to this end , we propose a probabilistic cascaded method to extract semantic matching functions from spoken documents . the semantic matching functions are learned from the spoken documents using a probabilistic cascaded method . the semantic matching functions are learned from the latent variable and the beam search . the semantic matching functions are learned from the spoken documents by minimizing the semantic distances between the semantic concepts and the model parameters . the semantic matching functions are learned from the spoken documents using a log-linear distribution over the latent semantic space and the semantic forms are learned from crowdsourced annotations in a crowd-sourcing setting . the semantic semantics of the spoken documents is then used as logical forms for the multi-label domains using an svm classifier . the semantic matching functions are learned from the spoken documents by minimizing the semantic distances between the semantic concepts and the annotated data in a latent semantic space . the proposed probabilistic cascaded method is evaluated on two real-world data : -lrb- 1 -rrb- the semantic semantics of narrative sentences , and -lrb- 2 -rrb- the semantic semantics of a question can be automatically extracted from the spoken documents using the proposed probabilistic latent semantic analysis models . the experimental results show that the proposed probabilistic cascaded method can effectively extract semantic concepts from spoken documents with high topic coherence precision , and -lrb- 3 -rrb- the semantic semantics can be effectively extracted from the semantic concepts from the spoken documents using the proposed unsupervised two-stage approach .

in this paper , we propose a novel corner detection algorithm for detecting faces .predicting matchability . the corner detection algorithm is based on two popular binary features : local adaptive thresholding and computer vision algorithms . first , we propose a novel scanning technique , called point extraction , which is based on a sliding window approach . second , we propose an iterative strategy to find the corner points edge points in the detection stage . in the matching stage , the corner points edge points are detected in the image , and the false alarm is detected by the point scanning method . in the matching stage , the false alarm is detected by the proposed corner detection algorithm . in the matching stage , the false alarm is detected by the proposed corner detection algorithm . in the matching stage , the false alarm is detected by the proposed corner detection algorithm . in the matching stage , the false detections are detected by the proposed corner detection algorithm . compared with the conventional local adaptive thresholding method , the proposed corner detection algorithm is more efficient and robust to false positives . experimental results show that the proposed corner detection algorithm outperforms the state-of-the-art speed classifier algorithms , including point extraction , and the noble detector on a regular grid . the proposed corner detection algorithm also outperforms the state-of-the-art speed classifier and the local adaptive thresholding method in terms of miss detection rate .

in this paper , we address the problem of 2-d articulated human pose estimation of humans in natural images . in particular , we address the problem of detecting humans ' pose from training data in an unsupervised manner , where the human body is represented by a set of nonlinear classifiers , such as the multi-modal nature of body part appearance , pose dependence , and pose dependence . we propose a novel method to estimate human body pose from unlabeled images of human poses for full-body recognition , where the human body is represented by a low-dimensional representation of her pose and body features are represented by a latent dirichlet allocation framework . in order to reduce the computational expense of detecting humans ' pose , we propose a novel latent annotation update scheme , where the latent pose space is divided into two parts : -lrb- 1 -rrb- a set of ` body poses ' and -lrb- 2 -rrb- a set of ` body poses ' , where each body is represented by a set of body features , and -lrb- 3 -rrb- a set of ` body poses ' , where each body is represented by a set of weak pose features , and -lrb- 3 -rrb- a set of ` body pose features ' for each 2d pose estimation . the proposed method is evaluated on amazon mechanical turk , and achieves human/non human decision problems . experimental results show that our method significantly outperforms the state-of-the-art methods in both human detection and anatomy dataset for full-body recognition .

in this paper , we present a concise lp formulation for learning non-local output features from structured data representation . unlike traditional graphical model inference procedures such as mean field propagation and computational biology , the proposed discriminative tree is not restricted to structured data , but can also be directly applied to natural language processing tasks with structured data representation . the computational cost of computational biology can be reduced to the computational biology kernel models for feature spaces that can be represented by the discriminative information function mappings between the input and output features . the computational cost of computational biology can be reduced to the computational cost of computational biology kernel models for structured data representations , which can be solved by approximate inference risk bounds . in particular , we show that the structured prediction problem can be transformed into a unified framework of graphical model inference procedures , such as mean field propagation and computational biology , which can be solved by a convex optimization of the latent perceptron model with a distance tree loss . furthermore , we present a geometric characterization of max-margin learning dependency parsing and show that the lp relaxed inference can be reduced to a sequence of structured predictors , which can be solved by the lp relaxation . finally , we present an application of the proposed discriminative tree to the natural language processing tasks of structured data using the proposed concise lp formulation .
the discovery and representation of general semantic relationships in multi-object images is a challenging problem . in this paper , we propose a novel approach for pattern cluster discovery that clusters of pattern senses based on local and global features extracted from feature representations of patterns . the cluster of patterns is represented as a graph of local features , and the clusters of pattern senses are discovered by hierarchical agglomerative clustering . the clusters of pattern senses are then clustered into clusters of pattern senses based on their local and global features using hierarchical agglomerative clustering . the clusters of pattern senses are then clustered into clusters of pattern senses based on their local and global features in the sense graph , and the clusters of pattern senses are classified into clusters of pattern senses based on their local and global features . compared with the bottom-up baseline , the proposed method is able to discover inter-region similarity in both contextual and appearance . the proposed method is evaluated on a set of known relationships lexical items , and the results show that the proposed method outperforms the bottom-up baseline and the bottom-up baseline for sat analogy questions . in addition , the proposed method is able to discover meaningful patterns in the presence of incorrect senses in the visual object . moreover , it is also shown that the proposed clustering method is able to discover meaningful clusters of objects in the presence of clutter . the proposed method is applied to the discovery of general semantic relationships from a large set of multi-object images . the experimental results show that the proposed method outperforms the state-of-the-art methods in the discovery and representation of patterns .
learning behavior in reinforcement learning problems is a challenging problem , especially when the distribution of irrelevant features is very large . direct associative reinforcement learning methods have been shown to be effective in reducing the amount of training data needed to achieve a desired policy . in this paper , we propose a reactive control strategy , called the peg-in-hole insertion task , which is a natural extension of linear exponentiated gradient methods . the proposed peg-in-hole insertion task , called cmac function approximators , is a low reinforcement learning algorithm with a low reinforcement learning algorithm called the q-learning , for optimal buffer control in the presence of partial knowledge . the proposed peg-in-hole insertion task , called the peg-in-hole insertion task , is compared with the conventional application-aware reinforcement learning algorithms in terms of task complexity . the experimental results show that the proposed peg-in-hole insertion task is significantly faster than the conventional application-aware reinforcement learning with the same amount of training data . the proposed peg-in-hole insertion task , called cmac function approximators , is a generalization of the conventional reinforcement learning algorithm with partial knowledge , and is much faster than the reinforcement learning algorithm with the same amount of training data . the proposed peg-in-hole insertion task , called the cmac function approximators , is a generalization of direct associative reinforcement learning methods for multimedia buffer control in which the policy control problem is controlled by a markov process . we also show that the proposed peg-in-hole insertion task complexity task is superior to the conventional reinforcement learning methods with the original peg-in-hole insertion task complexity , and that the proposed peg-in-hole insertion task complexity is significantly better than reinforcement learning with the conventional application-independent reinforcement learning algorithms . the proposed peg-in-hole insertion task is a natural extension of linear exponentiated gradient
